story:
Short Summary

We are a family seeking support to continue to send our transgender child to an inclusive, safe, and loving school, and to afford this opportunity to other trans families. The Center School in Greenfield, Massachusetts has rallied for our family and our daughter Avery from the moment we met.  As soon as we enrolled they took action: creating a supportive environment that actively addressed her needs and refused to compromise her integrity.  Avery's story inspired the school to change from gendered bathrooms to all-gender bathrooms and focus on gender-inclusivity in their socially responsible curriculum for students from preschool through 8th grade.  The administrators started a "Raising My Rainbow" book club to help educate parents and staff members about gender variance, brought the author of that book, Lori Duron, to the area to present her work, attracting over 200 people from the general public, and hired a highly reputable therapist who specializes in gender education to train the entire staff.  All of these efforts began within a month of Avery's enrollment without ANY pressure or even suggestion from Avery's parents. 

Due to changes in our family structure, we can no longer afford to send our daughter to her beloved school. Avery has blossomed at the Center School and needs your support to be able to continue her education at this progressive, social-justice school.  Although The Center School has established a new scholarship for Avery and families like hers (what we call trans*families), in its fledgling state, it can not yet offset Avery's tuition.  Please help us send Avery and two other children from trans*families to The Center School for the 2015-16 school year AND help us begin our new venture: to find more safe schools like The Center School (and train schools who hope to become "safe") for gender non-conforming children and their families.  

What We Need & What You Get

You are probably wondering if working towards one, two or three kids' education is the best way to spend your donation dollars. Maybe you think you should, instead, give to a larger organization, focused on policy change? That is certainly valuable. But, by giving to this campaign, you are making a radical difference in an actual kid's life. You are a hinge pin in this individual's development, safety and identify formation.  In those moments when you ask yourself "what have I done to make a difference in this unjust world?" you can remember that this girl got to continue feeling good in her skin, because of you. That's not only a great feeling, but it's authentic grass roots social change in real time, in real life. 

When you donate money to this fund, you will also receive a gift featuring artwork from the "The Transgender World", a book written by Avery or from the "We Like You Avery" book made by her kindergarten/first grade class on the day she came out to them, one year after joining this courageous community:

"I'm transgender!" Avery announced last fall after the class discussed a few books they had been reading on the subject.  "My parents thought I was a boy but I was a girl."  Avery walked around the class with photographs of herself as "Henry" and answered "questions and comments" from teachers and peers.  Afterwards, each member of the class responded with pictures and writing, which were quickly compiled into a book titled "We Like You Avery."  On that afternoon, Avery bounded out of her classroom, her hands full of evidence of love and affirmation, racing to hug me and say, "I told them Mama!  I told them I'm transgender!!!"  She was absolutely radiant - lighter, more free, more present than I had ever seen her before.  The Center School joined our family's mission: to gently support her re-birthing process by following her instinctual need to share her story.  At age 6 Avery could finally be known as her whole true self by her community at home and at school.  The Center School and our family are truly raising this child together.    

We set our campaign goal at $42,289.00.  This represents three tuitions to The Center School for one academic year.  We are working to raise enough money to send Avery and two other children from trans*families to The Center School as we believe this is the most supportive environment available to them.  

The Impact

By contributing to our campaign you will ensure that Avery and two other children under the age of ten are able to enjoy an elementary school experience free of bullying, teasing, and uncomfortable scrutiny.  Three children who know the true meaning of gender--- a spectrum that can only be determined and described by a person's own self ---will be able to enjoy a "rigorous education for deep thinkers and creative spirits" (http://centerschool.net) without the burden of constantly navigating and processing spoken and unspoken gender injustices throughout each and every school day.

The Center School honors and respects the true self of every human that walks through its doors.  By donating to this fund, you will be opening those doors for three young children who have found a way to articulate their true gender identities.  You will be allowing more of this important work to happen for more families at more schools as we bring our message and success out into the the wider world.

Risks & Challenges

The Center School has recently established a scholarship to support gender non-conforming children.  We are thrilled that Avery's school has taken this extra step to demonstrate their commitment to an inclusive and welcoming environment.  However, it is a new scholarship and not yet established enough to enroll Avery in the second grade, her third year at The Center School.  Avery's parents cannot continue to send her to her beloved school - if we do not reach our goal she will enroll in her local public school and leave her friends and teachers that love her so.  Avery will have to navigate gender-restricted bathrooms and come out all over again, a process that took her more than a year to accomplish at The Center School. 

At other schools, attended by other trans* and gender non-conforming children we know (and after two years we know many!), the responses from administrators look and sound radically different.  "But we have already planned our professional development days for this year - maybe next year we can try to address gender as a topic."  Or "We feel that the nurse and the classroom teacher are the only ones who need to know (about this child's gender identity) - let's keep it simple."  At The Center School, Avery's identity is not seen as a burden.  The teachers and administrators see Avery and her story as a gift, just as our family does.  Avery provides an opportunity for a whole school community to become more tolerant, more loving, more aware of the human experience.  Shouldn't all schools see each child this way? 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign widely with your friends, family, and colleagues.  This effort is just the beginning of a growing network of people who believe that every child should feel safe and comfortable in their own skin and in their own school.   Please contact us if you would like to continue hearing about the work we are doing as we develop our new organization - Gender Justice School Fund - connecting trans*families with safe schools and training schools that hope to become "safe".  Thank you for caring about this important work.  We are making great changes for present and future generations!

story:
Let's really help Greece, instead of pretending

The "Greek Bailout Fund" campaign was a noble failure. 

If you're reading this, you probably want to help the Greek people stand up to the needless, ideologically-driven austerity that will make it impossible to rebuild their economy.

The "Greek Bailout Fund" could have done just that, but for a couple of fatal flaws which rendered it useless, despite all the good intentions.

A simple mistake in setting up the campaign ensured that the Greek people wouldn't get anything unless it raised the full 1.6 billion Euros. That's over a hundred times bigger than the most successful crowdfunding campaign ever.

And even if it had met its target, its founder admits he had no idea how to get the money to the Greek people. Look:

He committed to an impractical scheme involving shipping fresh salads from Greece to donors all around the world. There would have been no way to do that without spending a lot of the money outside Greece.

The campaign was well-meaning, but over-ambitious and badly thought out. But now we have a second chance.


We can get it right this time

The other bailout campaign was set up as a Fixed Funding campaign. That means that if it didn't raise 100% of its target - 1.6 billion Euros - Greece would get nothing.

At this point, it's looking like the campaign will fail after raising about 2 million Euros. That figure seems impressive, and it's a testament to the generosity of the European public. 

But it's only just over one-thousandth of the hugely ambitious target.

When the campaign fails, all the generous donations will be refunded. The middlemen will take their cut, but Greeks will get nothing. It's a huge shame, and all because somebody ticked the wrong box.

Our campaign is using Flexible Funding - so any money you pledge will actually be collected.


It's a bailout, not takeout

This campaign is about helping the people of Greece - not getting yourself an order of stuffed vine leaves. The old campaign pledged to waste money delivering completely impractical perks. If you want to support the Greek economy by buying Greek produce, you can do that at your local supermarket. 

We're not going to waste any money on international salad delivery. We know you don't have to be bribed to help other people with the promise of a bottle of ouzo. We're just going to use your money to help Greece by repaying its public debt.


The Bank of Greece solidarity account

Remember, the problem with the other campaign is that it had no realistic way to get the money to Greece. We've done our research, and we've found the best way to help.

Pursuant to the Bank of Greece Governor’s Act 271/4.3.2010, the Bank of Greece has a solidarity account for public debt repayment. 

Any money you donate will be paid into that account (minus any costs and fees incurred, which we'll keep to a minimum).

By decreasing the Greek public debt, we'll decrease the leverage of the ideologues who are pushing for further destructive austerity.


Don't let them win

If you're reading this, there's a good chance that you donated money to the other bailout. Perhaps you feel angry that the money you pledged didn't actually end up doing any practical good. Or maybe you're just baffled. Or maybe, like us, you spotted the fatal flaws before you donated, and you're sad about the time and energy that the other campaign wasted.
The right-wing forces behind the suffering of the Greek people will use the failure of the other campaign to pretend that there's no alternative. They'll say that, just because one over-ambitious campaign failed, it means the people of Europe want to see Greece broken. They'll use their media platforms in the right-wing press to argue that there's no alternative to years more unsustainable debt, and paint us as impractical dreamers.
Let's prove them wrong. Whatever money you donated to the first bailout attempt will soon be refunded to you. If you pledge the same amount here and now, we can keep the momentum going, top the original figure and build from there. 
If you didn't give to the first campaign, now is your time to help. 

The future is in our hands

After the brave, defiant No vote, the coming days will be vital for Greece. We must show that we care and that there is a practical alternative to austerity. It's our second chance to help. It may be our last chance.

story:
Our Co-operative Responsibility:

Come let's work together for the progressive future of these rural school pupils in Ghana. It is  joy to be part of the bright future of these pupils we are working to serve.

Why we launched this Campaign:

70% of girls and boys in primary  schools in the north Gonja district of the northern region of Ghana in west Africa cannot read. Severe shortage of teaching and learning materials in schools have been cited as the cause. We launched this campaign in support of our foundation's Education Project dubbed "School is Fun" http://www.puretrustghana.org/education/ in response to an urgent call to mobilize educational resources to help overcome the challenge of chronic shortage of educational learning materials for pupils  in  the district. The goal of this project is to contribute in making School a safe, pleasant and productive place for pupils and teachers.

The Situation:

The month of September is the beginning of the school calendar for primary and Junior high schools in Ghana. It is a major turning point for every household- parents, children, community and school authorities.  For beginners, it marks My-First-Day at school and for continuing pupils a moment to progress on the educational ladder or remain where they are.  For Sakinatu and John, two primary school pupils in the Tarbiyat and DA primary schools respectively and their teachers in the North Gonja District of the northern region of Ghana, the challenge is whether there will be adequate supply of readers for effective teaching and learning in their school as it re-opens. Basic schools in  the district and other rural  areas of Ghana have been  grappling with the problem of  severe shortage of teaching and learning materials and poor infrastructure. Reading books for English, Environmental Studies, cultural studies, among others are in short supply in almost all schools in the district a fact confirmed by the district directorate of education.

In the North Gonja District, pupils sit in groups with one reading book per group in order to learn.   Read on the poor state of education in the district; http://www.ghananewsagency.org/education/about-70-of-bece-candidates-cannot-read-66818

Primary school pupils of DA primary school in a reading class

Read more on the pain of schooling in rural Ghana:  http://www.myjoyonline.com/opinion/2015/July-31st/enduring-the-pain-of-schooling-in-rural-ghana.php .

The Impact of our Collective Effort:

By supporting and contributing to this campaign you will be contributing to  a cause to improve teaching and learning outcomes in the target schools. Girls and boys  in primary schools will improve their reading skills. Beneficiary Schools will have play equipment. School attendance and retention will increase .


What We Need & What You Get

 We need a total of $8000 USD  to effect the change. The money will be spent as follows;

       ITEM                                                                    Qty per school      Amount
    1. Reading books                                                                 750                        $ 3,300
    2. Exercise books                                                                1,200                       $ 1,800
    3. Pens, pencils, crayons (boxes)                                     50                           $  700
    4. Drawing Books                                                                 350                         $  600
    5. School bags ( 40bags)                                                    20                          $  600    
    6. Play Equipment (see-saw, merry-go-round etc)     5                            $  1,000 

We have unique perks for you as you give us strength to give hope to the school pupils we target to serve. If we are not able  to meet our  funding target ,  we will spend whatever is available on purchasing and donating the reading books.

The Impact

This project will contribute to the delivery of quality education in the North Gonja District of Ghana. 615 primary school pupils in two selected primary schools in the target district will have access to adequate teaching and leaning materials and play equipment for extra-curricular activities to improve their learning outcomes. 

Access to quality education has been my passion all these years. Privately, i have managed student sponsorship funds provided by benevolent individuals from Canada who sponsored 12 girls to acquire  high school and University education.  Alhassan Rashida who was sponsored by Chantille Viaud  https://www.facebook.com/chantille.viaud?fref=tl_fr_box&pnref=lhc.friends from Canada,  now holds a University degree in Geography and Rural Development. Your contribution to this campaign will contribute to making girls and boys in deprived rural schools in the target district acquire quality education.

Other Ways You Can Help

Remember what Confucius said;

Donate to the campaign, spread the message around.

Even if you cannot contribute financially, you can help spread the word around.

  • Remember to invite friends, family members and colleagues to this campaign.
  • Use the indiegogo share tools on the left side bars of the story: facebook, twitter etc.
  • If you are in Ghana and cannot donate  online by Credit or Debit Card, you can still donate by Mobile money Transfer through your Mobile phone Networks;

                     1. MTN Mobile Money number   0243 712 077

                      2. Artel Money      number            0269 402 167

                      3. TigoCash           Number             0273 497 431

Your  mobile money donation  will be acknowledged on this platform.

And that's all there is to it.

Even if you cannot contribute financially, you can help spread the word around.  Remember to invite friends, family members and colleagues to this campaign. Use the indiegogo share tools on the left side bars of the story: facebook, twitter etc.

If you are in Ghana and cannot donate  online by Credit or Debit Card, you can still donate by Mobile money Transfer through your Mobile phone Networks;

story:
*A magyar leírásért görgess le*

Recent changes in Hungarian public education have been passed without any substantial social consultation or dialogue.

For example, teachers can’t choose textbooks of their own preferences, it is set in advance. In our view, this puts the teachers to teach from books they don’t even know and therefore it greatly inhibits their ability to give a qualitative work on pupils. Also, children in elementary school have to stay indoors until late afternoon even in the age of seven and they get also a lot of homework to do. These children are deprived of time which they could spend on useful activities or relaxation that they would definitely need. It also takes away the opportunity to try to organise a day for themselves, which would be part of the natural process of growing up.

These reforms affect us directly. This stage of our life is the key to be adults who can stand up for their own rights.

We want to gain control over our own lives.
Nothing about us shall be decided without us!

In our opinion, the aim of the current educational system is not to develop our mind or widen our knowledge and thinking of the world, instead it tries to restrict teachers and children to create obedient people for the next generation who can’t stand up for themselves and agree with everything that people in authority indicate.
Moreover, the present educational system widens the gap between different social groups instead of creating equal opportunities for children with different backgrounds.

The socially and culturally handicapped children are not supported, some of them can’t even spend a day in school: they are absolutely demotivated there without any support, and their parents need help at home or to make money for food. The lack of - qualitative - education puts them into the very bottom rung in the labour market and is the cause of the high level of unemployment. 

We think that the current situation affects our entire life and can ruin our future. We realized the necessity of acting for ourselves. First of all, we have to give an opportunity for teenagers to be aware of their rights, to get to know more about democracy and fight for themselves.

We would like to form a self-organized group of students, who can think critically and put pressure on the decision-makers. 

The Independent Student Parliament of Hungary is a student-organized public forum operated by democratic rules. We want to demonstrate that we do indeed have our own opinions and we can deliver our ideas and recommendations in a constructive manner.

We - the organisers - were pioneers in developing the whole system of a student parliament. We do believe that step by step we can help our nation to become a truly democratic one.

We organise online parliamentary elections every year, students can vote for their chosen representatives from all over the country. Their delegates vote online as well as during the plenary sessions in different topics.

We have already organized one session of the Independent Student Parliament.

Driven by our experiences, we plan to expand the reach of our programme by lowcost though creative advertisement and the media and give thorough information to each school at the beginning of the 2015/16 schoolyear. Advertising is essential for delivering our news to as many students as possible. With more and more students engaged nation-wide we will have a better chance to achieve our goals.

We need your help in order to finance our costs. From the money donated by you we would like to subsidize students to travel to sessions from rural areas, advertise the campaign season and e-elections and organise other events for students, buy promotional items (now we have a flag, a roll-up, some stickers and badges) and set up a better e-election system: an attractive and modern website with an easy-to-use voting system allowing students to vote absolutely secretly after the authentication of their student status.

We would like to thank all of you who considered our project worth to finance and also those of you who just read the description, because we believe that if more and more people become aware of our situation we can manage to reach our goals finally: students, teachers, parents and experts will be involved in the decision-making and the educational system won’t contribute to social inequality and won’t undermine any student’s one and only chance to become educated people - with a livable future - who can support the community with his or her individual thoughts.

Our estimated annual minimum costs:

1. Travel costs: 1400$
2. Advertisements: 700$
3. Technical cost of events during the year: 200$
4. Visual elements with our logo (hundreds of badges, thousands of stickers, T-shirts): 350$
5. Food costs for plenary sessions: 700$
6. Elections campaign: 700$
7. Higher education admission information day: 350$
8. By-elections campaing: 180$
9. Plastic cards for MPs: 140$.

***

A közelmúltban hozott átalakítások az oktatásban valódi konzultáció és párbeszéd hiányában kerültek bevezetésre.

Például a tanárok nem választhatják meg szabadon, hogy milyen tankönyvből tanítsanak, a választható 1-2 tankönyv központilag ki van jelölve. Szerintünk ez azt eredményezi, hogy a tanárok általuk nem is ismert könyvből tanítanak, ez pedig erősen akadályozza őket abban, hogy minőségi munkát végezzenek.

Az általános iskolás diákoknak késő délutánig bent kell maradniuk az iskolában - 7 évesen is -, emellett rengeteg házi feladatot is kapnak. Ezek elveszik a gyerekek szabadidejét, amelyet hasznosan eltölthetnének például pihenésre. De ez a szabályozás abban is korlátozza őket, hogy idővel maguk osszák be a saját idejüket, amely fontos része lenne a felnőtté válásnak.

Ezek az átalakítások közvetlenül érintenek bennünket, diákokat. Ez az életszakasz kulcsfontosságú abban, hogy tudatos és a saját jogaiért kiálló felnőttekké válhassunk.

Beleszólást szeretnénk a saját életünkbe. 
Semmilyen rólunk szóló kérdésben ne döntsenek nélkülünk!

Véleményünk szerint a jelenlegi oktatási rendszer célja nem az, hogy bővítse a tudásunkat a világról és fejlessze a gondolkodásunkat, hanem korlátozza a tanárokat és a diákokat, s ezáltal engedelmes embereket neveljen, akik nem képesek kiállni magukért, hanem egyetértenek mindennel, amit a felettük állók mondanak.

Továbbá a fennálló oktatási rendszer növeli a társadalmi különbségeket a különböző társadalmi csoportok között, ahelyett, hogy esélyegyenlőséget biztosítana a különböző családi- és anyagi háttérrel rendelkező gyerekeknek. A társadalmi és kulturális szempontból hátrányos helyzetű diákokat nem támogatja, közülük többen nem is tudják az iskolában tölteni idejüket, mivel az iskolában hamar demotiválttá válnak, szüleik pedig a segítségükre szorulnak a pénzkeresésében, hogy legyen miből enniük. A minőségi oktatás hiánya a munkaerőpiac legaljára kényszeríti őket, és egyben a magas szintű munkanélküliség egyik fő okozója.

Szerintünk a jelenlegi helyzet befolyásolja az egész életünket és tönkreteheti a jövőnket. Rájöttünk, hogy szükséges cselekednünk, és kiállnunk önmagunkért. Először is lehetőséget kell adnunk diáktársainknak, hogy tisztában legyenek jogaikkal, hogy többet tudjanak a demokráciáról és képesek legyenek cselekedni a közös érdekeikért.

Szeretnénk létrehozni egy önszerveződő diákcsoportot, amely tagjai képesek kritikusan gondolkodni és nyomást gyakorolni a döntéshozókra. A Független Diákparlament egy diákok által szervezett demokratikusan működő fórum. Meg akarjuk mutatni, hogy a minket érintő kérdésekben igenis van véleményünk, és képesek vagyunk konstruktív ötletekkel és megoldásokkal előállni.

Mi, a szervezők egyedülálló módon dolgoztuk ki a teljes rendszerét egy diákparlamentnek. Hiszünk abban, hogy lépésről lépésre haladva elérhetjük, hogy az országunk valóban demokratikusan működjön.

Minden évben internetes választásokat tartunk, amelyek során a középiskolás diákok szavazhatnak az általuk kiválasztott jelöltekre az ország minden régiójában. A megválasztott képviselők a plenáris üléseken személyesen, azok között pedig interneten keresztül szavazhatnak. (...)

Szükségünk van a segítségetekre, hogy finanszírozhassuk a Független Diákparlamentet. Az adományozott összegből fogjuk segíteni a vidéken élő diákok felutazását az ülésekre, meghirdetni a kampány-időszakot és az internetes választást, továbbá eseményeket szervezni a diákok számára és létrehozni egy még jobb elektronikus választási rendszert: egy vonzó, letisztult és modern felületet, amely lehetővé teszi, hogy a diákok titkosan szavazhassanak a nekik tetsző jelöltekre.

Már megszerveztük a Független Diákparlament első ciklusát. Szeretnénk még több emberhez eljutni olcsó, de kreatív hirdetések és a média segítségével, valamint tájékoztatni az iskolákat a 2015/2016. tanév elején. A hirdetés szükséges ahhoz, hogy eljuttassuk híreinket a lehető legtöbb diákhoz. Minél több diákot tudunk bevonni a folyamatba országszerte, annál nagyobb esélyünk van arra, hogy elérjük céljainkat.

Köszönjük Mindannyiotoknak, akik adományozásra méltónak találjátok a projektet, vagy csak végigolvastátok a leírást, mert hisszük, hogy ha egyre többen értesülnek a helyzetünkről, akkor képesek leszünk elérni céljainkat: így az oktatásban érintettek és a szakma be lesznek vonva a döntéshozatalba, és az oktatási rendszer nem fog hozzájárulni a társadalmi különbségekhez, nem fogja aláásni egyetlen diák egyedüli esélyét sem attól, hogy - élhető jövővel - tanult emberré váljon, aki képes támogatni a közösséget a saját gondolataival.

Éves minimális költségeink:

1. Utazási költségek: 400 ezer Ft
2. Hirdetések: 200 ezer Ft
3. Évközi rendezvények technikai költségei: 60 ezer Ft
4. Logóval ellátott vizuális elemek: pl. több száz kitűző, több ezer matrica, pólók: 100 ezer Ft
5. Plenáris ülések étel-költségei: 250 ezer Ft
6. Jelöltetési, választási kampány: 200 ezer Ft
7. Pályaválasztási nap kampány, helyszín, élelmiszer: 100 ezer Ft
8. Évközi választások kampánya: 50 ezer Ft
9. Képviselői plasztik igazolványok: 40 ezer Ft.

story:
The Problem 

As of August 2013, the Los Angeles Unified School District (LAUSD) decided to eliminate all third-party companies like Arithmetic Solutions from the process of providing much needed free tutoring services to over 38,000 students in the more impoverished areas of Los Angeles.  Even though "some" students still receive free tutoring on certain school campuses after school, a large number of students have no access to tutoring; in most cases, these are the students who exhibit the most need.  Arithmetic Solutions aims to provide a free and accessible tutoring option for these students that will not create a financial burden for their families.

Our Company

Founder Derrick Louis established Arithmetic Solutions in 2005, and in the Spring of 2006 Arithmetic Solutions was added to the list of Supplemental Education Service (SES) Providers for the State of California.  Currently, the company coordinates 30 Independent Contractors and maintains contracts with 5 school districts in and around Los Angeles County.  To date Arithmetic Solutions has provided over 1,500 students with math tutoring.  In doing so they have seen a 22% increase in scoring in 93% of their students.

Our Goal and Our Needs

In 2014 Arithmetic solutions, established an Online Tutoring Platform (OTP) that allows students to access high quality Mathematics Tutoring from the comforts of their own homes through the use of "real-time" audio & video.  We currently provide online services to privately paying customers and we would like to use this OTP to target 100 students in inner-city Los Angeles and give them free mathematics tutoring for an entire school year.  Our intent is to specifically select students who do not have the financial means to pay for services privately.  We will closely monitor and record their progress.   

We aim to provide 100 students with 70 mathematics tutoring sessions taking place two times per week from September 2015 through June 2016 for a total cost of $50,000.00. 

The Impact

Your contribution will aid in helping disadvantaged students receive free academic help that could realistically change the trajectory of their lives.  Many students located in areas such as South Central Los Angeles do not have access to personal transportation, a resource that many individuals take for granted.  For example, it is not guaranteed that all parents have a car to transport their child to a learning center for tutoring and far fewer have the $80.00 per hour to pay for services once they arrive.  Using the Online Tutoring Platform will eliminate one of the tutoring access hurdles by giving disadvantaged students the opportunity to receive help at their local school’s computer lab or at home by using a personal computer or laptop.  The other hurdle of cost can be eliminated through your investment in our vision.  Your support of our efforts will allow us to offer a student access to much needed academic intervention as well as help students make a successful transition to the NEW Common Core Standards.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help us by using you personal resources to let more people know about the numbers of students who no longer have access to the tutoring services that are so desperately needed.  Let other potential donors know that we are in Los Angeles on the grassroots level helping students reach their goals.  Our OTP for Mathematics & Science can be made available to everyone, we do not care where you live.  Please use the Indiegogo tools and share our initiative via social media.

though "some" students still receive free tutoring
on certain school campuses after school, a large number of students have no
access to tutoring; in most cases, these are the students who exhibit the most
need.  
Arithmetic Solutions
aims to provide a free and accessible
tutoring option for these students that will not create a financial burden for their families.
Our Company 
Founder
Derrick Louis established Arithmetic Solutions in 2005, and in the Spring of
2006 Arithmetic Solutions was added to the list of Supplemental Education
Service (SES) Providers for the State of California.  Currently, the company
coordinates 30 Independent Contractors and maintains contracts with 5 school
districts in and around Los Angeles County.  To date Arithmetic Solutions has
provided over 1,500 students with math tutoring.  In doing so they have seen a
22% increase in scoring in 93% of their students.
Our Goal and Our Needs
In 2014 Arithmetic solutions, established an Online Tutoring
Platform (OTP) that allows students to access high quality Mathematics Tutoring
from the comforts of their own homes through the use of "real-time"
audio & video.  We currently provide online services to privately
paying customers and we would like to use this OTP to target 100 students in
inner-city Los Angeles and give them free mathematics tutoring for an entire
school year.  Our intent is to specifically select students who do not
have the financial means to pay for services privately.  We will closely monitor and record their progress.   
We aim to provide 100 students with
70 mathematics tutoring sessions taking place two times per week from September
2015 through June 2016 for a total cost of $50,000.00. The Impact
Your contribution will aid in helping disadvantaged students
receive free academic help that could realistically change the trajectory of their
lives.  Many students located in areas such as South Central Los Angeles
do not have access to personal transportation, a resource that many individuals
take for granted.  For example, it is not
guaranteed that all parents have a car to transport their child to a learning
center for tutoring and far fewer have the $80.00 per hour to pay for services
once they arrive.  Using the Online Tutoring Platform will eliminate one
of the tutoring access hurdles by giving disadvantaged students the opportunity
to receive help at their local school’s computer lab or at home by using a
personal computer or laptop.  The other
hurdle of cost can be eliminated through your investment in our vision.  Your support of our efforts will allow us to offer a student access to much needed academic intervention as
well as help students make a successful transition to the NEW Common Core Standards. 
Other Ways You Can Help
You can help us by using you personal resources to let more people know
about the numbers of students who no longer have access to the tutoring
services that are so desperately needed.  Let other potential donors know
that we are in Los Angeles on the grassroots level helping students reach their
goals.  Our OTP for Mathematics & Science can be made
available to everyone, we do not care where you live.  Please use the Indiegogo
tools and share our initiative via social media.

story:
Inwood Academy for Leadership

Inwood Academy for Leadership empowers students in Inwood and Washington Heights to become agents for change through community-focused leadership, character development and college preparedness. 

Our population is drawn directly from the Washington Heights and Inwood community, where an average of 27% of children live below the federal poverty threshold.  We advocated successfully in offering preference to English Language Learners (ELL) within our lottery, establishing an average of 41% “high needs” students (those having ELL status, an IEP, or both).  We began our first school year in 2010 as a small group of eager teachers charged with the task of meeting the specific learning needs of our students.

Career Readiness

Many young people never get the opportunity to participate in education as a transformative experience.  The “path to college” represents a vision of success that many deserving students fail to achieve due to the difficult living conditions and familial problems associated with poverty.  In our community 13% of adults are unemployed and only 19% of adults 25 and older have a high school diploma or equivalent.  Living below the poverty line means that potential does not guarantee success. 

Although the “college prep” model may work for some of our students, we work with a diverse population of learners.  Many of our students are drawn to a more “hands-on” style of learning, where they can acquire the skills needed to promote career readiness.  As the economy continues to fluctuate, ALL our students need to be prepared for a job market that is highly competitive and where a college degree doesn’t necessarily guarantee employment. 

Research suggests that other schools across the country are beginning to recognize the need for Career and Technology Education (CTE) for high school students.  The manufacturing industry is growing at an exponential rate all across the country, contributing to an increasingly large market for skilled job opportunities.  Learning by “doing” has become a major force propelling the rise of business opportunities for entrepreneurs.  Studies done on the small subset of high school students that have access to vocational training indicate that a growing number of graduates move on to well-paid, highly skilled postsecondary careers. 

Fundraising Campaign

To meet the needs of students whom would most benefit from alternative pathways to graduation, it is imperative that we establish an official Career and Technical Education Program at Inwood.  Universally recognized and endorsed by the NYSED, CTE programs are meant to provide an additional level of individualized support in the educational program and to increase the number of options for students to achieve postsecondary success.

Inwood Academy currently offers an introductory woodworking course that takes place during the school day, along with a program for advanced students offered afterschool and on weekends.  If we raise the funding needed to expand our CTE workshop, IAL will be able to fully develop the CTE program as an alternative pathway to graduation with additional coursework and alignment to industry standards.  Due to budget constraints the school has been unable to provide funding for this program, leaving the instructor personally responsible for all the expenses.  Although we are fortunate enough to have dedicated classroom space, we cannot sustain our CTE program without additional funding.  A renovated workshop space will enable us to increase the number of CTE courses we offer our students.  Contributions made to the Urban Woodworking Project will be used to establish a facility with the resources, materials, and equipment that encourage creativity and facilitate deep learning. 

Proposed Course Offerings (2016-17)

If we are able to meet our fundraising goal of $20,000, the following elective courses offered through the Inwood CTE Program will be open to all students:

Introductory Woodworking

Students will learn the fundamentals of carpentry: safety, tool usage, joinery, and small-scale construction.

15 students per semester

Advanced Woodworking

Students will continue their exploration of carpentry by studying the principles of furniture design and building their own pieces. 

15 students per semester

Auto Mechanics and Metalworking

Students will learn the basics of auto body repair and the mechanics of the internal combustion engine as they work together to restore a 1963 VW Beetle.

10 students per year

Artisanal Craft

Students will independently pursue projects that integrate the principles of art and design with the added option of selling their crafts in an Etsy shop. 

15 students per semester

Inwood Guitar Co. 

Students enrolled in this course will participate in an experimental “business lab” where they will be fully immersed in the experience of running a small business.  Sessions will be conducted both in the workshop and the classroom as students learn how to manufacture, market, and sell their own product. 

10 students per year

Instructional Model

CTE courses will be conducted in a highly engaging learning environment with a marked emphasis on differentiation.  Collaboration among students occurs naturally as they pool their knowledge and work together to develop their projects.  Although many schools struggle to address the needs of "at-risk" students in urban communities, the dynamic learning environment in the workshop allows me to address the specific needs of my students on an individualized basis, thereby encouraging continuous refinement of the skills that are essential to postsecondary success.

With your support, the effectiveness of the Urban Woodworking Project will impact our students by providing access to a learning environment that encourages collaboration, creativity, and critical thinking.

story:
A group of occupational therapy students, professors, and clinicians traveled to Ecuador for an Occupational Science Community and Justice class. Nicole Arnhold OTR/L and a group of 6 students from Saint Catherine's University and Boston University spent 7 days at FINESEC, a foundation for people with varying abilities. FINESEC is a Montessori like program for people ranging in ages 6 to 56, providing opportunities for people to learn life skills to become more independent and successful in the community. The University students were able to learn about FINESEC's approach, culture differences and similarities and non verbal communication due to language barrier. In return Nicole and the students offered knowledge on sensory based techniques. The University students experienced raw resourcefulness by creating shakers out of used pop bottles and dried beans and used socks and rice to make bean bags. The teachers and professionals of FINESEC were educated on basic sensory processing, proprioception, vestibular input, and how to incorporate such strategies into daily routine to increase participation, focus, mood, and body awareness.
When the group traveled to Ecuador, they were uncertain of the supplies the particular foundations may be in need of, hence the resourcefulness once arrived. The group would like to send back a collection of supplies so that the foundation continues to thrive and offer sensory based techniques.
This group is looking to collect money for supplies such as; markers, stress balls, theraband, beans bags, table top easels, chewlry and funds to cover shipping costs.

story:
Surveillance. Civil liberties. Protests. Arrests. 

From the rise of the Occupy movement to the outrage over the National Security Agency’s data collection, these words have become familiar to anyone who scans news headlines.

But if you take  a step behind the scenes, a complex interplay of social power and ever-changing legal precedents are the real drivers behind who is allowed to march and who can be surveilled and how.

Scrappers Film Group, in collaboration with Truthout.org, presents a multi-part web series to turn the camera on the most pressing civil liberties issues of our day.  Rights Lab is a cross-genre web series that dissects the most pressing civil liberties questions of our day while bringing viewers straight into the action through on-screen experiments. 

By using real-life case studies, featuring local activists and offering clear and compelling explanations of ongoing legal debates, our series will illuminate the legal and social dynamics behind Stingray surveillance, when and how it is legal to film a police officer, the burgeoning debate behind consumer drone flight, what you legally can and can’t do on social media, and much more.

Your help will make this series possible by: 

  • Increasing our budget for essential motion graphics to clarify complex legal concepts
  • Legal guidance to make sure our activist actors do their experiments in the safest way possible
  • Contributing to the hours of shooting and editing that go into the creation of video series 

About us 

Scrappers Film Group is a documentary company based in Chicago. Some of our other projects include Scrappers, an award-winning feature-length doc about metal collectors; Central Standard, a web series produced in partnership with PBS Digital Studios following five students in Chicago through their transition to high school; and The Grid, a series on Gapers Block profiling local subcultures and landscapes. 
Truthout.org is an independent news site that aims to use in-depth investigative reporting and critical analysis to reveal system injustice and provide a platform for transformative ideas.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, we'd love for you to Facebook, Tweet or share our campaign. Every little bit helps.

story:
May I present myself...

Winter is coming , they say, and so is my PhD, starting this October. I managed to convince the University of Glasgow that George R.R. Martin's Revolution in Literature is more than just a Fantasy series. However, it is now, as I realised, that the hardest part is coming: Funding my research.

I am Matteo Barbagallo, 25 and I have just completed my MA in English and Comparative Literature at "La Sapienza" University of Rome. It could seem silly or simple to say, but books, comics, and creating stories have always been my passion. During my school years I volunteered in a library and this is where it all began. In fact, there were mountains, volcanoes of books to read and never enough time, but luckily I had the time to discover some stories that are really worth a life of study. In Italy though, scholarships are not easily obtained, especially not for merit. This unfair condition is one of the motivations why I am glad to be allowed to do my research in the UK.

... and now let's turn to the protagonist...

My research is based on the contemporary writer George R.R. Martin, in whose writing emerges clearly how he modifies our perception of reality. I will explore extensively how "his realism" differs from his biggest ancestor, J.R.R. Tolkien, and other fantastic novelists all along the centuries, and hopefully be able to demonstrate a new kind of Realism, invented by Martin, unique and powerful. Though Martin has an enormous fellowship and has been translated into more than 45 langauges, in this academic field his narration is still highly undervalued and this research would be the first worldwide, analysing the various levels of narration and realism. From my point of view it is a great lack of information that literature is missing out on and which could become a literary revolution for future generations.

Of course my goals go beyond. I am working towards an academic career, trying to become not only a Professor at University, but a good one: One capable of carrying people away with Literature.

Here is where I need your contribution:

Unfortunately I, as most of us, was not born heir to the Iron Throne, and I have no Petyr Littlefinger to misteriously obtain any funds I need, this is why I've decided to start this crowdfundng campaign, trying to find people who believe in my research as much as I and the University of Glasgow do.

I am not eligible for a full British Scholarship according to the ESRC residential criteria, which asks for at least 3 years of previous residence in the UK. The tuition fees for three years full time research are £ 12.156, and I have rounded up the sum to have a little more space for creativity. However all money goes uncut to tuition fees (and if I should be so lucky and exceed this amount it would go to housing and living expenses).

A win-win situation:

I feel particularly happy to be able to offer you a very special perk to thank you for your contribution. Every donor will be kept updated via email, cited in the PhD and never forgotten, but for every £ 35 donation, I will send you a personalized poem of mine.

By generously supporting my campaign with £ 100 or more, you are pre-ordering a paperback copy of my thesis, which will be finished by the end of 2018, and helping me to cover my research expenses.

Every contribution makes a difference to me! So even if you cannot help financially, please share this campaign with your family and friends! The more the merrier.

More information:

If you want to know more about my project or have any kind of question feel free to email me: barbagallomatteo@gmail.com

story:
(Español y portugués abajo)

PRESENTATION

Hello, my name is Janine and I am from Medellin, Colombia. I was one of the nine Colombians elected for a spot in the UWC schools, specifically the Atlantic College in Wales, so I feel very lucky, but I do not have a scholarship to fulfill this dream. Therefore, I turn to you, the great community, for support in this great adventure from which I am sure I will draw much benefit to finish my education as a person and as an academic, and dedicate everything achieved to society.

UWC

The United World Colleges (UWC) was founded in 1962 by Kurt Hahn, with the purpose of educating students from different countries and cultures of the world, so that they were the leaders of a peaceful and sustainable world.After half a century, the United World Colleges already have 15 schools, being the first to be founded Atlantic College in Wales. This school has the Atlantic Diploma which consists of two parts: the International Baccalaureate Diploma which covers the academic and the co-curricular program that focuses more on learning the key aspects of the peace of a sustainable future.As you might expect, this is a movement that has grown substantially since it began more than half a century.

What awaits me

Atlantic College is located in the castle of St. Donats

  There they have a large library

Also it is taught to be a Coast Guard


  In addition to the community service done, fulfilling the ideals of UWC.

Contributions

You can donate or simply spread the campaign through social networks. Any donation is helpful as well as sharing, or is not the ocean just a lot of droplets? Thank you for your attention!


PRESENTACIÓN

Hola, mi nombre es Janine y soy de Medellín, Colombia. Fui una de los 9 Colombianos elegidos para un cupo en los colegios de UWC, específicamente el Atlantic College en Gales, por lo cual me siento muy afortunada, sin embargo, no poseo una beca para cumplir este sueño. Por lo tanto, me dirijo a ustedes, la gran comunidad, para recibir apoyo en esta gran aventura de la cual estoy segura que sacaré mucho provecho para terminar mi formación tanto como persona como académica, y dedicar todo lo que logre a la sociedad.

UWC

Los Colegios del Mundo Unido (UWC) fueron fundados en 1962 por Kurt Hahn, con el propósito de educar a estudiantes de países y culturas diferentes del mundo, para que ellos fueran los líderes de un mundo en paz y sostenible. 

Después de medio siglo, los Colegios del Mundo Unido ya cuentan con 15 colegios, siendo el primero en ser fundado el Atlantic College en Gales. Este colegio cuenta con el Atlantic Diploma que consiste en dos partes: el Diploma de Bachillerato Internacional que cubre el ámbito académico, y el programa co-curricular que se enfoca más en el aprendizaje de los aspectos claves de la paz de un futuro sustentable.

Como es de esperarse, este es un movimiento que ha crecido sustancialmente desde que inició hace más de medio siglo. 

Lo que me espera

El Atlantic College está ubicado en el castillo de St. Donats


Allí cuentan con una gran biblioteca


También se enseña a ser guarda costas


Además del servicio comunitario que se presta cumpliendo los ideales de UWC.

CONTRIBUICIONES

Puedes donar o simplemente difundir la campaña por las redes sociales. Cualquier donación y difusión es de ayuda, o no es la playa nada más que un montón de granitos de arena? Gracias por su atención!


APRESENTAÇÃO

Oi, meu nome é Janine e sou de Medellin, Colômbia. Eu fui uma dos nove colombianos escolhidos para uma vaga em uma das escolas UWC, especificamente o Atlantic College, em Gales. Eu me sinto muito afortunada, mais não tenho a bolsa para cumprir meu sonho. Por isto venho a vocês, a grande comunidade, pedindo ajuda para essa grande aventura da qual tenho certeza terei muito benefício para terminar a minha educação como pessoa e acadêmica, e dedicar tudo o atingido à sociedade.


UWC

UWC são as siglas em inglês para Colégios do Mundo Unido (United World Colleges). UWC foi fundado em 1962 por Kurt Hahn, com o propósito de educar estudantes de diferentes países e culturas do mundo, de maneira que sejam líderes de um mundo pacífico y sustentável. Após meio século, os Colégios do Mundo Unido tem 15 escolas, sendo a primeira fundada o Atlantic College em Gales. Esta escola tem o Diploma Atlántico que consiste em duas partes: o Diploma Internacional de Segundo Grau que cobre o programa académico, e o co-curricular, se focando mais no aprendizado em aspectos chaves da paz em um futuro sustentável. Como vocês podem ver, este é um movimento que tem crescido substancialmente desde que começou faz mais de meio século.


O que me espera

Atlantic College está localizado no castelo de Saint Donats.


  Tem uma grande biblioteca.

 

Também se ensina a ser um guarda-vidas.


Além do mais, se faz serviço à comunidade, cumprindo com os ideais dos UWC.


Contribuições

Você pode doar ou simplesmente espalhar a campanha a través das redes sociais. Quaisquer doação ajuda, como também compartilhar, ou o oceano não é feito justamente de um monte de gotinhas?

Obrigada por sua atenção!

specifically the Atlantic College in Wales, so I feel very lucky, but I do not
have a scholarship to fulfill this dream. Therefore,
I turn to you, the great community, for support in this great adventure from
which I am sure I will draw much benefit to finish my education as a person and
as an academic, and dedicate everything achieved to society.UWCThe
United World Colleges (UWC) was founded in 1962 by Kurt Hahn, with the purpose
of educating students from different countries and cultures of the world, so that
they were the leaders of a peaceful and sustainable world.After
half a century, the United World Colleges already have 15 schools, being the
first to be founded Atlantic College in Wales. This
school has the Atlantic Diploma which consists of two parts: the International
Baccalaureate Diploma which covers the academic and the co-curricular program
that focuses more on learning the key aspects of the peace of a sustainable
future.As
you might expect, this is a movement that has grown substantially since it
began more than half a century.What awaits meAtlantic
College is located in the castle of St. Donats 
There
they have a large library
Also
it is taught to be a Coast Guard 
In
addition to the community service done, fulfilling the ideals of UWC.ContributionsYou
can donate or simply spread the campaign through social networks. Any
donation is helpful as well as sharing, or is not the ocean just a lot of
droplets? Thank you for your attention!
PRESENTACIÓN
Hola, mi nombre es Janine y soy de Medellín, Colombia. Fui una de los 9
Colombianos elegidos para un cupo en los colegios de UWC, específicamente el
Atlantic College en Gales, por lo cual me siento muy afortunada, sin embargo,
no poseo una beca para cumplir este sueño. Por lo tanto, me dirijo a ustedes,
la gran comunidad, para recibir apoyo en esta gran aventura de la cual estoy
segura que sacaré mucho provecho para terminar mi formación tanto como persona
como académica, y dedicar todo lo que logre a la sociedad.
UWC
Los
Colegios del Mundo Unido (UWC) fueron fundados en 1962 por Kurt Hahn, con el
propósito de educar a estudiantes de países y culturas diferentes del mundo,
para que ellos fueran los líderes de un mundo en paz y sostenible. 
Después de medio siglo, los Colegios del
Mundo Unido ya cuentan con 15 colegios, siendo el primero en ser fundado el
Atlantic College en Gales. Este colegio cuenta con el Atlantic Diploma que
consiste en dos partes: el Diploma de Bachillerato Internacional que cubre el
ámbito académico, y el programa co-curricular que se enfoca más en el
aprendizaje de los aspectos claves de la paz de un futuro sustentable. 
Como es de esperarse, este es un movimiento
que ha crecido sustancialmente desde que inició hace más de medio siglo. 
Lo que me
espera
El Atlantic College está ubicado en el
castillo de St. Donats

Allí cuentan con una gran biblioteca 

También se enseña a ser guarda costas 

Además del servicio comunitario que se presta cumpliendo los
ideales de UWC.
CONTRIBUICIONES
Puedes donar o simplemente difundir la campaña por las redes
sociales. Cualquier donación y difusión es de ayuda, o no es la playa nada más
que un montón de granitos de arena? Gracias por su atención!
APRESENTAÇÃOOi, meu nome é Janine e sou de Medellin, Colômbia. Eu fui uma dos nove colombianos escolhidos para uma vaga em uma das escolas UWC, especificamente o Atlantic College, em Gales. Eu me sinto muito afortunada, mais não tenho a bolsa para cumprir meu sonho. Por isto venho a vocês, a grande comunidade, pedindo ajuda para essa grande aventura da qual tenho certeza terei muito benefício para terminar a minha educação como pessoa e acadêmica, e dedicar tudo o atingido à sociedade. UWCUWC são as siglas em inglês para Colégios do Mundo Unido (United World Colleges). UWC foi fundado em 1962 por Kurt Hahn, com o propósito de educar estudantes de diferentes países e culturas do mundo, de maneira que sejam líderes de um mundo pacífico y sustentável. Após meio século, os Colégios do Mundo Unido tem 15 escolas, sendo a primeira fundada o Atlantic College em Gales. Esta escola tem o Diploma Atlántico que consiste em duas partes: o Diploma Internacional de Segundo Grau que cobre o programa académico, e o co-curricular, se focando mais no aprendizado em aspectos chaves da paz em um futuro sustentável. Como vocês podem ver, este é um movimento que tem crescido substancialmente desde que começou faz mais de meio século. O que me esperaAtlantic
College está localizado no castelo de Saint Donats.  
Tem uma grande biblioteca.  
Também se ensina a ser um guarda-vidas. Além do mais, se faz serviço
à comunidade, cumprindo com os ideais dos UWC. ContribuiçõesVocê pode doar ou simplesmente espalhar a campanha a través das redes sociais. Quaisquer doação ajuda, como também compartilhar, ou o oceano não é feito justamente de um monte de gotinhas?Obrigada por sua atenção!

story:
Our story

In 2006 we met Ms. Racquel E. Corpuz, former president the Philippine Federation of the Deaf.   Beeing Deaf herself, it was very important for Rack to create livelihood projects for people with hearing disabilities. Currently we are working on the possibility to enable Deaf farmers to be connected to a sustainable project, which is the cocoa growing. 

Cocoa beans from the Philippines have a great quality, and this can be developed further by training and qualification. Growing quality cocoa is a good opportunity for maintaining a sustainable life standard. 

Our goal is to implement a training center, where Deaf farmers can learn in FSL (Filippino Sign Language) the way, how to grow and what to do post harvest for  high quality cocoa. 

  • Creating the training material in Sign Language 
  • Setting up training facilities
  • Providing plants for "new farmers" additional to the training
  • Creating the fair trade sales channel for the cocoa beans

What We Need 


  • Part of the money raised will be spent on the technical assets needed for the learning material. Translations, small studio for creating training videos, providing learning material and tools for the first practical trainings .
  • The rest  will be spent on the cost of facilities  for the first 1 year and contributing to the set up of a Business Service Center.

The Impact

This innovative Farmer Business School delivers trainings in Filipino Sign Language and trains Deaf farmers. It provides training and agricultural know how for rural cocoa farmers exclusively in Sign Language. It will integrate a farm management approach, increasing profit from cocoa, and also the annual business planning. Business Service Centers (BSC) serves as a hub of services including credit and market information in Sign Language. 
The dual impact is on one side a long term and sustainable livelihood project for the Deaf,  AND a great quality cocoa supply for chocolate manufacturer as result. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute financially, you still can  help:

  • get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Share the information by using the Indiegogo tools

story:
Resumen

Saludos del comité organizador de la conferencia Luchas de Antes, Ahora, y...¿Siempre?Lxs ex-prisionerxs puertorriqueñxs y su legado en las generaciones nuevas, la cual se llevará a cabo en Mayagüez, Puerto Rico jueves, el 17 de septiembre de 2015 en el Anfiteatro Figueroa Chapel de la Universidad de Puerto Rico, Recinto Universitario de Mayagüez. 16 ex-prisionerxs representando tres generaciones distintas ya han confirmado su participación y, como muchxs eran criadxs y/o pasaron un tiempo significativo en los Estados Unidos antes de ser encarceladxs, la conferencia dará énfasis en las identidades puertorriqueñas desde la diáspora, las resistencias y las luchas. Asimismo, tiene el objetivo de familiarizar a lxs estudiantes universitarixs del presente con las distintas historias de lxs ex-prisionerxs políticxs, historias que repetidamente cruzan la distancia entre Puerto Rico y los Estados Unidos. Conjuntamente, la conferencia pretende exponer las diversas maneras en las cuales la juventud activista está contribuyendo dinámicamente a la justicia social en Puerto Rico hoy en día.  A la misma vez, la conferencia pretende instigar un diálogo entre todxs las generaciones presentes en el público.

Lo que necesitamos y lo que recibirán

  • Necesitamos recaudar aproximadamente $4000 para subvencionar los pasajes de cuatro ex-prisionerxs que actualmente viven en los Estados Unidos, para proveer hospedaje para varixs ex-prisionerxs que viven lejos de Mayagüez, para contratar catering para un almuerzo para todxs lxs ex-prisionerxs el día de la conferencia, y para una publicación impresa de mini-biografías de lxs ex-prisionerxs, la cual será distribuida entre el público gratuitamente.
  • Si no logramos recaudar todos los fondos necesarios, la públicación se hará en línea y proveeremos hospedaje para lxs ex-prisionerxs en casas de gente solidaria. Pagar los pasajes y el almuerzo son las prioridades.
  • Si recaudamos más de meta, los fondos que sobran serán utilizados para la campaña para la ex-carcelación de Oscar López Rivera. 
  • Para todxs lxs que contribuyen $100 o más, sus nombres serán incluídos en el programa para la conferencia y en una publicación sobre lxs ex-prisionerxs que se distribuirá el día del evento. Para lxs quienes no quieren ser identificadxs, aparecerán como “Anónimx”

El impacto

Nuestra conferencia será histórica en varios sentidos: será la primera vez que reune en un solo espacio un grupo tan grande de ex-prisionerxs puertorriqueñxs y jóvenes puertorriqueñxs para inciter conversación de luchas para la justicia social en el pasado y el presente, y en la cual habrá énfasis en conexiones con la diáspora puertorriqueña.

Entendemos que la mayoría de jóvenes puertorriqueñxs hoy en día, y muchas otras personas, no tienen conocimiento de lxs ex-prisionerxs puertorriqueñxs, las razones por su incarcelación, cuánto tiempo pasaron incarceladxs, su activismo en el presente para la justicia social en Puerto Rico y en comunidades puertorriqueñas de los Estados Unidos. Entendemos que la conferencia y la públicación serán sumamente importantes en ese sentido y por eso sus contribuciones son tan importantes para lograr nuestra meta, para proveer el público con una experiencia presencial con lxs ex-prisionerxs y distribuir literatura para divulger información imprenta sobre sus trayectorias.

Otras maneras de contribuir

1) Si prefieren hacer un donativo en efectivo o con cheque fuera de línea, comuníquense con las coordinadoras! Entendemos que no todo el mundo le gusta hacer donativos por este medio y otrxs sencillamente no tienen los recursos para poder hacerlo. 

2) La imagen que vean para la conferencia es una obra de arte original, “Somos Muchos” ©2015 (30X24 en medio mixto sobre lienzo) comisionada de la artista Yasmin Hernandez específicamente con el fin de recaudar fondos para este evento. Para más información sobre la obra, vean: http://www.yasminhernandez.com/somosmuchos.html

3) La obra original enmarcada está disponible para la venta, una reproducción enmarcada de la obra será rifada el día de la conferencia, y afiches de la imagen también están a la venta. Para más información, vean: https://www.facebook.com/luchasdeantesahoraysiempre

¡Agradecemos su apoyo solidario!

Damary, Raquela, Jannette, y Mary

story:
I am Jewel A. Tolbert, Founder and Executive Director of ART OF HEARTS™, a non- profit organization fostering art workshops for children in developing countries, utilizing visual arts education and its various mediums as a means of self- expression and communication. 

Last year February, I had the honor of teaching an art workshop at More Than Me Academy in Monrovia, Liberia, (Image above). The topic of lecture was Self- Love, and the girls were given the task of drawing and writing what they love most about themselves. The kids were so appreciative of the art supplies that I donated, as were the teachers! These supplies made for more of a personal display of their feelings, as they enjoyed the mediums they were using to communicate. The things we have often taken for granted were all the more special to them and in turn showed and helped them realize their own passions, purpose, confidence, and creativity. The twinkle in their eyes and bright smiles on their faces sparked a greater desire within me to launch the ART OF HEARTS initiative.

Please join me in keeping that fire and twinkle alive! Many children in developing countries endure unbelievable pain and burdens at such young ages; from pandemics, to becoming orphans, and are cheated of the chance to develop in a healthy environment and to envision a better future for themselves. I strongly believe in the therapeutic power of art and the outlet it provides! Your donations will make it possible to travel to Monrovia, Liberia and Accra, Ghana this Christmas season to teach art workshops and deliver art supplies to about 75- 100 students. These specialty lectures will include art education and the use of specific artistic mediums but most importantly encourage self-expression through it all.

As a former refugee, I strive to not let the history of my country define me but to help re-define my country and many developing countries around the world, through art. I can vividly recall the hardships that come with living in a developing nation. I lived in Liberia until the age of five and I was fortunate to be able to immigrate to the United States, where I was able to cultivate my talent in, and passion for the arts. Growing up in the U.S. made me acutely aware of the many privileges I was allowed, and the stark contrast between my realities and that of millions of less fortunate children around the world.

Together, let's help them express their hearts through art. We can help children who have been through tremendous difficulties find their voices in ways that they probably never thought were possible, and learn how the facets of an artistic perspective can be applied to many aspects in life. Furthermore, touching on integral topics that aid in our personal growth and advancement as human beings. 

I understand some may not be able to help monetarily but please still share this campaign with your network, as every little bit counts. 

FROM YOUR HEART TO THEIR ART!

ARE YOU IN?

THANK YOU!


Please be sure to follow the progress of the campaign at:

WEBSITE - www.artofhearts.org

& Subscribe to our newsletter

INSTAGRAM - @Artofheartsorg

CONTACT- Jewel@artofhearts.org for any further questions and inquiries

story:
The Mission:

We have an innovative plan to connect and create an arts audience in our rural area. Our mission is to take a depressed but beautiful upstate village and create an arts hub. Our village currently has no access to vibrant arts. By using accessible subject matter in fine arts applications, we intend to use the proposed non-profit gallery/supporting cafe as a revitalization tool. Our goal is to create a local desire for art and arts education. Opportunities to revitalize the town through the efforts of the non-profit are part of the goal.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need seed money to rehab a derelict building for our new non profit.
  • Perks include signed prints inspired by the area by internationally recognized local artists! A great way to collect name brand work at a deep discount.
  • All funds go to building purchase and rehab. We have A LOT of work to do.

The Goal:

  •  We want an arts presence be as regular to the locals as their farm chores. Milk a cow, then take a free 4x5 polaroid class at the Dance Hall. That's our idea.
  • Workshops would be absolutely free to anyone with proof of local residency.

The Takeaway:

  • Every resident of Medusa, Berne, Westerlo, Preston Hollow and Greenville, NY will be able to come in and enter a free raffle to win a fine art piece donated by the artist – a gift from the exhibiting artist to the townspeople- with every show we mount.
  • That means every full-time area resident can become an art appreciator and collector, for free.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • If you're an art innovator, tastemaker, or someone who thinks our idea is worthy, help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools on your screen!

And that's all there is to it.

Here's the Victorian that comes with the barn. We're going to make it a residency for exhibiting artists as well as a public room for members. Billiards anyone?

story:
Hi!

I'm Jen and I want to introduce you to Afrika Tikkun.

For those of you who know me, you know I am a passionate results-oriented entrepreneur. You may not know that I spent the formative years of my childhood in South Africa and it is a second home to me.

The systemic challenges facing South Africa are enormous, but I have found one organization that is making a real difference: Afrika Tikkun.

For over twenty years, Afrika Tikkun has perfected a "cradle-to-career" development model that literally supports children from birth into adulthood. At six "Centres of Excellence" across South Africa, Afrika Tikkun:

  • Provides support to new mothers and early childhood development programming from birth to age six;
  • Provides learning support, cultural and sports programming from grades 3-12
  • Offers 19-35 year-olds through career readiness training, entrepreneurship development, bursaries and job placement
The Afrika Tikkun model offers a holistic programme of education, culture, art and sport. The sports programme is especially important for keeping children, especially boys, engaged in the community.

In honor of Nelson Mandela Day, I am committing myself to raising £10,000 to underwrite Afrika Tikkun's football programme for FIVE YEARS. It's a big goal, but one I know will make a huge difference in the lives of South African children who need it the most. I hope you will join me!

Hi!I'm Jen and I want to introduce you to Afrika Tikkun.
For those of you who know me, you know I am a passionate results-oriented entrepreneur. You may not know that I spent the formative years of my childhood in South Africa and it is a second home to me.
The systemic challenges facing South Africa are enormous, but I have found one organization that is making a real difference: Afrika Tikkun.
For over twenty years, Afrika Tikkun has perfected a "cradle-to-career" development model that literally supports children from birth into adulthood. At six "Centres of Excellence" across South Africa, Afrika Tikkun:  Provides support to new mothers and early childhood development programming from birth to age six;
Provides learning support, cultural and sports programming from grades 3-12 Offers 19-35 year-olds through career readiness training, entrepreneurship development, bursaries and job placement
The Afrika Tikkun model offers a holistic programme of education, culture, art and sport. The sports programme is especially important for keeping children, especially boys, engaged in the community.
In honor of Nelson Mandela Day, I am committing myself to raising £10,000 to underwrite Afrika Tikkun's football programme for FIVE YEARS. It's a big goal, but one I know will make a huge difference in the lives of South African children who need it the most. I hope you will join me!

story:
Very Briefly

Coworking for Hope is a charity. Its objective is to raise USD 30,000 to buy 33 cows for needy Ugandan families. In August 2016, its co-creators, six young students living in Switzerland, will make sure that the money is well spent by giving the money directly in Uganda. There are several reasons why cows can sustainably help, e.g.:

  • Cows produce milk during approximately 10 years
  • Milk can be sold to create revenues
  • Cows help in creating some manure, increasing crop yield
  • Cows give birth to new calves, building a continuously growing network


Where Is the Money Going to?

All the collected money will be used to buy and maintain cows. A bank account has been created under the association name (implying an acknowledgment of the association by the Swiss bank). All the money is collected through this account. It will not be used to cover travel or administrative expenses, meaning that each donated cent will end up in Uganda. Our association statutes (in conformity with the Swiss law) express these statements. These statutes and our goal can be found on our website (www.coworkingforhope.org, in French only).


The Impact

All the collected money will be used to buy cows. Here is how we plan to spend this USD 30,000 (1CHF =1USD):

  • 1 cow = CHF 800
  • Annual fees for 1 cow = CHF 40
  • Annual medical services (local) = CHF 50

==> 1 cow = CHF 890 = 1 family

==> CHF 30,000 = 33 cows = 198 families = 792 people !

If a different amount of money is collected (greater or smaller than USD 30,000), the number of cows will be simply adapted in accordance to the above formula.


Why Trusting Us?

The team

We are 6 young and motivated people living in different areas of Switzerland (see gallery). Most of us are university students To create this charity, we all agreed on the same following principles:

  • All the money collected will be used for the cows (no personal expenditure nor administrative fees)

  • The solution we provide has to be both sustainable and absolutely essential to the beneficiaries
  • Our priority is to struggle against poverty and hunger


A collaboration with FH Suisse

The local Ugandan partners we will work with, their networks, and their logistics is based on a reliable relationship they have had for many years with FH Suisse (Food for the Hungry). FH Suisse is a charity created in 1996.  In 2014, they spent more than USD 700,000 in humanitarian projects. Furthermore, they are members of the Fédération genevoise de cooperation (FGC), a well-established network of more than 60 charities active in Switzerland. 

What Else Can You Do?

  • Like our Facebook page (facebook.com/coworkingforhope)

  • Visit our webpage – statutes and presentation report available (coworkingforhope.org)

  • Make a donation directly to our partner (fh-suisse.ch)


Thank you!
