story:
Dear friends of sustainable living,

I am pleased to announce the launching of the IndieGoGo campaign and seek your support for the completion and promotion of Learning for Sustainable Living (LfSL), an online learning program which utilises an integrated approach to sustainable living.

Today there is increasing public acknowledgment that a sustainable future for our children and us will require profound changes in perceptions and practices in large parts of the world’s population. More than 100 Million people in many countries, people often referred to as Cultural Creatives, have been practicing some aspects of sustainable living for the last several decades.

Our program aims to bring together the most notable of these elements by integrating:

  • Ecologically sustainable practices and concerns for the planet
  • Interest in other cultures and lifestyles
  • Eliminating poverty
  • Personal growth and healing practices
  • Values based on altruism, spirituality, and self-realisation.

With approximately 66% of the project already completed, your financial support will ensure that the learning environment can go online early 2016.

The LfSL online learning environment and its associated residentials and groups are designed to enhance learners’ ability to lead sustainable lives through gaining knowledge and skills on important sustainability related topics. The eight courses of this program focus on a wide range of issues that are deemed important for an integrated approach to sustainable living. The eight key topics are briefly described below. When completed the program will have the following features:

  • 8 courses
  • 96 topics
  • 500+ papers and book chapters by scholars working in the respective fields
  • 200+ links to relevant websites
  • PowerPoint presentations and learning tasks
  • Forum discussions for each topic

We envisage that approximately AUS$ 12,000 will enable us to complete and promote the project. While we will be grateful for donations of any amount, we have structured the benefits for you, learner access to the learning environment and other forms of involvement, around the figures of AUS$50 and 100. 

Perks

The obvious choice of benefits is to give you access to this learning environment. You can also choose to transfer your entitlement to another person. Because four of the eight courses have already been completed or are nearing completion, you will be able to get access to some of the courses of your choice very soon after your contribution has been confirmed. This means that you will receive an email with your user name and password to access this environment. You will also receive an access key for each course as well as links to information on how to use this environment as a learner. The following list summarises the benefits that you will get as a sponsor:

  • AUD 50 will entitle you to get full access to two courses of your choice for two years
  • AUD 100 will entitle you to get full access to four courses of your choice for two years.

Full access means that you have access to all readings, links, learning challenges, chat rooms and other facilities that you can use to communicate with fellow learners and the LfSL team.

Each course contains in the last section a document where you can share your feedback with us. If you have a passion for sustainable living and the appropriate qualifications you may also approach us to become one of the course facilitators in the program. If you have expertise in an area of study that would be a good extension of this program, you could also become a course designer and facilitator.

All donations will be used solely for the purpose of developing and promoting the LfSL environment. Progress reports will be published on the same webpage to inform you on the progress of the campaign and on how the money is being used.

More informatiion and contact

Please visit the educational website at www.lfsl.info for information on the project, the campaign, and the rewards. Please click on LfSL Information under Available Courses and log in as a guest. You can contact us through the website or at admin@lfsl.info

Thank you!

For the LfSL Development Team

Dr Werner Sattmann-Frese

story:
INTRODUCTION:

Minister Jameliah Young-Mitchell and her husband Calvin Mitchell has over twenty five years of combined experience in ministry on several different levels. Calvin Mitchell operates in his gift of business administration and Minister Jameliah operates in the gift of the prophetic as well as teaching and preaching. 

DESCRIPTION OF THE CAMPAIGN: 

If you are reading this right now I am sure you have experienced a level of pain hurt and disappointment. As we look around, depression is on an all time high and people have taken out their anger hurt and depression out on the world.  We all have looked at several situations where the theory of hurt people hurt people and clinch our heart on the devastation cause by pain.  Now at some point when you experience pain you have two places.

The hospital and some sort of faith lets just call it a church for arguments sake.  How is it that the places where you are supposed to heal have added pain to your already existing circumstance?  Well this is where you have an opportunity to experience church unusual.  Let’s be honest, we all are looking for a level of faith and friendship that will help us through our difficult times.  LET US DO THAT.  Here at MJ Ministries ECU we are building a gateway via social media that will expand help to the hurting people.  

MJ Ministries ECU will help revive the hope that this world has either snatched or just made life so hard until people feel hope has gone. You will be surprise how much a little encouragement goes just a long way.

Have you ever waited for the approval or the encouragement from a parent of love one?  How beautiful it is to be in the assembly with encouraging people who not only show you that you ware fearfully and wonderfully made; But will help you navigate through life on a high note of ALL THING ARE POSSIBLE THOUGH CHRIST FOR THOSE WHO LOVE THE LORD AND ARE CALL UNTO HIS PURPOSE. PHILIPPIANS 4:13

Circumstances.  MJ Ministries ECU will help you right where you are it can be you the reader or anyone who you know that may need a life line. WE ARE HERE FOR YOU! 

The Impact

I recall one day I was in a church and I was ask to come see a young lady that had a loaded hand gun in her bag.  Through the grace of GOD the word she heard allowed her to come to my office and hand over the weapon and get help.  

What We Need & What You Get

If we can work together to meet our financial goal of $50,000 we can start getting the things we need to help the people.  

Shelter, Food, Clothing, Transportation, Counseling, Conferences, Workshops Events, and much more.......

MJ Ministries ECU is a ministry of transparency, visibility and accountability. Before you sow anything pray. As you sow your seed you must understand the principals of seedtime and harvest. The ground of where you contribute monetarily must be fertile ground, which I know MJ Ministries ECU are.  Your funding will help us reach the depressed of this nation. Each dime contributed will be accounted for. Every quarter we will provide a report on our page as to where your seed is going and testimonies on the lives you have help change.  You will see the product of your seed and how we watered it as GOD has gotten the increase. The Perks for our contributors are monthly news letters along with free conferences, events and workshops.

We at MJ Ministries ECU will help you find your purpose thought workshops, conferences, providing you with step by step guide using the word of GOD and even your day to day experiences in the most unusual way that will help you see thing differently.  With your help together we can do that.  There are so many people who are just stuck and have no direction on how to unlock the fuel needed to get them to the next level due to life and situations. MJ Ministries ECU believe that a healthy MIND, SOUL and BODY can create a healthy YOU. 

We will provide at the workshops and conferences: 

For women hurting from divorce and/or domestic violence. The funds will help us get them the counseling they so very well need. 

THE LADY BUG PROJECT

MJ Ministries ECU will provide make overs, along with tools preparing them for the work place. Sometimes even helping purchase suites and clothing to help them  get interview ready plus, much more. MJ Ministries realize in shelters there are people who have nothing to wear to secure a job.

BUILDING AN ARK

The Ark is a project created to help young men understand the development of manhood and bridge the gap helping men understand the importance of being a father. Your funds will even help MJ Ministries ECU provide workshops and conferences geared toward the hurting man. 

YOUR CONTRIBUTION IS NEEDED

1. Please donate whatever amount you can to help us reach our fundraising goal. Every single donation helps, whether large or small, and we will be grateful for whatever you can do.

2. Please pray for the hurting people of this world that needs this ministry. Pray that the hearts of the people will be opened to hearing the gospel. Pray that Jameliah and Calvin will be bold and loving in sharing that good news while serving the people. Pray for this crowd funding effort to be successful.

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize everyone can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help: 

Please share the link for this fundraising campaign on your social media sites. Spreading the word about this need will help bring it before the eyes of those whom God is preparing to give to this effort. Please share it on Facebook, Twitter, Tumbler, Pinterest, Instagram, or wherever your sphere of influence may touch.

Thank you in advance for your wonderful and generous support!

story:
Who are we? 

Kamp Khalil, Inc. is a 501(c)(3) organization that was founded in 2003. The mission of Kamp Khalil is to provide holistic Islamic programming designed to empower youth with the knowledge and skills necessary to become global leaders impacting our social fabric by positively affecting change in the areas of business, education, politics, and culture.


What do we do? 

Since 2004, Kamp Khalil has established itself as a leadership and youth development institution. What began as a 4-day summer camp has evolved into an organization that serves the needs of America’s youth year-round. We have served youth ages 12-17 from over 32 states during our summer sessions, winter sessions, as well as at various local, state, and national conferences.

Our success can be directly attributed to our faith and belief in Allah (swt) and the life example of Prophet Muhammad (saw). We approach our work with a spirit of service and sacrifice. We are passionate about youth development. Our time, resources, and knowledge are completely invested in our youth. We want to leave this Earth knowing that we did our part to provide a positive example of preparing our future generations for leadership.


Who do we serve?  

What makes Kamp Khalil unique is that we develop youth from a holistic approach.  All of our sessions are content rich, yet activity based. Participants learn through diagram models, guided practice, group discussion, public speaking, team building, and self-directed presentations Content includes but is not limited to financial literacy, goal setting, critical thinking, business plan formulation, civic engagement, healthy communication skills, time management, networking, self- discovery, proactivity, entrepreneurial development, overcoming adversity, understanding diversity, identifying and handling bullying, and conflict resolution.

Creative expression is another key ingredient within our programming. Participants gain experience using raw materials to create and produce. Developing their skill set increases their self-efficacy and enhances their ability to succeed. Our participants have crafted pillows, jewelry, and rugs. They have also learned the importance of using natural products on their bodies through mixing and formulating individualized shower gels and lip balms. Our Talent Showcase is the highlight! Everyone participants through various performing arts. 

Health education and physical fitness are the highlights of our summer and winter camps. Participants have participated in workshops on nutrition, positive mental attitude, hygiene, and dietary needs. Physical activity includes kickball, dodgeball, dance, yoga, basketball, canoeing, and our signature activity Khalil Khaos, which is a team competition comprised of both physical and mental challenges.


How do we work? 

 Kamp Khalil not only develops the mind and body. We develop the spirit. As a faith-based organization we seamlessly thread spiritual consciousness into our all of our programming. We emphasize moral responsibility, the Oneness of the Creator, and the oneness of humanity. As citizens of this planet, youth are empowered to be moral leaders and servants of Allah (swt). We teach and model the belief that we are all servants of the Creator and are responsible for positively contributing to the society.


How can you have an impact? 

Double your contribution to support youth programming this month!!  

"Those who spend of their goods by night and by day, in secret and in public, have their reward with their Lord. On them shall be no fear, nor shall they grieve."

For the month of October, every dollar that you donate will be matched. This means you can double your contribution, double your blessings, and double your impact on our organization!!! 

Our goal is to raise $10,000 this winter. The average cost to register a child for a 5-day residential camp is over $400. Because of the generous financial contributions that we receive, we have been able to keep the registration costs under $200 for over 10 years.

All contributions to Kamp Khalil are tax-deductible. With your valued support, we will continue to provide enriching experiences for our participants that will positively impact their lives and the future of our world.

"Civilized societies never leave their future to chance." -- Imam W. Deen Mohammed

All contributions to Kamp Khalil are tax-deductible. With your valued support, we will continue to provide enriching experiences for our participants that will positively
impact their lives and the future of our world."Civilized societies never leave their future to chance." -- Imam W. Deen Mohammed

story:
This Fall, in honor of Ally Week, donate and help GLSEN Connecticut raise funds for fighting bullying and creating safe K-12 schools!  Your donations will help fund:

  • scholarships for LGBT youth
  • research on how schools feel for LGBT and LGBT-perceived youth
  • safe space kits
  • educational outreach for students, parents, and teachers
  • building Gay-Straight Alliances in high schools and middle schools
  • legislative and legal support for LGBT student rights and antibullying campaigns
We want every student in every Connecticut school, public and private, to feel safe, confident, supported, and able to learn.

Donate here, via Indiegogo, or send a check to GLSEN Connecticut, PO Box 2405, Stamford CT 06906, Attn: Leigh Elijah, GLSEN Connecticut Treasurer.

story:
Part 1

For those who did not see part 1 of this campaign, please follow the link below to read in full detail about the campaign.

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/graduation-yoga-retreat-in-costa-rica/x/11021838#/

Part 2

December (aka Graduation!) is right around the corner. After 9 years of higher education, I am beyond excited to receive my Master’s Degree in speech-language pathology in about 12 weeks! After graduation and the holidays, I will be off to pursue another educational passion and earn my certification to teach yoga. I am also excited to share that a second certification is being offered during the 4-week training. When I return from Costa Rica I will be certified to teach yoga not only to adults, but also to children ages 2 – 17. As my personal passion for yoga has developed and evolved, I have envisioned integrating yoga into my therapeutic approach as a speech pathologist. I’m in disbelief that I will be properly trained to do this beginning Day 1 of my career.

I am so grateful to share that I was able to make a deposit and secure a place in the training with the previously raised funds. I was also personally able to register for the kids’ yoga teacher training, purchase a plane ticket, and make some accommodation arrangements for the few days prior to the start of the training. The remaining tuition for the training will be due right around the New Year.

Thank you for contributions of any amount, but most of all for your love and friendship.

 

In Gratitude – Namaste.

 

Stephanie

story:
SO, WAIT. WHAT?

Adult-use cannabis is coming to Chicago!Urbs in Horto is inviting representatives from different unions, community groups, industries, and professions to a cannabis roundtable dinner discussion. Following in the footsteps of true grassroots advocacy, our guests consist of Chicagoans who’ve been impacted by the War on Drugs, and others who will be affected by the adult-use bill. 

Each of our guests have been encouraged to bring questions they have regarding cannabis, the industry in general, and how they may advocate for a fair and equitable market if they themselves choose not to consume. 

 

 

Nickel Experiential Agency is the driving force behind Urbs in Horto.  

Differing from a traditional experiential marketing company that (usually) tends to sell a product through some sort of an immersive experience, Nickel produces multi-sensory productions where the focal point (the "sell") is an idea, a way of life, or a potential solution to one of the many issues we're facing as a society. 

When Nickel learned that Illinois was close to legalizing adult-use cannabis, and that the bill includes provisions to help Chicagoans who have been disproportionately affected by the War on Drugs (largely, communities of color) they saw an opportunity to bring a group of passionate creatives together and build grassroots advocacy for a conscientious and ethical cannabis industry in Illinois. 

Chicago's motto is the Latin phrase Urbs in Horto which means City in a Garden. The Urbs in Horto team is hoping this legalization will put Chicago in a City of hope, opportunity, prosperity, and reparation.

 

MEET THE CREW BEHIND URBS IN HORTO

A Space Where Knowledge Flows Between Professions and Industries


Urbs in Horto is a collaborative initiative between two chefs, fifteen artists, five videographers, one architect, six business owners, one mixologist, two graphic designers, and all of whom are activists.

To create a purpose-driven experience that stimulates the five senses, we've brought together a specific group of creatives whose talents (when combined,) have the ability to transform an ordinary space into an alternate reality. 

 

WE BELIEVE

In order to create empathy and respect for a life thats different from your own,  you need to feel where that individual is coming from. You need to feel the why behind their reasoning.

 

Throughout this event, we've intertwined the five senses to stimulate a shared feeling of hope around this legalization; instilling in our guests the opportunity for each and every one of them to stand up for freedom and equality in the state of Illinois. 

 

From this environment, we can establish common ground for answering our central question:
 

As cannabis consumers and non-consumers alike, how can we advocate for an ethical and conscientious cannabis industry in Illinois?
 

By supporting Urbs in Horto, you are funding the talented individuals shown above.

 

DINNER

The team behind Urbs in Horto believes that when an individual eats a new dish and enjoys it, that experience gives them an appreciation of the culture and community from where that dish came.

To shine light and love on some of the Chicago communities that have been largely criminalized and pushed to the fringes of our cityscape, Chef Skyler Dees and Chef Fresh Roberson have brought to life (through taste and smell) cherished delicacies from these communities: 

 

Austin, Back of the Yards, Englewood, Garfield Park, Humboldt Park, Lawndale, and South Shore. 

 

The adult-use cannabis bill in IL. includes provisions to specifically help Chicagoans who come from these communities -- our people who have been disproportionately targeted, policed, and arrested for consuming a plant thats usage is equal among races.

 

(Illustrations courtesy of Meg Robichaud)

 

ART EXHIBITION & SILENT AUCTION

Directly following the roundtable discussion, the art exhibit and silent auction will take place in a studio one floor above the dining space. 

Shifting the medium to art, and expanding our invitation to the general public + Chicagoans interested in the cannabis scene, the exhibit uses the power of visual stimulation (i.e. videography, photography, projection mapping, street art, and paintings,) to continue and expand upon the conversations sparked during the course of the dinner. 

 

(Illustrations courtesy of Meg Robichaud)

 

WHY NOT JUST CHARGE FOR A TICKET?

We want to make sure that we have a diverse body of Chicagoans represented at the Urbs in Horto roundtable dinner discussion. So rather than charging $150/ticket (the starting point for a multi-course dinner like this,) we're inviting our guests free of charge. 

 

To do this, we need your support.

 

We also want to give other individuals (who might not live in Chicago) an opportunity to use their $$$ as a way to join the conversation - opening up the doors for additional ways to become an activist. 
 

The more we talk about this plant, the various ways it affects our lives, and the systemic change it can bring to communities of color, the more we can de-stigmatize its use and bring it out of the shadows of society. 

 

 

IF YOU CAN'T SUPPORT US FINANCIALLY, YOU STILL CAN SUPPORT OUR MISSION.

Share our campaign!

The more people that learn about what we're doing, the more people we'll be able to bring onboard this train of conscious consumerism and advocacy in the cannabis space.

If you have a personal story involving cannabis, and you want to share it, we want to hear it.

 

It's never too late to join the conversation.

By using the #myurbsinhorto hashtag, you are standing in solidarity with our mission. 

 

While the Urbs in Horto initiatives involves discussions regarding cannabis, this movement is not solely designed for those who consume it; 

rather, this is an opportunity for anyone and everyone who cares about social responsibility and standing up for those who have been impacted by the War on Drugs in Illinois.

story:
Bloom Learning Community - Our Story

Our Mission:

Our mission is to gift learners with space, time, and support to experience self-discovery and emotional growth through personalized holistic learning.

Our Vision:

Bloom Learning Community fosters empowered global citizens who are confident, capable, and compassionate agents of positive change.

...Every creation begins with a dream.

When we became parents, we consciously wanted to create a nurturing and supportive environment for our kids. We did this to the best of our ability as we learned and grew alongside our young children.

As parents, we dream that our children experience freedom for both inner growth and outer expansion as they unfold towards their full potential.

Once our children were old enough to start school, we wanted to continue to make conscious choices for our families. For many of us, it’s a challenge to choose among current education options. We decided the traditional school system wouldn’t provide the best experience for our kids. We kept them home and continued to enjoy learning together.

As our kids grew, we longed to expand our options. To enrich their days and experience being a part of a close community. However, when we searched through our available choices again, we still couldn't find a learning option that matched our dreams for our children.

So we bravely decided to create one.

We have strongly held values about learning that we couldn't find reflected in the available choices in our area. Ultimately dissatisfaction with aspects of both the traditional school model and homeschooling led us to imagine a different alternative.

We dreamed of a place where we would feel happy, proud, and excited to send our children all day.

A place that saw our kids as unique individuals with strengths, passions, and purpose waiting to be nurtured and encouraged.

A place that protected the sacred time of childhood, maintaining an atmosphere of fun and freedom that allows children’s inborn spontaneity to flourish.

A place that was welcoming and accepting - that felt good the moment you walked in. Where kids and parents both found joy in close and connected relationships - a true community of shared experience and values.

A place that supported us with the intensely demanding venture of raising whole, compassionate, bright, happy, and healthy children, who feel valued and a deep sense of belonging.

A caring place for our kids to feel at home while we could also pursue interests, practice self-care, self-development, grow careers, and create positive change in the world.

We desired enrichment that respects personal differences and lovingly challenges our kids to dive deep into inner discovery and reach higher towards their full potential.

A thoughtfully well-designed and organized program that would truly prepare kids for the challenges and opportunities of the future... to be powerful agents of social change... to be open-minded and open-hearted... to be creative in their visions for themselves and their world - and to feel capable and confident to carry out those visions.

Bloom was a dream that called us to be created.

We answered that call for our own families and for yours. Bloom Learning Community embodies its own vision and mission, to demonstrate the freedom we all dream of - to create choices, solutions, and a bright future for the world.

Meet Kristen:

Kristen Cuffari, M.A., SLP CO-FOUNDER/DIRECTOR

Kristen is a homeschool mom of two years and a PRN speech-language pathologist. She lives with her husband and two young children in Strongsville, Ohio. She is a state-licensed Speech-Language Pathologist and received her Masters in Communication Sciences from Case Western Reserve University in 2006. Her professional work experience includes five years working at the Monarch School for Children with Autism in Shaker heights followed by a brief position in private practice before she decided to be home full time to raise and homeschool her children. She is currently a substitute speech language pathologist at the Monarch School and works on an as-needed basis. Along with Beth, she also holds a position on the administrative team of a local homeschool cooperative comprised of 25 families. Kristen has worked with Beth to co-found Bloom in an effort to establish a more holistic, self-directed educational opportunity for her own children and others.

"When I chose to homeschool my children it was in the hopes that I could give them the gift of time—time to be children, time to make mistakes and fail in a safe environment, and time to take however long they needed in the process of learning, at a pace that was right for them. When the idea for Bloom was sparked I felt as though I was about to embark on a great frontier of education reform. I felt as though I needed to be a part of making education what it should be. We dreamed of building an educational environment in which we could give other children the time and space they need to learn whatever it is their hearts desire, and to support them emotionally, socially, and spiritually. Our hope is that, in doing so, we can leave this world better than we found it.”

Meet Beth:

 

Bethany Springer, M.Ed. CO-FOUNDER/DIRECTOR

Bethany has been homeschooling her children for five years after spending two decades working in educational settings with children from birth through college. Previous work experience includes tutoring in classrooms and client homes, special needs early intervention specialist, and teaching in private and public schools from kindergarten to college. She helped create a homeschool cooperative with over 25 families, and was on the administrative team along with Kristen. She is also a holistic wellness educator who has created a variety of workshops and classes in yoga, meditation, and stress management techniques. She co-founded Bloom to realize a dream of changing the world through holistic, self-directed education.

“At the back of my mind, I always thought about how I’d love to start a school one day. It’s a dream I had since I was a child playing “school” with my dolls - a dream I just knew in my heart would happen at the right time. I love learning, creating, and sharing with others - it’s when I feel most alive and energized! Growth is so potent and powerful! It’s human nature to want to learn and grow and we’re wired to create and connect. We need more places like Bloom that support the unfolding of these intrinsic qualities. Personally, I am dedicated to the awakening of human potential so we can all live our best lives - happy, whole, connected, and purposeful.”

What We Need & What You Get:

We need $8000 to get the necessary supplies for our Foundation Year students to begin in the fall. Items such as computers, shelving, learning materials, curriculum, flexible seating, and art supplies are going to make our educational space inviting and exciting for the kids.

Perks for our donors:

$10 Donation: Receive a personal thank you from our Facebook page so all our followers can see what an awesome human being you are!

$25 Donation:  A personal thank you from our Facebook page AND receive a hand-painted thank-you postcard from one of our own small artists. Can be framed to commemorate your generosity!

$50 Donation: A personal thank you from our Facebook page AND a piece of plantable seed paper included inside a personally painted thank you card. When your flowers bloom you'll be reminded of how you helped us bloom too!!

$100 Donation: A personal thank you from our Facebook page, a piece of plantable seed paper included inside a personally painted thank you card, AND receive a tote bag painted and designed by one of our very own small artists.  When people stop you to ask where you received this awesome perk you can tell them all about how you were part of building an amazing educational program!

$250 Donation: A personal thank you from our Facebook page, a piece of plantable seed paper included inside a personally painted thank you card, a handpainted tote bag AND a Bloom logo T-Shirt.  We can even tie-dye it for an extra personal touch!

$500 Donation: A personal thank you from our Facebook page, a piece of plantable seed paper included inside a personally painted thank you card, a handpainted tote bag, a Bloom logo T-Shirt, AND a personal invitation to tour our location, either in person or virtually, before we open! Be the first to see it, take pictures, share it with the world, and let people know that you helped build something great!

$1000 Donation: A personal thank you from our Facebook page, a piece of plantable seed paper included inside a personally painted thank you card, a handpainted tote bag, a Bloom logo T-Shirt, a personal invitation to tour our location, AND the honor of having your name displayed as a generous donor on site at Bloom. Be forever commemorated as having helped build the amazing educational experience that Bloom Learning Community will be!

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

While every dollar helps us reach our goal, if you contribute funds or even if you can't, you can still help Bloom grow!

  • Help us get the word out about our campaign by sharing our campaign link with friends and family and on social media:
  • And please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you for your support!

Stay up to date by liking and following us on Facebook @ Bloom Learning Community

$1000 Donation: A personal thank you from our Facebook page, a piece of plantable seed paper included inside a personally painted thank you card, a handpainted tote bag, a Bloom logo T-Shirt, a personal invitation to tour our location, AND the honor of having your name displayed as a generous donor on site at Bloom. Be forever commemorated as having helped build the amazing educational experience that Bloom Learning Community will be!
 
Other Ways You Can Help:
While every dollar helps us reach our goal, if you contribute funds or even if you can't, you can still help Bloom grow!

Help us get the word out about our campaign by sharing our campaign link with friends and family and on social media:
And please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you for your support!Stay up to date by liking and following us on Facebook @ Bloom Learning Community

story:
What does ‘Arabic’ mean to me?

I have been looking into art and design as an expression of cultural identity since I was a design student, learning about art history and artists whose vision shaped the world we live in today. When I looked closely at the Arab world’s artistic contribution, I found one uniquely dominant element: calligraphy. 

This finding sparked my interest in letters, in their forms and proportions as well as their connection to who we are. 

If art is an expression of our cultural identity, and if calligraphy is the hallmark of our artistic tradition, are Arabic letters then the closest visual representation of who we are? If so, how are we using them today to express our identity?

How does Arabic Typography measure up to Arabic Calligraphy?

Today, the level of support for Arabic in digital communication is substandard in comparison to other languages. Specifically, only a limited number of Arabic fonts exist commercially, often unpolished or even missing characters. 

Arabic font designers have been struggling to preserve and update the form of the language, especially as the technology has been changing faster than the ability to adapt to it. Add to this problem the pressure for Arab corporations to compete in a global market. As a result, designers are left with little room to creatively experiment with ways in which letters can reflect our contemporary identity and diversity as Arabs.

 

My journey with Arabic Calligraphy


As a graphic designer, I used calligraphy to compensate for the scarcity of Arabic fonts. Even though my isolated efforts failed to address the broader underlying problem, they led me to the UK, where there is a strong type design community that helped me explore the issue from both theoretical and practical perspectives.

As a type designer, I continued to deepen my understanding of the field from both historical and technological perspectives. I took a Codicology and Palaeography course at the University of Cambridge to study the history of Arabic manuscripts and the writing system, as well as a coding course at General Assembly. I also spent a month at DecoType in Amsterdam learning about their trademark font technology for connected scripts.

Through these experiences, I understood that I was missing a crucial perspective: economic. The problem with the current state of Arabic digital communication is not a lack of research, skills nor technological resources. Rather, it is a lack of profitable and sustainable business and licensing models that govern the design, production and distribution of fonts for emerging markets, especially on the web. This issue is taken for granted but there are many language communities that are under-represented in the digital space because they cannot afford to digitally recreate their languages on their own.

My Next Stop: MBA

During my ten months at INSEAD, I will learn about designing and refining business models for the creative industries in emerging markets. My goal is to develop the skills needed to profitably run creative digital initiatives, from retail font libraries to website builders to educational platforms, that are tailored to our language and culture. This move, I believe, will bring me a giant step closer to my vision: an Arabic type foundry serving the communication needs of the Arabic-scripted world and headquartered in an Arab country, so that we wouldn’t have to go abroad to look for Arabic. In other words, my vision is to bring Arabic back home.

 

www.bringarabicbackhome.com

www.soulafkhalifeh.com     |    ​soulaf.khalifeh@gmail.com

  @soulafkh        @soulafkh

 

 

 

 

www.bringarabicbackhome.com

www.soulafkhalifeh.com     |    ​soulaf.khalifeh@gmail.com

  @soulafkh        @soulafkh

 

Please note that I will personally deliver all orders made from Lebanon in December 2019. More information will follow once the campaign closes.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Special thanks to Mourad Boutros and Gerry Ellender for always believing in me.

story:
ENABLA – the community-based educational platform where you can study and share your experience for free

 

Enabla is:

  • Open to everyone

  • Community-based

  • Without adverts

  • Totally free

  • And much more...

 

What makes Enabla so Special?

WE ARE OPEN TO EVERYONE (Implemented)

Modern educational platforms pursue the elitist approach by letting only chosen professors from chosen universities give lectures. At the same time, there are thousands of talented individuals who host their lectures and talks on youtube. Now there is no need for it, no more! On Enabla, access is open to everyone – if you want to teach others – you’re in. And inversely – if you want to study – just go and do it, you don't have to wait for the "start of the course" date.

WE RELY ON COMMUNITY

There is a reason why Wikipedia is the best encyclopedia ever created – it was made by the people for the people. With Enabla you never feel like you study alone as the whole world helps build a proper understanding of the matter. With all its special features Enabla makes pursuing knowledge a breeze!

  • Find the answer (Coming soon)

Ask inline questions to get correct answers from your classmates and even lecturers themselves.

  • Discuss substantively (Partially implemented)

Start open discussions with students from all over the world directly inside the lectures. Works with the videos as well!

 

 

  • Make it better (Coming soon)

Found a mistake in a lecture or just want to add some depth to the materials? With Enabla, you can edit with only a couple of clicks. We provide people with tools which allow improving any existing educational material – as long as the community approves such changes.

 

WE PROVIDE A PERFECT ENVIRONMENT (Partially Implemented)

Text, video, audio, slides, tests, tasks, supplementary materials – you can include anything of this list in your lecture. Moreover, all the formats are deeply interconnected. Audio and video are synchronized with the text and supplementary materials, and tests are linked to the appropriate parts of the lecture's content.

 

WE WILL HELP YOU PUBLISH (Coming soon)

On Enabla, you can publish anything educational. No need for a large course like on other platforms. More than that, you shouldn’t be afraid of posting an unedited note, as we’ll do the rest. On Enabla, we will automatically review your work during the uploading and make a well-structured publication out of any notes, be that a plain text, MS Word, or LaTeX. The review contains:

  • Grammar and spelling check
  • Sectioning
  • Creating captions and hyperlinks for figures and tables
  • Chemical and mathematical expressions writing
  • Connecting your notes with already published lectures
  • And more

 

OK, WHAT’S THE CATCH?

No catch. Of course, we will need resources to operate. That is how we are going to fund the platform:

  • We will take a percentage of donations to lecturers (Coming soon)

If you're happy with the lecture or content and you want to express gratitude and support the creator financially – you're more than welcome to donate. The platform will receive a small percentage of donations that will help it fly level and improve on a daily basis.

  • Premium (Coming soon)

We will add additional features as paid premium options later. Some of them are private classes for studying in smaller groups and an automated schedule. The core features will always stay free of charge – this is our main principle.

 

Who Are We?

 

We are the Enabla team – the team of young scientists, students, designers, and developers, who got sick of current elitist and money-grabbing educational platforms. We want to enhance the process of studying, make it open, and easily accessible – and we know how!

 

Enabla Needs Your Help!

Good news – Enabla is up and running. But it is not polished enough to be presented to the wider audience. Our team has done a great deal without any external investments – we are not gonna give up our free platform to some fat-pursed investor.

However, to expand the team and speed up the development, we need your financial support. We would greatly appreciate it if you shared this campaign with your friends and colleagues. But what is more important – we need your help to determine the most requested features by the people.

On the right, you can see a list of perks we provide our backers with. By donating literally anything, you’ll be able to vote for the feature that you need the most. On our side, we will do our best to implement it ASAP.

 

Feature
Description
Automatic text and subtitles translations We will add automatic translations for all the available text lectures which would be a good starting point for future community edits. The same will be done for subtitles.
Slides with synchronization Sometimes authors provide slides instead of text lecture notes; we are going to add the synchronization between the slides and the video in the same way as it is for the text now.
Context questions Context questions are quite similar to comments but have extra in-built features. The examples are setting one of the answers as “correct answer” or the ability for a lecturer to answer the question directly from his email client.
Community corrections We will implement voting and version control systems allowing users to improve existing lectures. The idea itself is similar to Wikipedia but provides more control over the community corrections.
Support for MS Word lectures We will add a possibility to upload and edit text lectures in the MS Word format in addition to the existing ones.
Android App We will start developing our Android App for better experience on mobile.
IOS App The same, but with IOS.

 

 

Join Enabla!

We want to create a real educational community where everyone can find useful and insightful content. And we need more like-minded people to grow!

Join the knowledge side. Join Enabla!

 

Contacts

You can send any thoughts, questions, or suggestions to us on contact@enabla.com. We are on the line! Also, join us on Facebook, Twitter, and Vkontakte for the up-to-date information and regular developer diaries.

Remember: by lending us a hand you help create a place where sharing knowledge is easy and accessible. We want to make this world a better place and with your help, we believe we will do it.

Sincerely yours,                                                                                                                                                    Enabla team.

story:
Writing Master Classes That Matter 

Since our launch in 2003, Under the Volcano has become a magnet for both emerging and accomplished writers from Mexico and around the world, dozens of whom have gone on to publish and win prizes. Thanks to the incredible support of local hosts and donors and a healthy supply of energy, we’ve been able to make our initial vision a reality year after year. However, we are now at a point where we need more funds to bring our next crop of writers and journalists together for our January 2018 master classes. Writers apply to Under the Volcano because of its reputation for excellence and its commitment to inclusiveness of every kind (literary style, language, nationality, ethnicity and race). And because they know it works: our online community lights up almost every week with news of alumni linked over time and space—fellowships, literary prizes, articles, book publications and contracts with top publishers.

Our Mission is More Urgent Than Ever!

Now more than ever, words matter.  Writing has the power to cut through harsh rhetoric and polarizing discourse. Novelists and poets connect readers across boundaries and cultures, while courageous journalists expose the truth. By identifying and encouraging the best new writers and by bringing them together in a community of peers, Under the Volcano continues to play its part in building the global awareness so critical for our survival.  As a non-profit, we remain committed to making our program affordable to all qualified applicants.


 

Why We Need to Raise $10,000 Now

We raised $9000 for scholarships at our fourth annual fundraiser in September, but we’re still $6000 short of the funds we need to bring another dozen wonderful writers who are waiting to hear whether we can help them with tuition or travel subsidies so they can join us.  We will also draw on this fund to offer modest stipends to a handful of local young people who will participate this year as interns, continuing the successful pilot we began three years ago, which has already seen hesitant high school graduates find the confidence to make the leap to college.

Why Under the Volcano?

A few of our recent alumni in their own words...

“The time I spent in Tepoztlán working on my novel was magical. It re-charged my batteries so that I could finally get through my first draft.”

                                                            Reyna Grande, Mexico and California

“The dream always is to feel that writing is your only job in life. At Under the Volcano that dream becomes real.”

                                                            Tim MacGhabban, Ireland

“Under the Volcano is not just about the writing. Never has a combination of place, people and program felt so powerful and inspiring.”

                                                            Natalie Hart, United Kingdom

“The journalism workshop opened my eyes to the possibility of thinking deeply about a subject and having a voice in the piece while still doing the job of reporter. It was an awakening for me personally but also something I could bring back to the Seattle Times and use in my work there."

                                                            Tyrone Beason, Seattle

“I had been hungry for an opportunity to write in Mexico, my ancestral homeland. The energy of Tepoztlán nurtured my creative process and allowed me access to stories I’d forgotten.”

                                                            Norma Liliana Valdez, California

“When I was feeling overwhelmed at the sheer talent and accomplishments of the faculty, a fellow student said to me, 'The only difference between them and us is time.'”

                                                            Martha Morrison, Canada



More on Our Budget: Impact of the Earthquake

The September 19th earthquake caused extensive damage in Tepoztlán, our village base, and we’re still scrambling to shift some of the key events of this special season, our fifteenth, which will see the launch of our first anthology (see our perks list to get your copy!), the world premiere of a song cycle by composer Felipe Pérez Santiago (downloads & CD's also on our list of perks) and the exhibit and sale of a stunning silkscreen commissioned from Cuernavaca artist Cisco Jiménez (available in limited edition prints to donors on the high end of our list.)

The earthquake has also hit the budgets of our many Mexican participants, some of whom were forced to move and/or lost work. And it hit home. Promised support from the local sponsors for several of our planned projects, including the anthology, has not come through and we are looking at $2000 in printing costs that we had not anticipated.

Giving Back to Our Village

Finally, we would like to be able to contribute to the reconstruction work in Tepoztlán. The first $1.000 of this campaign will go to several groups already working in the village to help families whose houses were either destroyed or rendered uninhabitable by the quake and to rebuild the 16th century churches whose bell towers collapsed.  We will also contribute to the reconstruction of the village’s crown jewel, the historic Museo del Ex-Convento, where we have held so many memorable readings and events with writers including Grace Paley, Maureen Howard, Breyten Breytenbach, Carolyn Forché, Russell Banks, Jonathan Levi, Elena Poniatowska, Francisco Goldman, Jennifer Clement, Sandra Cisneros and, just last year, Luisa Valenzuela.

       

Moving Beyond 2018

We also need funds to document this year’s program in order to move Under the Volcano to the next level. A professional documentary about the program (projected cost of $500) and money for a part-time grant writer ($500 to get us off the ground) will help us secure multi-year corporate and/or foundation funding to build a sustainable structure for the future. 

We know that what we do is unique: we’re both intimate and global, ambitious for our writers and as generous to them as we can possibly be. The success of our alumni speaks for itself.  After fifteen years as essentially a one-woman effort by Founder and Director Magda Bogin, Under the Volcano urgently needs to add staff.

What If We Raise More Than Our Target?

To expand our current level of outreach, continue to attract top faculty and increase our support to the best applicants, we will be seeking to hire a part-time assistant director, a social media expert, a graphic designer and a webmaster who can help us keep up with the weekly news from our alumni.

Gratitude

Over the years more than 100 donors, including alumni of the program, have contributed to our scholarship fundraisers and auctions.  Our local hosts have offered splendid hospitality to more than a dozen members of our prize-winning faculty and several local hotels and restaurants regularly provide discounts to our attendees.

We have also received generous donations from a select group of donors whose pledges enabled us to establish eight named fellowships that fully fund particularly talented writers to attend our entire program and its two-week follow-up residency at no cost, with travel and accommodation included. 

Our gratitude to all our supporters is immense.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help.  Please help spread the word on this campaign by sharing the link with friends who will help us reach our goal

We also need funds to document this year’s program in order to move Under the Volcano to the next level. A professional documentary about the program (projected cost of $500) and money for a part-time grant writer ($500 to get us off the ground) will help us secure multi-year corporate and/or foundation funding to build a sustainable structure for the future. 
We know that what we do is unique: we’re both intimate and global, ambitious for our writers and as generous to them as we can possibly be. The success of our alumni speaks for itself.  After fifteen years as essentially a one-woman effort by Founder and Director Magda Bogin, Under the Volcano urgently needs to add staff.
What If We Raise More Than Our Target?
To expand our current level of outreach, continue to attract top faculty and increase our support to the best applicants, we will be seeking to hire a part-time assistant director, a social media expert, a graphic designer and a webmaster who can help us keep up with the weekly news from our alumni.
Gratitude
Over the years more than 100 donors, including alumni of the program, have contributed to our scholarship fundraisers and auctions.  Our local hosts have offered splendid hospitality to more than a dozen members of our prize-winning faculty and several local hotels and restaurants regularly provide discounts to our attendees.
We have also received generous donations from a select group of donors whose pledges enabled us to establish eight named fellowships that fully fund particularly talented writers to attend our entire program and its two-week follow-up residency at no cost, with travel and accommodation included. 
Our gratitude to all our supporters is immense.
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help.  Please help spread the word on this campaign by sharing the link with friends who will help us reach our goal

story:
This world is getting crazy, and Dirty Dog is about to be released!!!  But there is hope - COOL CAT!

From the mind of Derek Savage comes Cool Cat’s new arch villain – DIRTY DOG!  And he’s one dirty dog… :) 

The new Cool Cat project introducing Dirty Dog is in production, so for now enjoy Cool Cat’s movie, “Cool Cat Kid’s Superhero”.  DVD available on our site and Streaming at Amazon. www.CoolCatLovesYou.com

As Cool Cat says, “Together we can make Great Things happen!”

“Cool Cat Kids Superhero” is an Anti-Bullying and Kid’s Gun Safety feature film, starring Vivica A. Fox, Erik Estrada, Cynthia Rothrock and myself.  We are now Close Captioning the film so it will Released and Streaming in a few weeks.

---ABOUT COOL CAT

Cool Cat is the Coolest Cat in the World!  And Cool Cat Loves You!

The Cool Cat Films and Books have proven themselves to be a good steward for children in showing them positive messages, and this film will be in the same caliber.

From the 1000’s of emails that we’ve received from all over the globe, we see that Cool Cat has touched the hearts of many and has brought happiness to many, and has helped kids with bullying.

---REWARDS FOR JOINING THIS FILM

We have some Cool Rewards for You to be a part of this project – Cool Cat Shirts, Books, Key Chains, Digital Downloads Posters, DVDs, Cool Cat Hats, Sweaters, Hoodies,
-Entertainment Related Rewards-
Your Name in the Movie Credits, Producer Credits, and even a Speaking Role in the film with Cool Cat!

---RAVE REVIEWS FOR COOL CAT

-“Cool Cat is Fun!” - Adam West, the Real Batman 
-“I Love Cool Cat!” - Bo Derek, Legendary Actress, The Perfect '10' 
-“The Cool Cat books are Adorable and have so much Potential!” - Bill Melendez, 9-time Emmy Winner, producer of Charlie Brown, voice of Snoopy 
-“Cool Cat is the Coolest Ever!” - Linda Hopkins, Tony Award Winner 
-“Cool Cat is Cool!” - Dean Koontz, NY Times Best Selling Author 
-“Cool Cat is a Cleaver Series!” - Rupert Murdoch, News Corporation, 20th Century Fox

---HOW CAN YOU HELP

It’s easy to help.  Donate whatever you can to the film, all is appreciated.  Plus tell all your friends and family about Cool Cat, and spread the word on social media.

---DOES COOL CAT LOVE ME

You already know that answer, and it’s Yes!  Cool Cat Loves You!  

If you would like to receive a Free “COOL CAT PRESS KIT”, then email us from our website and put Free Press Kit in the email title and we’ll forward the PDF to you.

---LINKS

Website - www.CoolCatLovesYou.com
Twitter - www.Twitter.com/CoolCatlovesyou
Cool Cat Kids Superhero IMDB – www.imdb.com/title/tt7281994 
Derek Savage IMDB - www.imdb.com/name/nm4733996

story:
Short Summary

The organisers are seeking funding and sponsorship from interested organisations and individuals to cover running costs of this not-for-profit venture, as detailed below.

It is a unique chance to support emerging scholarship on Chin State, and to ensure outputs reach the highest levels of international visibility at these important times

We have already secured some funding from a number of parties, ranging from INGOs, to academic institutions, to diaspora interest groups. We are looking forward to further encouraging donations. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are raising the following:

  • 2,500 USD needed for the first event which will take place in Mandalay, part of the International Conference on Burma Myanmar Studies
  • 1000 USD needed for the second event, the conference-cum-workshop at the Chin Christian University in Hakha
  • 1800 USD for production of the book
  • 200 USD extra for contingencies
  • We have divided our budget in these three steps so if we do not reach our entire goal we will still be able to fulfill most components.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute financially, there are many other things you can do to support us. 

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
  • Share our project on Facebook, email, and via the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Join our conversation - get in touch about Chin State, Myanmar, and other things we have in common.
  • Join us in Mandalay, Hakha, Chiang Mai, or online.

 

More information about our first project - an all day, multi-panel, event at Mandalay University

This series of panels aims to give a platform to researchers from Chin State as well as those from elsewhere in Myanmar and from abroad working on Chin State and its diaspora to share their insights to the study of this region. It represents an opportunity for both early career and established researchers and scholars from diverse backgrounds working within this field to meet and exchange ideas, as well as offering the potential for future collaboration. The panel is interdisciplinary, and submissions have been collected from a variety of academic and non-academic backgrounds from interested students, academics, researchers, as well as practitioners with an interest in critical debate around Chin State.  

Following abstract acceptance, authors are now writing a full academic paper on the subject, and preparing a 10-minute oral presentation on their topic. The presentation will be delivered at the conference in Mandalay. The paper and the presentation are in either English or Burmese.

Support available: Papers that are selected for the panel and that are written in English will receive peer to peer support from the Panel Committee, such as editing, argument and structural development of the paper, and more. 

Panel Series Title: "Emerging Scholarship on Chin State – Changes, Continuity, and Transformation. "

Abstract: 

Chin State is a predominantly Christian State rich in ethnic and linguistic diversity found in North-Western Myanmar. It is notoriously one of the most hard-to-reach regions of the country with high mountains that make access a continuing challenge. The State is not on any of the regional transportation corridors, it is land locked, and has lagged behind Myanmar’s overall economic development. These factors, compounded with the fact that one Chin person out of two is a migrant means that the remaining households in Chin State have been uniquely been affected by outward migration. Chin State has an unusually strong, exposed and educated diaspora whose remittances play a significant role in an otherwise low-earning internal migrant population. The recent arrival of large international aid and development programs in the region has also been contributing to a variety of social, cultural, and developmental changes.

Chin State is also experiencing social and agricultural transformations much like elsewhere in Myanmar, which are changing livelihood strategies and traditional indigenous relationships to land. Further, a slow but much-anticipated economic development also inevitably has impact on the environment – which is particularly important in Chin State - and can quickly generate multiple transformations of the region whose impact goes beyond creating employment and better income, some of which members of this panel will be exploring.

Some of the other questions this panel will be asking include: What are the main issues affecting the lives and well-being of people living in Chin State? How have these issues changed over the last few decades? What impact have the changes happening in Myanmar in the last few years brought to the region in terms of agriculture, development, and social-cultural changes? What is the relationship between Indigenous Rights claimed by ethnic minority populations and Development? What is the role of gender in understanding societies in Chin State?

Key words: Chin State, development, aid, environment, education, diaspora, migration, diversity, gender

Abstracts submitted address the overall themes of transformations adopted by the overall ICBMS Conference, and fall in any of the following areas:

Development & Transitions in Myanmar

Agro-based Economy

Bio-diversity/Environment and Climate Change

Rural Transformation/Rural Development/Poverty Alleviation

Cultural Heritage and Tourism

Media, Popular Culture and Communication

Governance, Social Security and Peace Process

Health Care

Population Change, Migration & Displacement

Urbanization/Rural-urban Relations

Food Security and Food Practice

Education and Development

Literature, Language and Society

History and Social Memory

Ethnicity and Gender Relations

Religion and Belief Systems

Resource Management

 

A detailed list of accepted papers will be uploaded on this site in the next few weeks.
