      We are not a retailer that dabbles in school fundraising as a subset of the company. We developed our company with the goal teacher appreciation paired with better school fundraising. After being involved with school support groups (PTA/ PTO/ PTSA) for several years, we have learned that many schools rely on product fundraisers to bring in the money necessary to cover essential school operations. 

   Please support our dream of helping schools in a substantial way.

Project may become challenging if we receive an overwhelming number of CHIKAGRAM requests and are unable to review and post each video in a timely fashion
WE WILL NOT POST NEGATIVE OR DISPARAGING VIDEOS if we receive inappropriate videos (containing negative comments, or profanity or otherwise deemed unfit for all ages) the video will not be posted and a refund WILL NOT be given

Send us feedback, we welcome any and all ideas you have to improve CHIKAMON

story:
MY SELF DESCRIPTION AND BACK GROUND

  My name is Pastor Joshua Laizer, I am 44 years old, born in Naisinyai village, Simanjiro district in Tanzania. I got chance to join evangelical college for four years and served as an evangelist for seven years. Later on I joined the university of Makumira for theology, after my graduation, I was blessed installed  to be a pastor among Maasai society. I have been a pastor for the Maasai in Lutheran church Northern diocese constituency of Siha in Karansi Kilimanjaro.

Pastor Joshua Laiser (Karansi Lutheran Parish in Moshi Tanzania)


   MY CAMPAIGN AND WHY IT IS IMPORTANT

I, as pastor of Maasai society where education is of low standard and inadequate, I decided to start a school in Maasai society so as to convince the Maasai on Education. Maasai society is leaving a life with no permanent settlement, thus not getting a chance for schooling. Also the society lives a life of animal husbandry which is difficult for parents to allow their children in distant schools due to they depend of them for rearing animals. Therefore starting a school within Maasai society will convince parents allowing their children to attend school near by them. That is the school I started within Maasai society is purposely to help the Maasai children. It is called PAMBAZUKA NAISINYAI PRE & PRIMARY SCHOOL. Already my school has grade one (1) with 65 pupils and grade two with 35 pupils and 4 teachers who use most of their time teaching the children for most of them can’t speak neither Swahili nor English, but Maasai language.

Pupils with their teachers

Our school started under the tree as we do not have resources to help us for building classes for the Maasai children. Education should start with their parents to educate them so that they can know the importance of education to their children. Some of the parents are now aware about education to their children so they are allowing them to attend school. We are still talking to the parents so that they can give us a good cooperation.

Pupils with their teacher


 NEW TWO CLASSES

Through our own efforts we have managed to build two classes where grade one and two are using for studying. We have more 10 acres where we want to build more classes as we have more students coming soon. We want to build more classes up to seven classes, we also need to build kitchen, toilet as the one we have is not enough, computers and computer lab, well for keeping water as there is scarcity of water, desks, books, office for teachers, salaries for teachers.

Our two New Classes

My future plans are to have secondary school up to university among Maasai society in order to have education nearby so as to fight poverty by getting good education.

  The importance of this campaign is to construct a school within Maasai society, also helping Maasai society withdraw from ignorance and illiteracy so a t cope with the changes of the world.


What We Need & What You Get

We need to do the following so that we can get our school off the ground;

Seven (7) more classes @ $5000 x 7 =    $35000

Computer room 1......................................= $5000

Thirty (30) computers @ $500 x 30.....=$15000

One office for teachers ..........................=$5000

Kitchen....................................................= $5000

Toilet........................................................= $5000

Library & books......................................= $9000

Well for keeping water(waterhole)........= $3000

Lunch for 100 students  $1000 per month * 12 months =$12,000

Salaries for 4 teachers @ $300 x 12 x 4 = $14400

Tuition fees for 25 students who their parents can not afford to pay for them @ $700 x 25  =$17500

Total Expansions Costs.......................... $125,900


THE FOLLOWING ARE THE REASONS AS TO WHY MY PROJECT IS VALUABLE TO DONORS AND THE WORLD

  This project is very important to donors and world at large for it will connect us with Maasai society for they shall be able to communicate with different people of different nations of the world. Also this will give chance for donors to come and visit Maasai society and learn the real life and culture of Maasai. Apart from that it also helps to eradicate the number of illiterates in the world.


RISKS AND CHALLENGES

1. Due to studying environment being of low standard life, it is difficult to get skilled teachers and faithful constructors.

2. Another challenge is teacher's salaries, where by in order to get good trainers you also have to pay them well.

3. Another challenge is that , the pupils are fluently speaking Maasai native language, while their teachers don’t know the language and thus difficult to teach them

4. Due to that parents couldn’t get education, and then they find no importance to take their children to school.


 HOW TO OVERCOME THE CHALLENGES

1. Improving the teaching environment so as to encourage trained teachers to come and teach in our school. Also getting enough trusted constructors for constructing the building.

2. Increasing teacher's salaries so as to motivate the coming of more teachers.

3. Educating parents’ house by house on the importance of taking their children to school.


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please tell friends and family about our campaign and our socially-good mission!
  • Please share our campaign page through the IndieGoGo share buttons on our campaign page!
  • Please share our campaign on your social networks such as facebook, twitter e.t.c

Thank you very much for your support! Every bit is greatly appreciated!

fees for 25 students who their parents can not afford to pay for them @ $700 x 25  =$17500Total Expansions Costs.......................... $125,900
THE FOLLOWING ARE THE REASONS AS TO WHY MY PROJECT IS VALUABLE TO DONORS AND THE WORLD  This project is very important to donors and world at large for it will connect us with Maasai society for they shall be able to communicate with different people of different nations of the world. Also this will give chance for donors to come and visit Maasai society and learn the real life and culture of Maasai. Apart from that it also helps to eradicate the number of illiterates in the world.RISKS AND CHALLENGES1. Due to studying environment being of low standard life, it is difficult to get skilled teachers and faithful constructors.2. Another challenge is teacher's salaries, where by in order to get good trainers you also have to pay them well.3. Another challenge is that , the pupils are fluently speaking Maasai native language, while their teachers don’t know the language and thus difficult to teach them4. Due to that parents couldn’t get education, and then they find no importance to take their children to school. HOW TO OVERCOME THE CHALLENGES1. Improving the teaching environment so as to encourage trained teachers to come and teach in our school. Also getting enough trusted constructors for constructing the building.2. Increasing teacher's salaries so as to motivate the coming of more teachers.3. Educating parents’ house by house on the importance of taking their children to school.Other Ways You Can Help
Please tell friends and family about our campaign and our socially-good mission!
Please share our campaign page through the IndieGoGo share buttons on our campaign page!
Please share our campaign on your social networks such as facebook, twitter e.t.c
Thank you very much for your support! Every bit is greatly appreciated!

story:
What? Why? How?

A summary by Massimo Costa (http://www.sicilianiliberi.org/it/) 

An old glorious Nation kept in chains

Sicily is one of the oldest nations in the world still alive.
It experimented the Great Classical Civilization (Siceliot Era): Greek-Roman Sicily lasted since 743 b.C until 903 a.D.
After the relatively brief Arabic domination it was the turn of the Kingdom of Sicily (1060-1860), a Great Power in Middle Ages, where it founded Parliament before the same England; after, a little kingdom in Modern Era, but still independent and alive.
Illegal occupation by Italy reduced the richest country in Mediterranean Area to a sad and poor colony. 
Now, despite a formal autonomy never respected by Rome, the situation is worsening day by day, the old nation is nearly killed by a hard theft of all its resources.

Some numbers of the disaster

From the Ancient times to 1860 never migrated from Sicily; since 1860 10 millions Sicilians left Sicily, more than Armenians or Palestinians, or Hebrews: a silent genocide.
GNP is today nearly 80 billions of euros, but with 60 % of youth unemployment; full employment GNP would be at least the double. GNP per capita under the 2/3 of Italian Average, ¾ of Economy owned by the public sector, ¼ public pensions.
Sicily pays in taxes and tariffs to Italy nearly 1/8 of its GNP without receiving anything by Italy.
Sicily has no speed railways nor acceptable highways, nor true international ports or airports; all its infrastructures seems 50 or more years old.
Sicily keeps 40% of Italian Cultural Heritage (on its turn the 60 % of the entire world) 

The only viable solution

Time for the “false autonomous” regime is ended.
Time for colonialism and assisted economy is ended.
Historical attempt to belonging to Italy has failed miserably.
Sicily must become an Independent State with a reliable ruling class. 


The features of our dream 

  1. Owners at home: land, energy, cultural and environmental resources, sovereignty belong only to Sicilians and to their Free State.
  2. A Revolution in transports, wealth services,…; in a word “Sicily as the motherland of Quality of Life”.
  3. E-administration for every level and abolition of the colonial “bureaucracy” regime.
  4. Lean management for public services.
  5. Freedom and Incentives for foreigners’ investments.
  6. Lowing taxes for income and VAT.
  7. Free customs (out of a short list of agricultural and food products).
  8. A model of development founded upon tourism, quality food, culture and high-tech, no carbon industries.

A Strategy for Sicilian Freedom

Foundation of a strong Sicilian Nationalist Party, rooted throughout Sicily (done, its name being “Siciliani Liberi”).
Winning the next political “regional” elections (2017) or strongly conditioning the winners for a legislation (2017/22) and winning the next one.
Organizing – after a max 5-years transition for restoring economy and society - a plebiscite for independence and opening negotiations with Italian State and European Union.
Declaration of Independence of Sicily and Convoking of a Constituent Parliament.

The need for help by the Sicilians of the Diaspora

Sicilians in the world feel their “motherland” more than Sicilians at home.
Only a domestic crowdfunding would be a too slow process: now Sicily is very poor and it cannot wait for a long-time lasting process of political liberation.
Financing Sicilian Independence is not only right, but also convenient: a great and fresh chance for free investments in a free land.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you don't want to help: You can use the Indiegogo share tools! please, share our campaign more than you can!

The First Steps

Need for a first program: “Make Sicily Free I”: Winning the election of Palermo, the capital of Sicily.
Reaching our potential voters by means of: 

  • producing flyers, brochure, posters and other printed material for this electoral competition
  • producing political spot and other multimedia to be distributed on TV and on Social Network.

Thank you for your attention. And for your contribution!

Massimo Costa
Political leader of the Movement

 

Zòccu? Picchì ? Còmu?

Un riassuntu di: Massimo Costa

 

N’antica gluriusa nazioni ncatinata

La Sicilia è una di li chiù antichi nazioni di lu munnu c’ancora esisti.

Spirimintau la granni Civiltati Clàssica (l’Era Siceliota); la Sicilia Greco-Romana durau di lu 743 a.C. a lu 903 d.C.

Doppu la dominazioni saracina, non troppu longa, tuccau a lu Regnu di Sicilia (1060-1860), na Granni Putenza nna lu Mediu Evu, quannu idda nvintau lu Parlamentu, prima di la stissa Inghilterra; doppu, un regnu nicu nna l’Era Moderna, ma macari ndipinnenti e vivu.

L’occupazioni illegali di l’Italia di lu paisi chiù riccu di tutta l’Aria Mediterrànea chi èramu, ni fici addivintari na colonia pòvira e nfilici.

Oji, puru c’avemu n’autonomìa formali chi Roma ‘un a’ mai rispittatu, la situazioni addiventa chiù peju jornu doppu jornu, l’antica nazioni è quasi ammazzata di sta latrunarìa veru granni di tutti li so ricchizzi.

Na pocu di nùmmari di la ruina

Di l’Antichitati nzinu a lu 1860, nuddu si n’a’ mai jutu di la Sicilia; di lu 1860, 10 miliuni di Siciliani si ni fujeru di la Sicilia, chiossai di l’Armeni o di li Palistinisi o l’Ebrei: un genocidiu mutu.

Lu PIL è oji circa 80 miliardi di euri, ma cu lu 60 % di disoccupazioni giovanili; a la china occupazioni lu PIL fussi almenu lu duppiu. Lu PIL pro capite sutta di li 2/3 di la media taliana, li ¾ di l’economìa occupata di lu setturi pùblicu, ¼ sulu sulu pensioni pùblichi.

La Sicilia paga di tassi e tariffi a l’Italia circa 1/8 di lu propiu PIL senza arricìviri nenti di l’Italia.

La Sicilia non avi treni lesti ne strati dignitusi, ne porti o aeroporti chi si ponnu diri veru ntirnazionali; tutti li so infrastrutturi pàrinu vecchi di 50 anni o chiossai.

La Sicilia avi lu 40 % di li beni culturali taliani (chi, pi li fatti so’ sunnu lu 60 % di chiddi di tuttu lu munnu).

L’ùnica soluzioni chi si po aviri

L’època di lu regimi di “autonomìa fàusa” finìu.

L’època di lu colonialismu e di l’economìa assistita finìu.

Lu tentativu stòricu di fari parti di l’Italia fallìu pri sempri.

La Sicilia av’a addivintari un Statu ndipinnenti cu na classi dirigenti a l’autizza di la situazioni.

Comu è lu nostru sonnu

  1. Patruni a casa propia: la terra, l’energìa, li ricchizzi culturali e ambientali, la sovranità appartennu sulu a li Sicliani e a lu so Statu lìbiru.
  2. Na rivoluzioni nna li trasporti, li sirbiza sanitari,…; nta na palora, “La Sicilia comu la patria di la Qualità di la vita”.
  3. E-administration ad ogni niveddu e abolizioni di lu regimi “burocràticu” coloniali.
  4. Maniju leggiu di li sirbiza pùblichi.
  5. Libirtati e ncentivi pri li nvestimenti furasteri.
  6. Diminuzioni di la tassazioni supra lu rèdditu e di l’IVA
  7. Libiralizzazioni duganali (tranni na lista di produtti agrìcoli e alimentari)
  8. Un cuatru di sviluppu funnatu supra a lu turismu, cibu di qualitati, cultura e àuta tecnologìa, senza ndustrii nquinanti.

Na Strategìa pri la Libirazioni di la Sicilia

Funnazioni di un partitu forti nazionalista sicilianu, radicatu unnegghiè ‘n Sicilia (già fattu, lu so nomu è “Siciliani Liberi”)

Vittoria a li pròssimi elezioni polìtichi “rigiunali” (2017) o risultatu comunqui in gradu di condizionari cu’ vinci pri na legislatura (2017/22) e vittoria definitiva a l’elezioni successivi.

Organizzazioni – doppu un perìodu di transizioni màssimu di 5 anni pri risanari l’economìa e la sucità – d’un plebiscitu pri la ndipinnenza, cu l’apertura di negoziazioni cu lu Statu talianu e l’Unioni Europea.

Dichiarazioni di ndipinnenza di la Sicilia e Convocazioni di n’Assemblea Costituenti.

Lu bisognu d’ajutu di li Siciliani di la Diàspora

Li Siciliani nta lu munnu sèntinu la so “patria” chiossai di li stissi Siciliani nta la so terra.

Na ricugghiuta di fondi sulu naziunali fussi un processu troppu lentu: oji la Sicilia è veru pòvira e non po aspittari un processu di libirazioni polìtica troppu longu.

Dunari pìcciuli pri la Ndipinnenza Siciliana ‘un è sulu giustu, ma puru cunveni: n’occasioni granni e frisca pri fari nvestimenti lìbiri nta na terra lìbira.

Áutri maneri comu ni po’ ajutari

Certuni di vuàutri putìssiru non contribuiri, ma chissu non signìfica ca non ni vonnu ajutari: putiti usari Indiegogo pri condivìdiri li nostri strummenti! Pri favuri, condividiti la nostra campagna chiossai chi putiti!

Li Primi Passi

C’è bisognu d’un primu programma: “Make Sicily Free I”: Vìnciri l’elezioni di Palermu, la capitali di la Sicilia.

Jùnciri a li nostri potenziali eletturi cu:

  • produzioni di volantini, brochure, cartilluna e àutru matiriali a stampa pri sta competizioni elettorali;
  • produzioni di spot polìtici e àutri media pri spartilli nna li TV o nna li social networks.

Grazi pri l’attenzioni. E pri l’ajutu!

Massimo Costa
Prisidenti di lu Muvimentu

 

Che cosa? Perché ? Come?

Una sintesi di: Massimo Costa

 

Un’antica gloriosa nazione tenuta in catene
La Sicilia è una delle più antiche nazioni del mondo ancora vivente.
Ha vissuto la grande Civiltà Classica (l’Era Siceliota): la Sicilia Greco-Romana durò dal 743 a. C al 903 d. C.
Dopo la relativamente breve dominazione araba fu la volta del Regno di Sicilia (1060-1860), una Grande Potenza nel Medio Evo, in cui essa fondò il Parlamento prima della stessa Inghilterra; dopo, un piccolo regno nell’Era Moderna, ma ancora indipendente e vivo.

L’occupazione illegale da parte dell’Italia ha reso il più ricco paese dell’Area mediterranea una colonia triste e povera.

Adesso, nonostante un’autonomia formale mai rispettata da Roma, la situazione peggiora giorno dopo giorno, l’antica nazione è quasi uccisa da un immane furto di tutte le sue risorse.

Alcuni numeri del disastro

Dall’Antichità sino al 1860 nessuno è mai emigrato dalla Sicilia; dal 1860 10 milioni di Siciliani hanno abbandonato la Sicilia, più che gli Armeni o i Palestinesi o gli Ebrei: un genocidio silenzioso.

Il PIL è oggi circa di 80 miliardi di euro, ma con il 60 % di disoccupazione giovanile; al pieno impiego il PIL sarebbe almeno il doppio. Il PIL pro capite al di sotto dei 2/3 della media italiana, i ¾ dell’economia occupati dal settore pubblico, ¼ dalle pensioni pubbliche.

La Sicilia paga in tributi e tariffe all’Italia circa 1/8 del proprio PIL senza ricevere nulla dall’Italia.

La Sicilia non ha treni veloci né strade decenti, né porti o aeroporti veramente internazionali; tutte le sue infrastrutture sembrano vecchie di 50 anni o più.

La Sicilia contiene il 40 % dei beni culturali italiani (a loro volta il 60 % di quelli mondiali).

L’unica soluzione praticabile

L’epoca del regime di “falsa autonomia” è terminata.

L’epoca del colonialismo e dell’economia assistita è finita.

Il tentativo storico di far parte dell’Italia è fallito clamorosamente.

La Sicilia deve diventare uno Stato Indipendente con un’affidabile classe dirigente.
 

I caratteri del nostro sogno

  1. Padroni a casa propria: la terra, l’energia, le risorse culturali ed ambientali, la sovranità appartengano solo ai Siciliani e al loro Libero Stato.
  2. Una rivoluzione nei trasporti, nei servizi sanitari,…; in una parola, “La Sicilia come la patria della Qualità della vita”.
  3. E-administration ad ogni livello ed abolizione del regime “burocratico” coloniale.
  4. Gestione snella dei servizi pubblici.
  5. Libertà ed incentivi per gli investimenti stranieri.
  6. Diminuzione della tassazione sul reddito e dell’IVA
  7. Liberalizzazione doganale (tranne una lista di prodotti agricoli e alimentari)
  8. Un modello di sviluppo fondato sul turismo, cibo di qualità, cultura e alta tecnologia, senza industrie inquinanti.

Una Strategia per la Liberazione della Sicilia
Fondazione di un forte partito nazionalista siciliano, radicato dappertutto in Sicilia (già fatto, il suo nome è “Siciliani Liberi”)

Vittoria alle prossime elezioni politiche “regionali” (2017) o risultato comunque in grado di condizionare i vincitori per una legislatura (2017/22) e vittoria definitiva alle elezioni successive.

Organizzazione – dopo un periodo di transizione massimo di 5 anni per risanare l’economia e la società – di un plebiscito per l’indipendenza, con l’apertura di negoziazioni con lo Stato italiano e l’Unione Europea.

Dichiarazione di Indipendenza della Sicilia e Convocazione di un’Assemblea Costituente.

Il bisogno di aiuto dai Siciliani della Diaspora

I Siciliani nel mondo sentono la loro “patria” più che gli stessi Siciliani nella loro terra.

Una raccolta di fondi soltanto nazionale sarebbe un processo troppo lento: oggi la Sicilia è molto povera e non può attendere un processo di liberazione politica troppo lungo.

Finanziare l’Indipendenza Siciliana non è solo giusto, ma anche conveniente: un’occasione grande e fresca per fare investimenti liberi in una terra libera.

Altri modi in cui puoi aiutarci

Alcuni di voi potranno non contribuire, ma ciò non significa che non vogliono aiutarci: potete usare Indiegogo per condividere i nostri strumenti! Per favore, condividete la nostra campagna quanto più possibile!

I Primi Passi

C’è bisogno di un primo programma: “Make the Sicily Free I”: Vincere le elezioni di Palermo, la capitale della Sicilia.

Raggiungere i nostri potenziali elettori per mezzo di:

  • produzione di volantini, brochure, cartelloni ed altro materiale a stampa per questa competizione elettorale;
  • produzione di spot politici ed altri mezzi multimediali da diffondere sulle TV o sui social networks.

Grazie per l’attenzione. E per l’aiuto!

 

Massimo Costa
Presidente del Movimento

Alcuni numeri del disastro
Dall’Antichità sino al 1860 nessuno è mai emigrato dalla Sicilia; dal 1860 10 milioni di Siciliani hanno abbandonato la Sicilia, più che gli Armeni o i Palestinesi o gli Ebrei: un genocidio silenzioso.
Il PIL è oggi circa di 80 miliardi di euro, ma con il 60 % di disoccupazione giovanile; al pieno impiego il PIL sarebbe almeno il doppio. Il PIL pro capite al di sotto dei 2/3 della media italiana, i ¾ dell’economia occupati dal settore pubblico, ¼ dalle pensioni pubbliche.
La Sicilia paga in tributi e tariffe all’Italia circa 1/8 del proprio PIL senza ricevere nulla dall’Italia.
La Sicilia non ha treni veloci né strade decenti, né porti o aeroporti veramente internazionali; tutte le sue infrastrutture sembrano vecchie di 50 anni o più.
La Sicilia contiene il 40 % dei beni culturali italiani (a loro volta il 60 % di quelli mondiali).
L’unica soluzione praticabile
L’epoca del regime di “falsa autonomia” è terminata.
L’epoca del colonialismo e dell’economia assistita è finita.
Il tentativo storico di far parte dell’Italia è fallito clamorosamente.
La Sicilia deve diventare uno Stato Indipendente con un’affidabile classe dirigente. 
I caratteri del nostro sogno

Padroni a casa propria: la terra, l’energia, le risorse culturali ed ambientali, la sovranità appartengano solo ai Siciliani e al loro Libero Stato.
Una rivoluzione nei trasporti, nei servizi sanitari,…; in una parola, “La Sicilia come la patria della Qualità della vita”.
E-administration ad ogni livello ed abolizione del regime “burocratico” coloniale.
Gestione snella dei servizi pubblici.
Libertà ed incentivi per gli investimenti stranieri.
Diminuzione della tassazione sul reddito e dell’IVA
Liberalizzazione doganale (tranne una lista di prodotti agricoli e alimentari)
Un modello di sviluppo fondato sul turismo, cibo di qualità, cultura e alta tecnologia, senza industrie inquinanti.

Una Strategia per la Liberazione della SiciliaFondazione di un forte partito nazionalista siciliano, radicato dappertutto in Sicilia (già fatto, il suo nome è “Siciliani Liberi”)
Vittoria alle prossime elezioni politiche “regionali” (2017) o risultato comunque in grado di condizionare i vincitori per una legislatura (2017/22) e vittoria definitiva alle elezioni successive.
Organizzazione – dopo un periodo di transizione massimo di 5 anni per risanare l’economia e la società – di un plebiscito per l’indipendenza, con l’apertura di negoziazioni con lo Stato italiano e l’Unione Europea.
Dichiarazione di Indipendenza della Sicilia e Convocazione di un’Assemblea Costituente.
Il bisogno di aiuto dai Siciliani della Diaspora
I Siciliani nel mondo sentono la loro “patria” più che gli stessi Siciliani nella loro terra.
Una raccolta di fondi soltanto nazionale sarebbe un processo troppo lento: oggi la Sicilia è molto povera e non può attendere un processo di liberazione politica troppo lungo.
Finanziare l’Indipendenza Siciliana non è solo giusto, ma anche conveniente: un’occasione grande e fresca per fare investimenti liberi in una terra libera.
Altri modi in cui puoi aiutarci
Alcuni di voi potranno non contribuire, ma ciò non significa che non vogliono aiutarci: potete usare Indiegogo per condividere i nostri strumenti! Per favore, condividete la nostra campagna quanto più possibile!
I Primi Passi
C’è bisogno di un primo programma: “Make the Sicily Free I”: Vincere le elezioni di Palermo, la capitale della Sicilia.
Raggiungere i nostri potenziali elettori per mezzo di:

produzione di volantini, brochure, cartelloni ed altro materiale a stampa per questa competizione elettorale;
produzione di spot politici ed altri mezzi multimediali da diffondere sulle TV o sui social networks.

Grazie per l’attenzione. E per l’aiuto!
 
Massimo CostaPresidente del Movimento

story:
Challenge

हिमालय or Himalaya literally means 'abode of Snow' in sanskrit - There is a lot of it in Nepal, perfect for skiing. Although many foreigners come to the Himalayans to ski, only few Nepalis are able to ski and snowboard.


About us

We are a grassroot Nepal based NGO that aims to educate Nepalis in skiing and snowboarding. We are about 15 Nepali tourism students and five mountainguides who decided, that after the earthquake of 2015 the time was ripe for something new. Together with ski instructors from Switzerland, Austria and Germany we have conducted the first major ski training in February 2016.

30 local female and male students were trained for 21 days in Rolwaling valley in Dolakaha district for free.The training consisted of basic ski/snowboard courses and avalanche training. At the moment we have 25 sets of skitour equipment and 4 Snowboards. Now its time to  scale it up and set up the first permanent ski school for mountain guides and locals in Nepal.

We insist that all skiing activities must be conducted in a sustainable way and in close interaction with the local communities!

The Project

The main target is to provide sufficient training, so Nepali instructors can  teach snowsports to Nepali students. Our training plan consists of beginners and advanced courses including avalanche awareness and crevasse rescue techniques. We can thereby profit from the mountaineering experience of local mountainguides and climbing sherpas that do already have incredible skills in operating in glacial and high mountainous terrain.

This is the first Skischool in Nepal and the highest in the world. After the earthquake in 2015 we decided to set new incentives for future of Nepal. We are highly motivated to encourage and educate more boys and girls about skis.

We concentrated on the Rolwaling valley, due to the major damage by the earthquake and landslides the year before. The valley offers excellent ski opportunities and skitouring could seriously improve the living conditions of the whole community.

Your support will go directly in the development of our ski school. So far the expenses of our first training were taken of by our private capital and by the european ski instructors. Now its your time to support us:

Firstly we will invest the majority of funds into a house in Khare based right on the bottom of Mera Peak (6416m). The house is in a good shape, welll insulated and only 2 years old. The family who sells it wants to migrate to the US.

The house is located on 4800m in a village called Khare and has 7 small double bedroom, one kitchen, one living room and costs 27000$. The owners are selling climbing equipment, worth 8000$, too. So this would be a package  deal that all of us would benefit.  On the glacier we could train 24/7 during the whole year while sleeping in our ski school, offering training, guided tours and equipment rental. So this is a perfect opportunity and a fair deal. We will inspect the house and the climbing gear during our mountain guide ski training in September on Mera Peak.

Second of all we neeed to continue to explore the best spots for skitouring and ski mountaineering in Nepal and aquire more ski equipment. Therefore we would need another 5000$ to scout in Nepals far Western region and Dolpo which lacks roads and is only accesible by air.

Third off all, we need more skis. Collecting them in Europe and US is no problem. However, cargo fees are extremly expensive. We will use another 5000$ for cargo fees for collected equipment.

We can offer skimountaineering races, freeride events and snowboard competitions to promote skiing in Nepal and generate income for our running expenses.

In two years, our mountain guides will be ready to guide foreigners on various peaks in Nepal for skitouring or splitboarding to expand their season and generate revenues for their respective families and other stakeholders.


If we cannot raise sufficient funds to buy a house for our ski school we will use it for seasonal ski/snowboard training sessions, rent and equipment. However it would be a lot more efficient, if we could train all year in the mountains on the glacier.

By supporting us you can become part of our NGO, join us on the slope or for a first descent of a 5000m or 6000m peak with our mountain guides!


Our Partners


We are cooperating with the Khumbu Climbing Center (KCC) that was founded 10 years ago and offers courses to young climbing Sherpas in ice and rock climbing. Their educational work has helped thousands of guides to work more safly in the mountains. KCC has a tremandous experience in working with locals from Khumbu valley and many of their trained guides are interested to learn how to Ski. (http://alexlowe.org/p/projects/item/1/the-khumb...)

In addition were are supported by Ski Dubai which has trained 4 Nepali Ski instructors, who want to help teaching in their home country during the winter.

We are affiliated with the Nepal Mountaineering Association (NMA) and cooperate with the Nepal Tourism Board to develop new possibilities for Nepal.

We are a full member of the World Snowboard Federation (WSF) and provisional member of the International Ski Mountaineering Federation (ISMF).


The consequences


At the moment there is an huge dynamic with young people in Nepal and in particular mountain guides. New nepalese companies are competing now with international Trekking and High altitude climbing companies. Many guides are doing solo climbs, first ascents and are taking alpinism in the Himalayans to the next level. Young people that are fed up with top down politics and corrupt structures want to start something from scratch to rebuild their country in a new, sustainable and comprehensive way.

Our NGO supports guides and local youngsters by giving them new opportunities, creating new jobs and a new season for skiing in their traditional communities. In many valleys, youngsters move to Kathmandu because they do not see any opportunities in the mountains. This leads to a major demographic problem and deserted villages. In the long run, many communities in the high valleys and in particular remote valleys with only little infrastructure, like Rolwaling or Dolpo region, could profit of a sustainable green ski tourism and convince young people to stay in their communities.


Due to the concentration of tourism on Everest and Annapurna Base Camp, the benefits of tourism are not spread evenly but create local grievances. We want to overcome this project by promoting forgotten valleys and peaks that are perfectly suited for skitouring and splitboarding.


Schedule

In September we will conduct an advanced skitraining on Mera Peak (6476m) for mountain guides. This is the first Nepali Ski expedition and we will train several days before we will attempt to summit and descent on skis. Climbing Sherpas from Khumbu Climbing Center will join us for the first time. In addition we will train crevasse rescue, avalanche theory and excercises.

From 18th december until 06th January we will conduct a major beginners Ski training in Langtang valley, which was hit by the earthquake like no other village. More than 60 students already signed up! We will conduct a ski race and attempt some first ski descents with our mountain guides and aspiring ski instructors.

In February 2017 will organize another ski training in Rolwaling valley in the village of Na. A few Ski and Snowboard professionals from Austria will support our Ski instructors and shred some Nepali powder.  There are slopes for beginners, advanced and professionals and many opportunities for snowboarders, too.


Similiar projects

This is not the first Ski development project. The most famous project is probably the Afghan Ski Challenge that promotes skiing in Bamiyan, Afghanistan (http://afghanskichallenge.com). Annually the Bamiyan Ski Club organizes a skitour race with hundreds of Afghan and international participants.
Skitouring became popular in Kyrgyzstan, after a couple of Europeans helped to set up the first ski school and thereby set an incentive. Soon, several tour operators and new ski schools and skitour resorts sprouted from the ground and skiing became quickly popular with vast parts of the population.
(http://www.returntokyrgyzstan.com)
Those examples proof the feasibility, joy and the socio-economic benefits that ski deveplopment projects can achieve.

Risks and Challenges

 

Skiing and Snowboarding in the Himalyans is quite different compared to the Americas or the Alps. The highest mountains in the world are majestic but dangerous at the same time. High altitude sickness (HAPE/HACE) can be a deadly risk if not treated correctly.

However, it is possible to acclimatize accordingly to the respective heigths by ascending slowly and sleeping at lower altitudes. Mitigating the risks of altitude sickness by taking the necessary precautions is possible and part of the job.
Our mountain guides and ski instructors have the required experience and skills to overcome those risks and to ski safley in high altitudes.

The variability of snowfall in the Himalayans and in particular the central Himalayans is another challenge to overcome. Early or late snowfall can fluctuate dramatically and is a challenge for ski projects in the Himalayans.

Despite the fact of varying snow conditions, we found several places with a decent snow cover where seasonal skiing is possible for several months. In addition, our future Ski school in Khare is right on the bottom of Mera glacier. Theroretically we can ski the whole yeare

Avalanches and crevasses can create a major risk while skiing in the Himalayans. We donated six avalanche beacons to the Air rescue service during the summer. In the winter we always use those systems if we go skiing and offer enhanced avalanche awareness and rescue training to our guides and students. Appropriate skills in theory and experience can ease the existing risks of skiing in the highest mountains of the world.


Alternative ways to help us

If you cannot afford to help us financially, you are heartly welcome to donate your old skitour or snowboard equipment or to join us as additional ski/snowboard instructor.

We need: ski, splitboards, bindings, skins, boots and more avalanche devices.


Please spread the word and help us to promote Ski and Snowboarding in Nepal!

Cheers and Dhanyavad!!!


Utsav Pathak (Chairman)

Shristi Sainju (Vice-chairwoman)

Julius Seidenader (Head Ski Instructor)

Kunga Sherpa (Climbing Instructor)

story:
Dear Pledgers, 

Unfortunately, we are experiencing some problems with the payment system of Indiegogo.

We are currently working on our own crowdfunding campaign platform that will be posted on www.voyage2learn.com soon. We will give you a heads up when it is ready.

Thank you for all your support!
story_txt: Dear Pledgers, Unfortunately, we are experiencing some problems with the payment system of Indiegogo.We are currently working on our own crowdfunding campaign platform that will be posted on www.voyage2learn.com soon. We will give you a heads up when it is ready.Thank you for all your support!

story:
Short Summary

VozzApp is a social network that allows you to discover and share 60 seconds worth of audio content with the people you know. It's based on the simple idea that listening to someone is more immersive than say, texting someone.

Using VozzApp you'd be able to sending intimate voice notes to your loved one or develop better bonds with friends. You'd be able to listen to and talk with people from different locations & cultures, discover their perspectives, and maybe, just maybe, forge new friendships with them.

I know that this social network has some potential and I am determined to see it come true. That's why I need your help.

The funds I ask for are the bare necessities that I require to get VozzApp up and running. Your contribution will not only fuel my optimism(trust me, it will), but also allow me to buy the resources required for a great user experience. Please donate a small amount towards my startup, because when the time comes when VozzApp is as big as the other social networks, you'll know that it was you who helped make it a reality.

What We Need

I've budgeted out production costs for an entire year and 2 months starting May 2016. There are a few costs that this startup needs to bear so here's the breakdown for you folks:

$2000 USD for renting powerful SuperMicro Blade servers for 14 months. Social networks are notorious for generating a lot of traffic. I expect VozzApp to receive almost 20 to 30 thousand people visiting it in a day which is why the SuperMicro Blade servers are my number one priority. They can handle thousands of concurrent users and are up and running 99.99% of the time. This means you can use the app and website without ever having to read 'Server Crash!'

$1500+125 USD for hiring a passionate iOS app development team of 2 people who'll work along side me to design a gorgeous and powerful app for your Apple devices and the $125 for registering on the various app stores.

$4500 USD for the license to use the sound effects and analysis algorithms.

If I don't reach my funding goal, whatever amount that was collected will go towards fulfilling the above costs and I'll pitch in the rest from my contingency fund of approximately $2000 that I've earned so far from my other apps. It's all or nothing on this one so we really need to make this goal happen.

The Impact

I could say that I am not trying to change the world here and sound modest, but I do intend to change the world. I want to be the guy who inspires other teenagers to get off their ass and dedicate themselves to doing something great. This initial funding round on Indiegogo will help me get the initial traction required to secure venture funding by this time next year. I want to make this social network a good one, and your backing could help me achieve that.

Risks & Challenges

The journey in setting up this internet startup is a difficult one. I've experienced this so far and I am learning new things every week. Till now it's been a one man show and I hope to change that quickly. One of the initial challenges is going to be to find a co-founder who is capable of being dedicated to her/his job and lend her/his perspective to mould the future of this startup.

Almost 92% of all tech startups fail and it'll be a big challenge to be a part of that elusive 8%. I'll have to learn as I go forward and find a business model that works because at the end of the day, the biggest challenge for me is to make VozzApp a success. Your backing wouldn't guarantee success, but it sure would push us just a little bit closer to it.

Other Ways You Can Help

I get it. Times are tough. You might have just donated your last $100 to the Greek Bailout Fund or your cousin's pet frog's plastic surgery. Sometimes you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get notified the second we launch VozzApp.
  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Here's a quick link to post on Facebook: Share http://igg.me/at/vozzapp/x/10803721 on Facebook. How often do you get to share a campaign that's being run by a teenager ;) Use the Indiegogo share tools will you.
  • Like VozzApp on Facebook, or follow us on Instagram, or Twitter for live updates on how and what this startup's doing.

story:
From the Rubble

There is no shortage of crowdfunding campaigns aimed at helping the people of Nepal. Some projects seek general assistance in addressing a wide range of needs and that's great. We don't wish to detract from any other causes in Nepal or elsewhere, but this project is very specific.

The villagers in the area of Goganpani (+/- 150 families) have had all but two of the hard structures in their region destroyed by the recent earthquakes. At the moment most are contentedly sheltered in tents made of re-purposed rice bags and other plastic. These are a resilient people who do not bemoan their poor fortune or demand that anyone take responsibility for their survival. Under normal circumstances, if one or two families were to fall upon a devastating hardship and lose their home, the rest of the community would address the need collectively and life would go on.

(The region of Goganpani)

These are not normal circumstances however. The extent of the destruction is so complete that it's extremely difficult to even begin the process of rebuilding. Everyone is in need. No one is positioned to absorb the devastation of their neighbor. They are eager to rebuild their modest homes from the leftover rubble, but find themselves constrained not only by a lack of materials, but also by the looming threat of severe weather. The monsoons are coming.


A Roof Over Your Head

Our goal in this fundraising effort is not to completely replace the destroyed homes of Goganpani with perfect new houses. The people of Goganpani are not looking to gain from this disaster, but in order for them to rebuild their homes over the coming months they have to be sheltered from the nonstop monsoon rains that will begin in June and continue through September. We are simply trying to give them a semi-dry environment to live and work while they rebuild their lives.

We've arrived at our campaign goal via the following basic math:

  • 150 families
  • Steel roof panels priced at $50 USD for 6 pieces
  • Each family requires 10-12 panels to cover a very modest, roughly square-shaped home
  • 12 panels ($100 USD) x 150 families = $15,000 + Indiegogo's 4% fee = $15,600


The Impact

Please consider for a moment, the prospect of living outdoors in a continuous torrential downpour. Consider sleeping, eating, managing your hygiene and caring for the elderly and young children whilst completely exposed to the elements.

Now consider the relief you would feel the moment the rain stopped hitting your face. Consider the calm that would come over you as you were finally able to dry off and resume 'almost' normal life. You now have the ability to help give another human being that sense of relief and peace.

(These ^^^ are representative of the roof panels we need to buy)

We are not looking to end world hunger, or reverse climate change or address every social injustice on Earth. We aren't even looking to address the full scope of needs in Nepal, or even all the needs in Goganpani.

This crowdfunding campaign is focused solely on getting families out of the rain so that they can begin to rebuild their homes and community. It is our hope that by addressing this key structural need, the families of Goganpani can regain the capacity to address their remaining needs as self-sufficiently as possible.


Who are we?

The collective "we/our" I keep referring to in this narrative are my friend Sadhu Ram Thapa (and family) and myself, Guy Valente (and family). 


I am an American, currently working for a UN common system organization in the Netherlands. Sadhu is a budding entrepreneur from Goganpani, Dhading Nepal, who was hard at work promoting his upstart travel and tourism enterprise, "Skylord Travels & Tours PVT. LTD." when the recent earthquakes disrupted everything. We're coordinating this together.



Sadhu and I met back in 2011 in Kandahar, Afghanistan. I was managing the Medical Crash Crew Services department at Kandahar Airfield and Sadhu was one of the ambulance drivers. We've obviously both moved on from there but we've maintained our friendship through the wonderful world of social media!

Naturally, when the earthquakes struck I reached out to Sadhu to make sure he was okay and to see if he needed anything. That's how I learned of the basic needs of Sadhu's community. While I had no experience with 'crowdfunding', I understood the basic idea and asked Sadhu if he wanted to give it a try. He was game for anything, so here we are.


How can you be sure this isn't a scam?

I suppose that's a hard one. We are just two friends, not a registered 501(c)3 or anything like that. I did not anticipate starting a crowdfunding campaign until about two weeks ago, so I can't point to a long list of donors and a history of relief projects I've funded - no such list exists.

I can tell you that we are promoting this campaign most heavily through our own social network and perhaps also on my (infrequently updated) blog. As such, if you're reading this there's a good chance that you either know me AND Sadhu, know me OR Sadhu, or know someone who knows me and/or Sadhu, etc, etc, etc.

Ultimately however, I'm going to ask you to have faith in the decency of other human beings right now. This whole thing is an exercise in hope.



Other Ways to Help

While any contribution is helpful, we understand that not everyone is able to help in that way. If you can't manage any monetary support we'd kindly ask you to:
  • Use the Indiegogo sharing tools
  • Promote the cause on your social media networks 
  • Get the word to your friends, family, co-workers, employer, etc.


Thanks for reading this. We appreciate your compassion.
Sincerely,
Sadhu and Guy

story:
Hi everybody

My name is Birman Shrestha. I spent almost all my childhood in poverty that is why I moved to Kathmandu, my country's capital, after my school in search of better opportunities. When I left home, my mom gave me about $5 (thank you, my lovely mom). She gave me the only money she had at the time. After a few weeks, I spent all the money and I found myself without food or shelter, but thank God I got a job in a garment factory for $5 per month, with no food or insurance included. I was honest and strong, I struggled a lot. Maybe because of that, I trust myself and I have received support for further studies. I ended up graduating from Art College. I came to the job market as an artist. I did so many activities that helped me learn more and make myself stronger. Now I am 31 years old, married with 2 children living in Slovenia.

The current situation in Nepal makes me very sad. A lot of people lost their houses and family members. Among of that, my family and my village were one of that too. In my village there is almost 60 houses and one school. We lost everything in the first earthquake (25-04-15).

That's the reason why this community collect was opened in order to raise funds and help rebuild my village and my school. To give to these children new opportunities so they don't have to go through what I have been through.

I would be really happy and thankful to you if I can collect as much money as possible. I will provide food and basic needs for everyone in the village and also help to rebuild houses and the school.

And step by step I would drum up my neighbors of my village and develop the culture of helping each other, teaching different activities and inviting guests from different countries to show the culture which I will teach and make a welcome program. I will make arrangements and guests will stay in our village with my people in their houses.

I also would like to send a nice handmade picture-postcard to who colaborate with $50 or more. Incase I couldn't reach to collect that much money I would like to return back that money to the person who try to support us.

As I mentioned before, I had a lot of difficulties and I don't want this for the children of my village. I wish that every child can easily go to the school which we will rebuild and learn different activities which make them stronger and confident.

You can locate my village here: https://goo.gl/maps/rhixg

Thank you for your time and collaboration. :)

story:
Short Summary

In December 2015, an arts partnership that has enriched the learning of students at the Blackstone Innovation School in Boston will cross-oceans and cultures to inspire children at the Light in Africa orphanage through art.

A small group representing the core of the Blackstone arts partnership -- Sara Mraish Demeter, founder and executive director of Art Resource Collaborative for Kids, Blackstone principal Danielle Morrissey, Blackstone art teacher Olivia Chaffee, and Blackstone Multiple-Disabilities Strand Specialist Michelle Blanchard -- will lead a workshop based on ARCK’s curriculum with the goal of making a multi-sensory arts experience accessible for orphaned children with varied abilities.

This partnership will take place at Light in Africa Children’s Home in Kilimanjaro, Tanzania. Light in Africa was founded in 2000 when Mama Lynn Elliot felt a calling to help children and communities impacted by HIV/AIDS and other medical conditions in Tanzania. Since then about 35,000 children and adults have been assisted in the Mt. Kilimanjaro area. Mama Lynn runs nine children homes. Each home addresses the needs of infants and children with special needs, complex needs and homelessness, as well as malnutrition and various health ailments. The population of her children is similar to those at the Blackstone. Light in Africa provides children with access to a food kitchen and medical outreach as well as, education, vocational training, and most of all love.

Sara, Danielle, Olivia and Michelle wish to teach a week-long workshop that uses reading, writing, storytelling and painting as a means to foster hope, give children a safe environment to explore self-expression, and help orphaned children rebuild their lives. The workshop, titled, “Storybook through Art” aims to utilize a book of children’s choosing to help them gain understanding through various modes of learning -- primarily reading, writing, visual art, and performance. The team will lead storytelling workshops, then work with children to illustrate their own stories and read the books aloud to the kids. They aspire to close the education gap by using a non-traditional learning environment designed towards giving children the skills to learn as well as the motivation to do so. In addition, this program is going to be accessible to all students of age and ability at the orphanage due to the accommodations and modifications that will be provided under the discretion of Michelle Blanchard.

In turn, this experience will carry over to the Blackstone Innovation School community in many ways. Foremost, the staff at Blackstone will be positively impacted by this experience. Our journey will be documented on a live, interactive blog. Staff will be able to follow our experience and progress as it unfolds. Then, upon arrival back to the United States, Danielle, Olivia, and Michelle will lead a professional development session to report their findings and ultimately share their experience with the Blackstone community, highlighting beneficial components they learned that can be incorporated into our daily instruction since we service a similar population of children.

Secondly, our scholars will be directly impacted by this experience. To help increase global awareness and education of our students at Blackstone, we will provide supplemental lessons and materials to three different areas of our school wide instruction: social studies, art, and grade 3 Engage New York ELA module 1.  In social studies, we will provide a unit of instruction on African culture, consisting of artifacts and photographs to accurately portray the culture. In art, Olivia will implement a unit on African tribal art and will expose students to this unique craft and also allow them to create their own. In ELA, specifically In Module 1 for grade Engage New York curriculum, the focus of study is how books are brought to children all over the world. Our experience and knowledge of bringing literacy to the orphanage in Africa will supplement this unit, and provide a differentiated and unique experience solely for students at Blackstone.

Lastly, to maintain these units of study, and to also maintain our partnership with Light of Africa, we will be identifying the orphanage as a sister school. Through consistent and ongoing communication, and by maintaining the relationships we will have built as a result of the work we complete, we will utilize our sister school as a resource that will continue to increase the global awareness and knowledge that our Blackstone scholars receive. Ways in which we will utilize our sister partnership includes, but is not limited to, creating a pen-pal program to deepen our students’ experience and ground them in the work they are doing, and to also support the educational needs at Light in Africa as they work to strengthen their school and the experiences they can provide their students.


Your donation will help them buy books, and materials for the students as well as provide delivery of the materials to Tanzania, printing, other resources, and fund the training and support of volunteers. Most importantly your donation will allow us to continue the program once a week for four months after we have left. This will allow 40-80 orphanage children to heal and learn creatively through arts and literacy. Art Therapy is one of the most effective ways to reduce stress levels in children. Developmental theories state that most children do not fully develop verbal skills until adolescence. Art is one of the only ways children can accurately express emotions and communicate with the people around them.

Please donate to help inspire the children in Light in Africa to heal through our program


FACT: Studies tested cortisol, an indicator of prolonged high stress levels, in children and saw a decrease in cortisol after art therapy sessions.


What We Need & What You Get

We need $6,000 to fund this trip: Danielle and Sara are purchasing their own tickets from their own personal funds: However, we are trying to raise money for the teachers : Olivia and Michelle to cover their airfare as tickets are costly. We need to purchase materials which will include papers, books, and art supplies as well as pay for fees to ship the materials to Tanzania.  

Your donation will help us buy books, and materials for the students as well as provide delivery of the materials to Tanzania, printing, other resources, and fund the training and support of volunteers. Most importantly your donation will allow us to continue the program once a week for four months after we have left. This will allow 40-80 orphanage children to heal and learn creatively through arts and literacy. Art Therapy is one of the most effective ways to reduce stress levels in children. Developmental theories state that most children do not fully develop verbal skills until adolescence. Art is one of the only ways children can accurately express emotions and communicate with the people around them.

Please donate to help inspire the children in Light in Africa to heal through our program. 

If we raise more than the requested $6,000, the remaining funds will be donated to Light in Africa to assist with their school fees.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. Please help us spread the word about our expeditionary learning trip. Let your friends and families know about ways to get involved.

 If you'd like to donate art materials (paper, paint, brushes etc...) we will be happy to accept those as well.

story:
We save lives, reduce injury and decrease fear from natural hazards through educating and preparing those in harm's way.

SUMMARY

Volunteer experts from In Harm's Way collaborate with local Indonesian leaders, college students and scientists to educate at least 1000 school children and their families in earthquake and tsunami survival skills.

Check out this interview with founder, Ron Harris, to learn more about the aims of In Harm's Way . http://www.byuradio.org/episode/1a8baca5-93fb-426e-8efb-abe1decfea0d?playhead=755&autoplay=true

WAVES JAVA

To prevent loss of life from tsunamis, In Harm's Way in collaboration with Geoscientists Without Borders seeks to involve 4 US students in a tsunami disaster mitigation initiative in Java, Indonesia. These students will train Indonesian counterparts how to:  

  • Assess natural hazards in their communities

  • Involve local communities in effective educational outreach

  • Assist in implementing proven disaster mitigation strategies.

The project, Waves Java, involves experts in disaster mitigation from universities in the US and Indonesia.

THE CHALLENGE

The Indonesian earthquake and tsunami of 2004 resulted in more than 250,000 deaths.  The majority of the deaths and damage from these events could have been prevented if those in harm's way would have known about the risk and implemented protective measures. For example, the more recent 2011 earthquake and tsunami in Japan affected more people but resulted in fewer than 1/10 as many deaths.

The challenge of In Harm's Way is to prevent natural disasters like these from happening in areas of known risk, but few resources. For this reason, In Harm's Way was established--to bridge the gap between what science is discovering about natural disaster prevention and the lack of knowledge of the common people at risk. In Harm's Way ensures people have the appropriate education and skills to protect themselves and therefore, dramatically decrease loss of life.

WHY JAVA?

The Java coast is one of the most densely populated places on Earth with an average of 1000 people per square kilometer.  It is also located in one of the most active earthquake zones in the world. Historical records and geologic features document that Java has been struck many times by recurring mega-earthquakes and tsunamis. Another earthquake-generated tsunami will inevitably hit this region.


HOW WE SOLVE THE PROBLEM

Forecasting Accurately.  Local experts collaborate with In Harm's Way to determine the history of tsunamis in coastal cities, construct computer models of past tsunami events to determine the potential damage from future tsunamis, and create tsunami flooding maps of the most densely populated cities of the coast. 

Communicate the Risk.  In Harm's Way helps local experts communicate to local leaders and citizens the risk level of their communities. 

Educate the Vulnerable.  In Harm's Way conducts a tsunami education campaign with local leadership support in the local school system and community. Families, teachers, administrators & students alike learn the basics of 1) how tsunamis and earthquakes occur and 2) how to prepare before, survive during, and respond afterwards.

Empower Solutions.  In Harm's Way supports community leaders and citizens to implement tsunami risk reduction methods by 1) establishing evacuation routes, 2) conducting regular evacuation drills and 3) creating tsunami-safe zones.

OUTCOME:  1000 school children and their families will learn how to survive a major earthquake, how to recognize the signs of an oncoming tsunami, how to evacuate safely and how to protect their families.

LONG-TERM IMPACT

This project will greatly reduce the disaster potential of communities along the Java coast. Those educated will prevent future loss of life and property to the next major earthquake and/or tsunami. Building resilience through preventative strategies is the key to a more stable, safer future.

Why invest in WAVES JAVA?

You will:

        Reduce the disaster potential of 6 Java regions

        Prevent loss of life of 1000s of Indonesians

        Build resilience & self-reliance of at least 1000 families

        Foster empowerment of at least 1000 school children

        Diminish economic losses

       Minimize the need for relief efforts and funds  

MEET THE TEAM: 

Several international scientists, with decades of experience in natural disaster mitigation, volunteer their time and expertise to combine best practices. Our combined efforts have already saved thousands of lives.

•Dr. Ron Harris, PhD, has conducted geological research in Indonesia for 27 years and published 35 papers on geological issues there. Harris speaks Indonesian and is primarily responsible for leading the expeditions.  http://geology.byu.edu/home/content/Faculty%20Directory/ron-harris

•Daniel Horns, PhD, (Associate Dean, Utah Valley University) specializes in paleo-seismology and trenching techniques. He is primarily responsible for training students in tsunami deposit excavations.  http://www.uvu.edu/profpages/profiles/show/vid/1000 9356

•Carolus Prasetyadi, PhD, is a Professor at Universitas Pembangunan Nasional (UPN) in central Java. He co-founded the Center for Natural Disaster Mitigation at UPN. His primary role is to coordinate and supervise the mentoring activities of the Indonesian students from UPN working with each of the professionals on the project.

•Rachel Dunn (BSc. Geology) will be primarily responsible for collaborating with Indonesian students to integrate data into inundation maps and train them to use Ground Penetrating RADAR (GPR) for exploring the extent of tsunami deposits in the subsurface. She will also lead the community outreach collaboration.

•Nova Roosmawati (MSc. geology) is an Indonesian geologist who has worked with Drs. Harris and Prasetyadi in disaster mitigation research since 1997. Nova’s primary role is to direct project logistics and coordinate student mentoring.

•Juliana Fretha (BSc. civil engineering, MSc. disaster mitigation) is a member of staff for BPBD, the Indonesian government disaster mitigation agency. She is one of the leaders of the disaster prevention education program for BPBD and will be primarily responsible for community involvement in ground-checking inundation maps. 

•Steve Fellows, PhD, is a geology professor at Utah Valley University who will lead and conduct the G

round P

enetrating RADAR (GPR) survey at each site to image potential tsunami deposits underground that the team will

 trench and investigate in detail. http://www.uvu.edu/profpages/profiles/show/user_id/15464

•Leslie Angeningsih, PhD, focuses her research on community-level disaster preparedness and mitigation. Her primary role is to coordinate with educators and students from the areas we will visit to develop and deliver effective tsunami hazards presentations and conduct evacuation drills.

•Dr. Chad Emmett, PhD, is a social geographer who focuses on women’s roles in natural disaster mitigation. He has led projects in Java and E. Indonesia that focus on resilience to natural hazards and construction of safe schools.  https://fhssfaculty.byu.edu/FacultyPage.aspx?id=cfe 

•Jared Whitehead, PhD, is applied an mathematician with expertise in geophysical fluid dynamics and modeling of earth systems. His primary role is training students in how to use GeoClaw software to develop tsunami models for various earthquake rupture scenarios along the Java Trench. http://math.byu.edu/wp-content/uploads/2013/10/Whitehead-CV.pdf

•Eko Yulianto, PhD, is a Chief Scientist at the Indonesian Institute of Science (LIPI). He is the lead tsunami paleo-seismologist in Indonesia and has identified several possible tsunami deposits across Java, Bali and Lombok. Dr. Yulianto’s primary role will be training students how to excavate and analyze tsunami deposits.  http://sivitas.lipi.go.id/ekoy001/
The Board: 
Ron Harris 
Jim Murphy 
Brad Harris
Daniel Horns 
Kim Jones 
Carolyn Wright 

In 2013, our team conducted needed research and created a disaster mitigation team at the local university. Large strides were made, but your donation is needed to make the impact envisioned to save lives through resilience at the local level.

Visit http://inharmswayhelp.org/ to learn more about In Harm's Way.
story_txt:
We save lives, reduce injury and decrease fear from natural hazards through educating and preparing those in harm's way.


SUMMARY
Volunteer experts from In Harm's Way collaborate with local Indonesian leaders, college students and scientists to educate at least 1000 school children and their families in earthquake and tsunami survival skills.
Check out this interview with founder, Ron Harris, to learn more about the aims of In Harm's Way . http://www.byuradio.org/episode/1a8baca5-93fb-426e-8efb-abe1decfea0d?playhead=755&autoplay=true
WAVES JAVA
To prevent loss of life from tsunamis, In Harm's Way in collaboration with Geoscientists Without Borders seeks to involve 4 US students in a tsunami disaster mitigation initiative in Java, Indonesia. These students will train Indonesian counterparts how to:  


Assess natural hazards in their communities
Involve local communities in effective educational outreach 
Assist in implementing proven disaster mitigation strategies.

The project, Waves Java, involves experts in disaster mitigation from universities in the US and Indonesia.


THE CHALLENGE

The Indonesian earthquake and tsunami of 2004 resulted in more than 250,000 deaths.  The majority of the deaths and damage from these events could have been prevented if those in harm's way would have known about the risk and implemented protective measures. For example, the more recent 2011 earthquake and tsunami in Japan affected more people but resulted in fewer than 1/10 as many deaths.
The challenge of In Harm's Way is to prevent natural disasters like these from happening in areas of known risk, but few resources. For this reason, In Harm's Way was established--to bridge the gap between what science is discovering about natural disaster
prevention and the lack of knowledge of the common people at
risk. In Harm's Way ensures people have the appropriate education and skills to protect themselves and therefore, dramatically decrease loss of life.
WHY JAVA?

The Java coast is one of the most densely populated places on Earth with an average of 1000 people per square kilometer.  It is also located in one of the most active earthquake zones in the world. Historical records and geologic features document that Java has been struck many times by recurring mega-earthquakes and tsunamis. Another earthquake-generated tsunami will inevitably hit this region.


HOW WE SOLVE THE PROBLEM


Forecasting Accurately.  Local experts collaborate with In Harm's Way to determine the history of tsunamis in coastal cities, construct computer models of past tsunami events to determine the potential damage from future tsunamis, and create tsunami flooding maps of the most densely populated cities of the coast. 
Communicate the Risk.  In Harm's Way helps
local experts communicate to local leaders and citizens the risk level of their
communities. 
Educate the Vulnerable.  In Harm's Way conducts a tsunami education campaign with local
leadership support in the local school system and community. Families,
teachers, administrators & students alike learn the basics of 1) how
tsunamis and earthquakes occur and 2) how to prepare before, survive during, and
respond afterwards.
Empower Solutions.  In Harm's Way supports community leaders and
citizens to implement tsunami risk reduction methods by 1) establishing
evacuation routes, 2) conducting regular evacuation drills and 3) creating
tsunami-safe zones.
OUTCOME:  1000
school children and their families will learn how to survive a major
earthquake, how to recognize the signs of an oncoming tsunami, how to evacuate
safely and how to protect their families.


LONG-TERM IMPACT
This project will greatly reduce the disaster potential of communities along the Java coast. Those educated will prevent future loss of life and property to the next major earthquake and/or tsunami. Building resilience through preventative strategies is the key to a more stable, safer future.
Why invest in WAVES JAVA?
You will:

        Reduce the disaster potential of 6 Java regions
        Prevent loss of life of 1000s of Indonesians
        Build resilience & self-reliance of at least 1000 families
        Foster empowerment of at least 1000 school children
        Diminish economic losses
       Minimize the need for relief efforts and funds  






MEET THE TEAM: 


Several international scientists, with decades of experience
in natural disaster mitigation, volunteer their
time and expertise to combine best practices. Our combined efforts have already
saved thousands of lives.

•Dr. Ron Harris, PhD, has conducted geological research in Indonesia for 27 years and published 35 papers on geological issues there. Harris speaks Indonesian and is primarily responsible for leading the expeditions.  http://geology.byu.edu/home/content/Faculty%20Directory/ron-harris
•Daniel Horns, PhD, (Associate Dean, Utah Valley University) specializes in paleo-seismology and trenching techniques. He is primarily responsible for training students in tsunami deposit excavations.  http://www.uvu.edu/profpages/profiles/show/vid/1000 9356

•Carolus Prasetyadi, PhD, is a Professor at Universitas Pembangunan Nasional (UPN) in central Java. He co-founded the Center for Natural Disaster Mitigation at UPN. His primary role is to coordinate and supervise the mentoring activities of the Indonesian students from UPN working with each of the professionals on the project.
•Rachel Dunn (BSc. Geology) will be primarily responsible for collaborating with Indonesian students to integrate data into inundation maps and train them to use Ground Penetrating RADAR (GPR) for exploring the extent of tsunami deposits in the subsurface. She will also lead the community outreach collaboration.
•Nova Roosmawati (MSc. geology) is an Indonesian geologist who has worked with Drs. Harris and Prasetyadi in disaster mitigation research since 1997. Nova’s primary role is to direct project logistics and coordinate student mentoring.

•Juliana Fretha (BSc. civil engineering, MSc. disaster mitigation) is a member of staff for BPBD, the Indonesian government disaster mitigation agency. She is one of the leaders of the disaster prevention education program for BPBD and will be primarily responsible for community involvement in ground-checking inundation maps. 

•Steve Fellows, PhD, is a geology professor at Utah Valley University who will lead and conduct the G
round Penetrating RADAR (GPR) survey at each site to image potential tsunami deposits underground that the team will
 trench and investigate in detail. http://www.uvu.edu/profpages/profiles/show/user_id/15464

•Leslie
Angeningsih, PhD, focuses her research on community-level disaster
preparedness and mitigation. Her primary role is to coordinate with
educators and students from the areas we will visit to develop and deliver
effective tsunami hazards presentations and conduct evacuation drills.
•Dr. Chad
Emmett, PhD, is a social geographer who focuses on women’s roles
in natural disaster mitigation. He has led projects in Java and E.
Indonesia that focus on resilience to natural hazards and construction of
safe schools.  https://fhssfaculty.byu.edu/FacultyPage.aspx?id=cfe 
•Jared Whitehead, PhD, is applied an mathematician with expertise in geophysical fluid dynamics and modeling of earth systems. His primary role is training students in how to use GeoClaw software to develop tsunami models for various earthquake rupture scenarios along the Java Trench. http://math.byu.edu/wp-content/uploads/2013/10/Whitehead-CV.pdf
•Eko Yulianto, PhD, is a Chief Scientist at the Indonesian Institute of Science

identified several possible tsunami deposits across Java, Bali and
Lombok. Dr. Yulianto’s primary role will be training students how to
