story:
Our Story

As someone that has been brought up on Hip Hop music, I know how much impact it has on our lives. A lot of you Hip Hop Heads might not realise it anymore, but so many things you do - the way you talk, how you act, your swag have been influenced by Hip Hop music.

I live in London and travel to New York City fairly often. Off the bat there is a big difference in culture. I mean a couple of years ago, the day after I arrived J. Cole played a surprise performance in New York. I got there within' 10 minutes of his tweet announcing the location and was already 300 people back in the queue. I remember thinking to myself: "This would never happen for Hip Hop in London". But then a year later, J. Cole bought the Dollar and a Dream tour over here and did the same thing. It was amazing! Of late artists such as Kanye West and Drake have been embracing UK Hip Hop (we call it Grime). Just a few weeks ago a huge UK Grime artists, Skepta had a surprise concert in a car park! (Something he said he would do one day, about two years ago.)

This is something I've been waiting to happen for ages; US and UK Hip Hop culture to come together. We've already heard a couple songs with Krept & Konan with Rick Ross and Jeremih - no one can tell me those weren't straight fire. And I know you're all waiting for that Kanye X Skepta to come out.

I just want to be able to take this opportunity where Hip Hop is at a new golden age with these new legends and make something for the people, by the people.


New Legendz

First of all we have an Instagram and Snapchat. You can add us, the username for both is new.legendz

Hip Hop is an ever evolving culture. I've always liked the phrase "What is a celebrity without their fans?" But here at New Legendz we don't see it as rappers and listeners. Or athletes and fans. We see it as one big community. After all, it is you that has some Dre Beats or those fresh new Yeezy's. 

Instagram
So we use Instagram as a means of getting information to people. There are a million sites and twitter accounts that you can follow that will give you a download link to a song or leaked album. That's not what we're here from. We don't want your hits. We want your opinions. You wont be suckered into someone's website with us, with a hundred pop ups as soon as you hit download. We post relevant information. You'll get to see the best bits of a concert, not some rubbish view where you can't even hear the performer. You'll get the pictures that are making waves through the net, not every repost we could possibly spam you with from every artist out. We condense the information and get it out to you. We will also have a Twitter account soon, but that is only to redirect you to other places where you can hear new music or see new videos that we can't show you in a 15 second Instagram clip. We really want this experience to be tailored to your day, not a hindrance to it.

Snapchat
We created a Snapchat account so that you get your information as soon as possible. Let me assure you know, we won't be having 300 second stories (unless there is a dope concert going on and we want you to be part of that live). If a song drops, it will come straight to your phone. If Drake or Beyonce decide to release a brand new album out of nowhere, you will be the first to know. Any Hip Hop related events like the Yeezy raffles or surprise car park shows will be straight to your phone. 

New Legendz Website
OUR LEGENDZ - Like I said before, there are a million Hip Hop blogs out there keeping you in the know. Well that's what our Instagram and Snapchat are for. Our website will be almost run by you guys. Exclusively think pieces. We want to get the opinions of you guys out to the world. We want to know why J. Cole got you out of bed. We want to know why you switched from Spotify to Tidal. We want to know why you just spent £100 to see Beyonce for 90 minutes of your life. Of course the website will be regularly updated by us, giving you our insights into the game, but we think it's important that this site is for the people. We want to build a community

NEW LEGENDZ - We will also be bringing new artists to the scene. There is so much talent out there who can’t get off the ground because they need backing from a major label. Although we are not a label, we will be able to give them the platform and recognition they need to succeed. After all, Macklemore and Ryan Lewis made a multi-platinum album without any help. We are currently working with some small artists who have EP’s coming out soon on itunes.

We hope to have the website up by July.

New Legendz - Club Nights
We have found that although the UK has some pretty good hip hop nights in terms of music and DJs, there has never been much atmosphere and hype around them. We want to start a club night which follows through. The next day you can go online and re live the night. We'll have exclusive merch that you can only get at that specific night. We want to bring in performers so you're not just stuck with a DJ all night long. Not only will we get known artists but we want to bring in local up and coming artists showcasing their talent. Hopefully we can have our first night up and running for freshers weeks - when students start university.

So why do we need the money?
We wish we could provide you with all this for free. But it's just too damn hard. The upkeep of such a constant stream of information is tiring. It takes a lot out of our day. Personally, I'm a student and will be at the forefront. I've got to balance all this with schoolwork in hopes of getting a degree. Please don't let this discourage you from our movement, I assure you, I and the whole team are 100% behind New Legendz. It is something we all hold dear to our hearts.

What will we spend the money on?
I'm not going to try and sell you the idea, I'm sure you know exactly what we are offering you. So here is a few things that your money will be going towards.
-Starting and up-keeping a website with constant traffic.
-Event tickets such as concerts and special shows.
-Producing merchandise that is influenced by the culture. Not some huge clothing brand, but just something that is unique. Something that you can wear every now and then where people will definitely ask where you get them from.
-Equipment needed to document and convey all these events that happen

Risks and challenges
I only see one challenge that comes with this task and that is balancing this project with school. So I'm not in high school, I've just finished high school. I'm 18 years old and will be going to University for the next three years of my life. So it's not like I am constantly working 24/7 on school work. Honestly, I will probably be putting more hours into this project. It's much easier to pursue something you're passionate about. It's not a chore to run this project. It will be something I always want to be working on no matter what.

We know that not everyone is able to contribute; no matter how much they support something. If you can't contribute now we totally understand and know you will support us in another way while we build this collective. If you could share this on Facebook, Twitter, Snapchat, Myspace, Bebo, anything! That would be a massive help for us.
We appreciate you taking the time to take a look at what we hope to be a very impactful movement in years to come.

story:
Short Summary

No one deserves to be abused.  Many people, however, do not understand how subtle emotional-psychological abuse can be.  By the time victims are hit, many of them may, ironically, already believe they deserve it.

Emotional-psychological abuse almost always precedes physical abuse; however one does not have to be physically harmed to experience a lifetime of abusive manipulation and control.

What we need

We need your help to raise money to produce this game! It teaches professional staff to the way abusers and victims behave.  We want to make it available to shelters, treatments centers, and therapists everywhere!

Funds from this campaign will assist us in producing/printing the game, marketing it and paying fees associated with production. Every dollar helps!

The Impact

This game is designed to be played by 5 people or teams.  Most victims only share the “tip of the iceberg” with friends, family and coworkers.  This game experientially portrays the underlying realities that cause victims to be so circumspect.

Players will learn more about the dynamics of intimate partner/domestic abuse and violence in a way that is safe, challenging and, dare we say, fun!

The Challenge

Just the words ”Domestic Violence” scare people away.  Nobody wants to deal with it.  We aim to change society!  We’re working hard to end violence one game piece, one person, one community at a time!

Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Help to get the word out and make some noise about "OUTrage".

Share the IndieGoGo Campaign with everyone you know!

And that's all there is to it.

Thank you For Your Time and Thank You in advance!


“I deal with Domestic Violence every day in my work.  I like to feel I have empathy for the victims, but this game made me realize even more how the children of Domestic Violence are victimized by the system as well as the abuser.  I think this would be a great way for Police Departments to work with teens and preteens in schools.  As well as people who work with victims at all stages.” Carmen J.


Dear Fans and Supporters,

We need your help to raise money to produce this game!

It teaches professional staff the way abusers and victims behave. We want to make it available to shelters, treatments centers, and therapists everywhere!

All it takes is a small donation!

Thank you for your support!

Carl W. Mangold, LCSW, LISAC and Stephanie Angelo, SPHR, SCP

story:
Bottom Line - up front!


I'm seeking contributions that will primarily be used to develop infrastructure and apply smart technology, which helps me deliver my #equinefacilitatedlearning workshops and programmes more widely, efficiently and effectively.  

Development of infrastructure is now crucial to growth and to meeting client expectations in a safe, functional and appropriate environment. This lays the foundation for me to finally take up invitations to run workshops and programmes overseas, growing the business outside New Zealand too. 


My story...


G'Day, I'm Jason - The Naked Horseman

I've spent most of my professional life helping to grow leaders and people, so I  love this venture – especially sharing the buzz with clients from the moments where struggle suddenly makes sense. Through interactive equine-facilitated workshops and programmes, I teach leadership to illustrate key messages about communication, behaviour and interaction.


As a leader, I believe your fundamental obligation is to your people - before anything else; without that being right, everything is harder. When the circumstances are challenging and things aren’t going the way you planned, as a leader I've not only learned how to think my way through problems, but also that it's the quality of the bonds with the team of people around you that will help you to lead well and get out of the tricky situation. I'm grateful to all those along the way who taught me and this is my way of paying it forward.


Being around horses and working with them has always reached something visceral in me. I've grown to appreciate how fantastic horses are at helping both me and other people learn how to enhance the ways in which we interact, especially when I overlay and apply modern technology to enhance teaching and feedback.  


What's with the horses?

The horse is a great vehicle (forgive the pun!) for teaching people about behaviour, interaction, and communication.   Horse and Human partnerships represents one of the oldest applications of technological connection! Horses provide endless examples for me to work with clients across the spectrum from small and medium sized businesses, to high-performance international sport coaches and key decision-makers in larger corporate organisations. 


In this short video clip, my client (a senior manager by profession) came to me looking for help with the way he interacts and engages with people. There was a lot of discussion between us prior to this early session and he gave me permission to show you this. You'll see him create a situation where the horse (purposely selected for this lesson) let's him know very clearly he's not happy with how the interaction is being  conducted.  Benny's a horse who doesn't respond well to anything he considers to be unreasonable!




You can see from the iPhone video, that Benny reacts to messaging that's unclear, and therefore unreasonable. My client continues to try and use force (via the rope and conveying a sense of the 'threat' of discipline). Benny isn’t too impressed by that and gives a number of building signals that something needs to change.  When that doesn't happen, well he does the only thing he thinks he can to make his point!


This is one of the things I really love, and that my clients come to understand - A horse doesn't care what reputation might have been built up around you, or how good a leader you might think you are.  The horse doesn’t care who you are, but best of all, a horse responds through the way you treat it – you have to earn credibility!  I'm proud to say that this client made incredible progress; it has even impacted on his relationship with his two sons. He describes himself as being almost unrecognisable now from his previous self as the result of the responsibility he took to seek help from me with making some behavioural changes and increasing his self-awareness - that's one of the reasons he was generous, and brave, in letting me show you an example of this work in practice. I'm very grateful to him for doing so and both he and I hope this helps provide you some context.


Nothing helps you learn a healthy dose of humility and patience like a horse. I use horses to help me because you have to earn the positive response...and it's not actually about the horse!



So why would you want to contribute?

You have the opportunity here to not only contribute to, but also to personally benefit from the development of a unique set of practical services.  Not only would you be part of having a positive impact on the people you interact with or lead, but you can help set the conditions where I can broaden access to my services - both within New Zealand, and internationally.      


When you think back to the short video, have you ever been treated badly by someone who was supposed to be a leader? Have you ever looked at someone struggling as a leader, and wished you could help? Do you know a remarkable young person who needs guidance and a chance to grow? Are you a leader wrestling with what that actually means? Perhaps you and others consider that you’re a fantastic leader - but you want to be even better?



Your contribution will help me to vastly accelerate the development and scope of a business that has already had significant positive impact on many different types of people - a parent suddenly realises there is a better way to interact with their child; it dawns on a CEO that there’s a better way to lead and work with fellow board members, or a sports coach realises the athlete is not a machine, but a human.  I've helped people deal more effectively with bullying bosses, and I've shown bullying bosses how to learn not to be. I've helped people lacking confidence find belief and empower themselves; I've coached managers to discover that there’s a better way to work with a team than they've been doing.  I've even helped small business owners find their way back to why they started with renewed passion. 



My business is all about helping the growth of your credibility as an individual and as a leader by focusing attention on your expertise, and your relationships. I’m committed to helping people tangibly improve through personal and professional development that's authentic.


If you value and yearn for personal and professional development that's immediately relevant, has enduring results and adds uncommon, genuine value; if you value an original approach that’s interactive, pragmatic, and works across cultures; if you value a proven approach that works across the spectrum from individuals to corporate groups, then you're invited to contribute.


You'll enable provision of leadership and personal development originating in New Zealand, and impacting Internationally!



I'm seeking contributions that will primarily be used to develop infrastructure that helps me deliver my workshops and programmes more widely,  efficiently and effectively.  Development of infrastructure is now crucial to growth and to meeting client expectations in a safe, functional and appropriate environment.  However, this lays the foundation for me to finally take up invitations to run workshops and programmes overseas. 


The incredible part for me is that my workshops scale and impact across both international and cultural boundaries. I've not only worked with New Zealanders (of various ethnic origin), but also people from Britain, Sweden, Ireland, Holland, The USA, South Korea, Australia, India and Germany.  


I can tell you it's been hard work, but I've already come a long way from operating in an empty paddock back in November 2011: The Property Progress Gallery



...roll forward to March 2015 - it's getting there!


What I need: 

I've an underpinning philosophy of not being greedy and of taking a lean approach to things. However, I’ve reached a point where the volume of business coming in means a typically understated New Zealand approach of ‘making do’ doesn’t cut it any more - I need to develop infrastructure beyond the basics I’ve established so far, and be smart with niche technology to add efficiency, but I need some help.


Contributions will be spent on:


A barn with a proper classroom for facilitation of discussion, rather than using my dining room! It might be similar in style to what's pictured below, but I understand funds raised will dictate the reality of the situation, and I'll manage accordingly. The barn will be centred on where the horse-float and shipping container are in this picture:



Horse-stalls (not dis-similar from these pictured) in which I can place horses to be groomed, rested or fed, AND SAFE between workshop sessions:



Development of my workshop and programme content to ensure strategic differentiation, and eventual overseas conduct of workshops and programmes (from 2017). I'm currently developing two new workshops: one on governance that will provide practical tools for directors, and another on cultural awareness. I also need to continue investment in brand development and marketing. 


A purpose built, well-drained, out-door arena enabling me to run my courses and workshops even when the ground gets wet! The picture's just an example of what it might look like when finished. Getting wet isn't the issue (it's part of the experience), but being in an un-flat, soggy paddock currently is!  This article, which I discovered in 2012, has been a useful reference for understanding the requirements and helping me plan realistically. 


Purchase of a Lily-Camera drone - overlaying technology to provide all-round state-of-the-art feedback! 

Using a tracking device for events or learning points I want to capture or to follow, after throwing the Lily high into the air, both the client and I then go about our activity. Lily flies around and shoots pictures or video all by itself.  The footage is not only played back in the classroom during our facilitated, specialist discussion  - but my client's will get to keep a DVD of themselves either as a memento, or as a key aid between sessions with me over the course of multiple workshops or a programme.

Incidentally, you can learn more about Lily here - it's a genius piece of kit, that's great value for money, from an exciting young company. What they've produced will add a fun, new dimension to things for me and especially my clients - with better results than I can achieve currently from a hand-held iPhone!


[In case you're worried, my horses will quickly learn to get used to the presence of the drones. Our neighbour is a commercial helicopter company - Amalgamated Helicopters. Whilst they are extremely considerate with their flight paths, the noise they can't help but create in fact helps me make nice, steady horses.  The Lily drone won't represent any sort of challenge for them!]   


The bottom line - what you get (in return for your contribution):


I'm offering contributors a number of perks, graduated relative to the contribution:

  • Some of these perks offer you the opportunity to experience my distinct services for yourself – I promise you’ll find the sample workshops representative, challenging and rewarding! I’ll work in partnership with you to develop unique training that helps you invest in the people and leaders in your life, or organisation.
  • Some of these perks offer you the opportunity to advertise your company or product with me for up to a 12 month period, or beyond by negotiation.
  • All of the perks involve assignment of a portion of your contribution to the scholarship programme I referred to earlier.
  • All contributions will be acknowledged on our social media and web-page. If there is a contribution level and perk outside those I've listed, please get in touch and we can discuss the detail. 
  • You have the opportunity to be part of the development of this proudly Wairarapa-born, but ambitiously international venture with me. Good things need investment just like young Montana here:  



Other Ways You Can Help

I appreciate that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help, if you would like to.  Please: 

  • Spread the word and help make me make some noise about this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools.
  • Send a link to this campaign on your Linked In, Facebook or Twitter sites.
  • Offer me input/advice because of an area of expertise you have.

And that's all there is to it...


Finally - what's in it for me?



At a personal level, being able to earn a living through a life with a sense of purpose has always been important; it’s enabled me to develop leading people in a way that draws on the opportunities I've been privileged to experience.  It involves giving something back as you go along – hence my real burning ambition to establish a scholarship programme, designed to lay good foundations in remarkable young people who will become the leaders of our future!


From a business perspective, I want to make a difference, and developing this adventure enables me to offer services, which do that in a distinctive, and authentic way.



If you want to know more about me running a workshop for you or your organisation, please visit my webpage and read about the services I can offer. 

You can also email me (nakedhorseman@tgle.co.nz), or tweet (@HorsemanThe) or connect with me on LinkedIn (Search First Name: The Naked Horseman). 


Thank you.


Required Disclaimer: 

In order to ensure this is not considered in New Zealand as presenting a campaign which may render me subject to payment hold by Pay Pal, I am required to state clearly that this is a non-monetary reward-based crowdfunding campaign. I'm also required to state that I will make every effort to provide the perks, but delivery is not guaranteed.  

You should note that I'm offering non-monetary rewards directly related to the campaign in return for funding. You have my word (I'm old fashioned like that) I will be in touch with all contributors regarding perks, if you provide me with an email address or contact number, on closure of the campaign. You should note that no perks will be delivered before 01 November 2015 (this will give me the right amount of time to establish the infrastructure I need and then host you appropriately).

story:
This fund has been set up under the joint collaboration of Sambhav Nepal, Ace the Himalaya and Ace Holidays.

Nepal is facing a heartbreaking situation because of the 7.8-magnitude earthquake that struck on April 25, 2015. The death toll has crossed 8,500 number  and more than 19,000 people are injured. The United Nations said more than 8 million people have been affected by the earthquake and at least 2 million have been displaced.

Image: An injured boy from the village of Lapu

And the most affected by this earthquake has been the children. UNICEF reports that more than 1.7 million children are in need of help. Not only the children lost their houses but also schools where they studied and dreamed of becoming a doctor, an engineer or a leader. Now they don't have a place where they can go to read, safely play with their friends and learn new things from their teachers. When a community loses a school, it loses a place to train and teach children; its way to move forward is blocked.

Image: Dharapani Secondary School in Gorkha after the earthquake

So, with the help of this fund, Nepali NGO Sambhav Nepal aims to rebuild schools that have been destroyed by the Nepal Earthquake. The schools will be earthquake-resistant. Building a school means building a community. Children will have a place to gather and learn, follow their dreams and take their community and nation forward.

The project will build about 35 earthquake-resistant schools; each one will cost roughly US$15,000 to make. The schools will benefit about 9,000 children.

The project is also supported by the generous clients of travel agencies Ace the Himalaya and Ace Holidays. Our goal is to raise US$500,000 for this purpose. The trekking operator Ace the Himalaya will make a donation of US$10,000 for US$500,000 raised.

Though this fund will be used mostly for rebuilding earthquake-resistant schools, water supply and other community facilities that enable prompt restoration of a community are also the focus.

Where the Fund Will Be Used

The project will target Arupokhari, Aruchanaute, Aru Arbang, Thumi, Lapu, Laprak and Manbu VDCs in Gorkha District close to the epicentre of the earthquake, in the remote hills about 160 to 200 km northwest of Kathmandu. The majority of Ace the Himalayas's guides, porters and other staff members come from these villages. 64 people have been killed in these villages. Over 90% of all structures in the villages are completely destroyed or seriously damaged.


Image: A damaged house in Arupokhari

Why Schools

One of the key matters Sambhav Nepal deal with is education. From the beginning, we have been working on improving the education situation in the remote villages of Gorkha, Nepal by building schools and libraries and conducting Teacher Training Programs. We also receive students from foreign universities who volunteer as teachers in the schools whose condition we try to uplift.

This recent earthquake destroyed a large number of school buildings and now children have to nowhere to go to study. UNICEF estimates nearly a million children won’t be able to return to their schools and receive education. Though the most urgent needs right now are food and a place to live, we felt that a project to rebuild schools has to be started. A single school can serve a whole community and help it to move forward. So, we initiated this long-term project and continue our mission of improving the education situation in the remote villages. And in this post-disaster period, schools haven’t got much attention.

For immediate relief, we have already provided 24,450 kg of rice, lentils and salt, and tarps and 3,720 roofing sheets in Gorkha. And to make relief distribution effective, our CSP Coordinator out on the field gathers information on where supplies are needed, how much and what sort of, and then we deliver relief to the victims.

Many small and large organizations like UNICEF, Save the Children and Help Nepal Network, good-intentioned individuals both inside and outside Nepal and our government themselves are also working day and night to provide relief. Though they haven’t reached to far-off villages yet because of difficult terrain, they will soon.

About Sambhav Nepal

Sambhav Nepal [http://www.sambhavnepal.org/] is a local Nepali government-registered NGO which has an excellent track record of 8 years working to achieve reforms in education and health and to improve living condition of Arupokhari and surrounding villages of Gorkha. The NGO, which has participated in past Australian Government programs, has strong governance and financial control including independent audit. It was active prior to the earthquake in Arupokhari and has integrity, local knowledge and local contacts needed to avoid the pitfalls and waste of big aid efforts.

This film briefly documents the beginning of Sambhav Nepal.


You can look at Sambhav Nepal's documents (support letters and registration and affiliation certificates) here: http://goo.gl/b8dTKO


About Prem K Khatry, Founder

Born in Gorkha, Prem K Khatry has helped to improve the standard of education, health and life in the remote villages of his home district through Sambhav Nepal. He is also a successful entrepreneur and runs travel companies. Besides, he serves as the Board Member of the Rotary Club of Mt. Everest, Lalitpur and the Rotary International has awarded him MPHF (Multiple Paul Harris Fellow) twice. Previously he was an executive committee Member of Trekking Agencies' Association of Nepal (TAAN). He had extensively travelled to different parts of the world including USA, Europe, South America, Russia and Singapore, and is also a member of American Society of Travel Agents (ASTA). You can find more information about him here: http://goo.gl/7sq67P

Where Else You Can Donate

You can also donate to Sambhav Nepal at the secure website of Rotary Australia World Community Service (RAWCS). EVERY CENT goes to the project. The Australian online donation made at RAWCS are tax deductible.

Link: https://donations.rawcs.com.au/Default.aspx?ProjectID=271&ReturnTo=4

Sambhav Nepal is supported  by the following organizations:

ARC - UNSW Global Village Volunteer Team

St Augustine's College Sydney

Rotary Australia World Community Service (RAWCS)

The Rotary Club of Wahroonga

The Rotary Club of Chatswood

The Rotary Club of Mt. Everest

Rotary Club of Kalamalka  Briitish Columbia, Canada

We request you to make a donation to any of the funds for schoolchildren-the most-affected victims of the Nepal Earthquake.  Be assured that your money will be used wisely and well. Every cent donated here goes directly to the project. The volunteers from ACE, their staff and other international volunteers do all the admin works.

Thank you very much for your support!

The schools will benefit about 9,000 children.The project is also supported by the generous clients of travel agencies Ace the Himalaya and Ace Holidays. Our goal is to raise US$500,000 for this purpose. The trekking operator Ace the Himalaya will make a donation of US$10,000 for US$500,000 raised.Though this fund will be used mostly for rebuilding earthquake-resistant schools, water supply and other community facilities that enable prompt restoration of a community are also the focus.Where the Fund Will Be UsedThe project will target Arupokhari, Aruchanaute, Aru Arbang, Thumi, Lapu, Laprak and Manbu VDCs in Gorkha District close to the epicentre of the earthquake, in the remote hills about 160 to 200 km northwest of Kathmandu. The majority of Ace the Himalayas's guides, porters and other staff members come from these villages. 64 people have been killed in these villages. Over 90% of all structures in the villages are completely destroyed or seriously damaged.Image: A damaged house in Arupokhari Why Schools One of the key matters Sambhav Nepal deal with is education. From the beginning, we have been working on improving the education situation in the remote villages of Gorkha, Nepal by building schools and libraries and conducting Teacher Training Programs. We also receive students from foreign universities who volunteer as teachers in the schools whose condition we try to uplift. This recent earthquake destroyed a large number of school buildings and now children have to nowhere to go to study. UNICEF estimates nearly a million children won’t be able to return to their schools and receive education. Though the most urgent needs right now are food and a place to live, we felt that a project to rebuild schools has to be started. A single school can serve a whole community and help it to move forward. So, we initiated this long-term project and continue our mission of improving the education situation in the remote villages. And in this post-disaster period, schools haven’t got much attention. For immediate relief, we have already provided 24,450  kg of rice, lentils and salt, and tarps and 3,720 roofing sheets in Gorkha. And to make relief distribution effective, our CSP Coordinator out on the field gathers information on where supplies are needed, how much and what sort of, and then we deliver relief to the victims. Many small and large organizations like UNICEF, Save the Children and Help Nepal Network, good-intentioned individuals both inside and outside Nepal and our government themselves are also working day and night to provide relief. Though they haven’t reached to far-off villages yet because of difficult terrain, they will soon. 
About Sambhav Nepal
Sambhav Nepal [http://www.sambhavnepal.org/] is a local
Nepali government-registered NGO which has an excellent track record of 8 years
working to achieve reforms in education and health and to improve living
condition of Arupokhari and surrounding villages of Gorkha. The NGO, which has
participated in past Australian Government programs, has strong governance and
financial control including independent audit. It was active prior to the
earthquake in Arupokhari and has integrity, local knowledge and local contacts
needed to avoid the pitfalls and waste of big aid efforts.This film briefly documents the beginning of Sambhav Nepal. You can look at Sambhav Nepal's documents (support letters and registration and affiliation certificates) here: http://goo.gl/b8dTKOAbout Prem K Khatry, FounderBorn in Gorkha, Prem K Khatry has helped to improve the standard of education, health and life in the remote villages of his home district through Sambhav Nepal. He is also a successful entrepreneur and runs travel companies. Besides, he serves as the Board Member of the Rotary Club of Mt. Everest, Lalitpur and the Rotary International has awarded him MPHF (Multiple Paul Harris Fellow) twice. Previously he was an executive committee Member of Trekking Agencies' Association of Nepal (TAAN). He had extensively travelled to different parts of the world including USA, Europe, South America, Russia and Singapore, and is also a member of American Society of Travel Agents (ASTA). You can find more information about him here: http://goo.gl/7sq67P Where Else You Can DonateYou can also donate to Sambhav Nepal at the secure website of Rotary Australia World Community Service (RAWCS). EVERY CENT goes to the project. The Australian online donation made at RAWCS are tax deductible.
Link:
https://donations.rawcs.com.au/Default.aspx?ProjectID=271&ReturnTo=4
Sambhav Nepal is supported  by the following organizations: 
ARC - UNSW Global Village Volunteer
Team
St Augustine's College Sydney
Rotary Australia World Community
Service (RAWCS)
The Rotary Club of Wahroonga
The Rotary Club of Chatswood 
The Rotary Club of Mt. EverestRotary Club of Kalamalka  Briitish Columbia, Canada
We request you to make a donation to any of the funds for
schoolchildren-the most-affected victims of the Nepal Earthquake.  Be assured that your money will be used
wisely and well. Every cent donated here goes directly to the project. The volunteers from ACE, their staff and other international volunteers do all the admin works. 
Thank you very much for your support!

story: Please help me teach the world woodworking and furniture design for free on the web. 3-D printers and robots could mean the end of craftsmanship! I have been a self-employed designer/craftsman for 47 years. I started working in 1968 when there were very few books on the subject and no films. Now technology has advanced to the point that one person truly could teach the world. I intend to do this by posting a 15-20 minute woodworking lesson once a week on YouTube for a year. (Youtube:SawedATL) That's 52 lessons starting with the very basics and ending with the very advanced. You may see examples of my work by visiting my website at www.woodguy.com.

story:
The magic of seeing other children on stage juggling, doing acrobatics, doing things they never imagined they could do, gives children in a war torn country, like Afghanistan, hope, enjoyment and the prospect of achievement.

Afghan Mobile Mini Circus for Children (MMCC) (www.AfghanMMCC.org) by its educational and entertaining activities has brought joy and laughter to over 3 million children in 28 provinces of Afghanistan since 2002. Making shows and workshops for children who have experienced enough of  war and organizing a Juggling Championship will be an inspiration to the whole country for making Afghanistan a happier place for children.

Help us to:

  1. Provide performing equipment, costumes, material, refreshment and trainers for 170 junior artists around Afghanistan for an entire year. These artists will make bigger and smaller Shows & workshops for tens of thousands of children who really need to laugh and be happy.
  2. Prepare and organise the 2015 Afghan National Juggling Championships in 5 regions and 24 locations in July and August.

What We Need:

Performing & Rehearsing Costumes  3400  USD
Performing Tools And Equipments 1100  USD
Refreshment 2150  USD
Staff & Trainers Salaries 2200  USD
Transports (For Performances & Championships) 1200  USD
Material & stationery (For Workshops) 1200  USD
130 Medals And Cups 1100  USD
Total: 12350 USD

MMCC manages, supervises and administers the funds, covers any additional expenses and spends any exceeding funds for similar activities in Afghanistan.

The Impact

Entertainment is good everywhere but in Afghanistan Circus activities are much more than just entertainment: it is a collective therapy and a window from the war to a beautiful dream world that makes people rethink and review their lives, values, and attitudes with and for children.

  • 170 young artists get plenty of trainings to improve their skills to perform in their regional teams in different parts of Afghanistan for an entire year.
  • Tens of thousands of Afghan children enjoy entertaining and educational performances with music, theater, comedies and other physical arts such as juggling, acrobatics, unicycle.
  • Estimated 340 girls and boys from 5 regions of Afghanistan participate in local, regional,  and finally National Juggling Championship.
  • As seen last year, the activities get lots of positive national and international media coverage. Good news, photos and reports over children’s activities brings a bit of fresh air and hope into the warzone.

Risks & Challenges 

Security, conservatism, political instability and much more are among the risks and challenges we face with nearly all that we do and every day. However none of these are new to us, since we have been running our activities in Afghanistan for over 13 years. Relying on our long experience and local networks and support, as well as the insight to the culture and respect to all local values we will continue making children’s circus in Afghanistan a historical success.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word!  Let people know that children of Afghanistan need fun and joy too. If you can't donate, but would still like to support us, share this site with friends on FaceBook, Twitter, write on your blogs, write e-mails out to friends and family to let them know!

story:
Skinz N Bonez, a local Women's Marching Krewe out of New Orleans, Louisiana has "adopted" a local group of children out of St Anna's Episcopal Church that attend our events and regularly parade with us during Carnival and Halloween seasons.  Their participation is possible thanks to the Anna's place Nola Program and coordinator Darryl Durham.  (conductor, Treme Community Choir)

On Sat June 20th the krewe is planning a "Short Ribs" fundraising event to be held at the Dodwell House.   We are doing an Indiegogo to help support the event itself.   All Monies collected here on this project will go directly to permits, police, costs to operate an event for 5 hours.

This is a family-friendly "back yard" fundraiser to benefit Anna's Place, a program envisioned by St. Anna's Episcopal to inspire local kids through performing arts training, community service, and environmental awareness. This fundraising event will be held at the Dodwell House, 1519 Esplanade Avenue, a restoration project that will be the new home of a primary school for young artists and musicians, grades K-4. OUR Goal is to raise proceeds for Anna's Place, and we will be hosting a raffle and silent auction on the day of the event.

ADMISSION: Open to the public. We are asking for a $3 suggested donation at the gate OR a donation of school supplies / art supplies for the kids. NO ONE will be turned away for their inability to fulfill the suggested donation.

AT THE EVENT:
We will have live "roving" entertainment by local musicians and marching krewes. Local artisans and vendors will also be present, and we have plenty of arts and craft opportunities for the little ones as well! For those of you who like to do some rummaging on the weekends, come check out the HUGE rummage sale St. Anna's will be hosting inside the Dodwell House! Additionally, the St. Anna's Mobile Mission bus will be on site available for free health screenings, prevention, and education!

An area for gardening on site will provide education and an opportunity for children to take home a plant to inspire a garden in their own homes.

Our goal is to reach as many children as possible, and give each child an opportunity to go home with something they have created, painted or planted.   We also want the community and children to know that this is a great program available to all kids, providing support for summer school, and after school programs.
any excess funds from this will go directly to the kids art program
thank you so much...

story:
John Corrigan's sister Helen lives with her family in the Commonwealth Republic of Vanuatu, an archipelago of over 80 islands in the South Pacific. You will probably be aware that on the 13th March this year Vanuatu was ravaged by Cyclone Pam, the worst storm to hit the region in many years. Helen said that the half hour of winds of between 140 - 200 mph that battered her home in Port Vila that day was the scariest thing she's ever been through. 

Fortunately, Cyclone Pam did not leave a large loss of life in its terrifying wake, but what it did leave was huge damage particularly to ten more remte areas. John's brother-in-law, Edward's home island of Erromango was particularly badly devastated. Huge damage was caused to the Happy Land Primary School where Edward's sister teaches. In particular the building itself, but also the water supply and the gardens, where much of the food for the school children is produced, were seriously damaged. John Corrigan Frances Law and some friends are organising a coffee morning on Saturday May 9th in Kilry Hall between 10 and noon.Short Summary

We have created this funding page for people who are unable to come to Kilry Hall for the fundraising coffee morning. Every pound we raise will help to re establish the school and its garden. There is a huge effort going on across Vanu Atu to clear the devastation but this campaign is special because it directly connects people on Erromango with us here in the UK who all know and care about the Corrigans and their family. This is a fast and direct way to make a difference now.
To describe a little about the situation on Erromango - when Helen, Edward and their daughters visit their family there they take a boat and then have an 8 hour trek through jungle to the village. Now, since the cyclone and the damage to the jungle all the trees are down, which means that the trek which was possible previously with a machete, now requires a chainsaw. The islands main business was the export of sandalwood it will take years to reestablish the business. In the meantime we can help by supporting the school and giving the children and their families a positive input. In the scale of things it is a small help but could be vital to building moral for the community as it recovers.
Donations of £5 £10 and more will be very gratefully recieved. A donation of £20 or more will be thanked with an email updating you of the work on Erromango. 

Please would you share this page whether or not you are able to donate. Spreading the word is very valuable and will help others to give.

story:
My name is Ethel Chimenya. I am 20 years old and I am from Zimbabwe. My great passions are working with children in helping them to discover themselves as they grow. Also, I am passionated in the empowerment of women. As a person, I am very sociable and very open to learn from others. I am into self-discovery and I love being in the nature. I live in Kufunda Learning Village, just outside Harare. In Kufunda I also get access to learning through the programs that take place here. 


  • I am fundraising for my participation in the Youth Initiative Program, that is arranged in a Swedish community. In Sweden, I am hoping to  begin the journey into what inspires me and to develop my skills. It is an opportunity to work on my purpose and clarity of what I want to do in my life.The program is going to help me into working towards my dreams which is around working with people. It will also give me tools in improving my communication skills and in creating a safer place for conversations to take place. These tools will be very useful for me in community building towards working with children, youths and women. It will be  a great opportunity  for me to learn and share with a diverse group of students from around the world, who are also exploring from their own experiences. Together we can learn from each other in how to cope with the situations in our communities. 
  • The funds I am raising will be used as follows:
    $12 000 for my education, food and accommodation,
    $2000 for my flights,
    $100 for a Swedish Visa,
    $800 for insurance.
    $900 is for my upkeeping during the weekends and also in case of any emergence.  
    In total it is $ 15,800 which is needed.

  • Your contribution will help me to travel and participate in the Youth Initiative Program in Sweden. This will  empower me as a young woman to  pursue my dreams and step up fully as I begin my journey to work with young people and women. Not only will it help me in creating a safer place for conversations that has never taken place before. This will also enable me to help young people and women to  begin to appreciate themselves, who they are and to accept their differences.  Through your contribution, I will be able to take part more fully in the development of my community. 

  • Already I have been involved in some youth programs arranged at Kufunda (Communiversity, 2013 and Young Women are Medicine, 2015). These programs have given me useful training in community development and leadership skills. With the knowledge I have acquired from these programs, I am ready to deepen my knowledge, to learn and to co-create with other students in Sweden.

story:
Click aquí para la campaña en español
 

What peeople say


Exoskeletons and robots

For decades, science fiction fans have dreamed of donning their own exoskeleton and using it to perform superhuman tasks. What if you could lift several hundred pounds? Think of how fast you could move from one apartment to the other if you could lift any object in your house! You could even lift a box of books!

My name is Victor. I'm an engineer and a project manager. I'm also a huge science
fiction fan. Remember the power-loader from Aliens? We had the concept for that in
the mid-1980s! A lot of people said the communicators from Star Trek and the little pad devices they used would be impossible. Well, we've got them now! In fact, they were both invented by the same company!

An exoskeleton would allow any man or woman to exert several tons of torque, pressure or lifting power while performing precision actions. How would this change rescue operations? How might this change construction? What capabilities would this provide people who, because of their physical limitations can't participate in certain occupations or tasks?

Many construction, repair, excavation, transport and even search and rescue tasks depend entirely on finding the right tool for the job. Over humanity's history, when the right tool could not be found, often its invention became necessary. Now, we propose to invent the right tool for every job. Equipped with an exoskeleton, any human being will have the ability to go anywhere and do just about anything a human body is capable of with several orders of magnitude more power and durability than otherwise.

It is not hard to see how this would change the world. A single person would instantly become capable of building a house, or even a small office building. Dangerous ordeals like a child trapped at the bottom of a well would no longer put dozens of lives at risk. No underground worker or car accident victim would ever be trapped again. No victim of an earthquake would ever be at risk of never being found.

Handicapped people would not only have their mobility restored, but improved beyond what it originally was.

The ability to exert maximum power at the exact location where it can do the most good is what an exoskeleton can do for humanity. It will change the world in ways that nobody has ever even dreamed before.

I don't want to reinvent the wheel. I know there are exoskeletons out there. But I want to build affordable exoskeleton robots which can be customized.

For this reason, we would appreciate your support so we can make this compelling vision a reality. Be one of our pre-release customers!


Stretch goals


To patent our exoskeleton robot we need $500. To donate one Scout exoskeleton we need to achieve our stretch goal of $20,000. This includes materials and manufacturing. We will increasingly donate exoskeleton robots, technical support, physical therapy and psychological therapy while we achieve our stretch goals.

If we hit our stretch goal of $100,000 we'll donate two Scout exoskeletons, give our exoskeleton customers free technical support and software upgrades for 1 year. With $300,000 we'll donate 3 Scout exoskeletons, give our exoskeleton customers free psychological and physical therapy for 1 year.


What you get


Building a general purpose external powered skeleton robot (exoskeleton robot) for use by human beings is not a project only limited to certain kinds of applications. We consider our devices to be “general purpose” machines, which can be used by the handicapped, workers in physically demanding jobs, or anyone with a need for more power.


There are a variety of control mechanisms built in to our exoskeleton models. A user can control their unit by voice commands or remote control, and each unit is capable of communicating with other devices and control mechanisms through the GPS system, Bluetooth or Wi-Fi. Exoskeletons will be equipped with digital cameras.


Our company will provide training, technical support and certification for licensed professionals to work with those who are learning how to utilize the exoskeleton as well. Physical therapists, psychotherapists and medical professionals will be able to obtain the latest research on how exoskeletons can be used to advance the physical capabilities of their patients in a wide variety of applications.


We consider this last point to be of particular importance. This technology is far too valuable to be limited to only a subset of its possible uses. Professional certification will ensure the widest adoption.



We'll also have phone apps

and a Google Glass application

All our exoskeleton robots can be remote controlled through our iPhone, Android and Google Glass applications. This lets you make your exoskeleton fetch things, go out to take a picture or record videos or stream videos to your phone or tablet. If you can't use your hands to control these gadgets then you can use your voice or our eye control system. Special training is included with every Independence exoskeleton robot units.


Scout Exoskeleton Robot

Robotic legs and chest that lets you transport heavy objects. Ideal for trekking or people with walking problems.

retail price: $14,500

Independence Exoskeleton Robot

Equipped with robotic hands this exoskeleton lets you grab and  lift objects. Quadriplegic users can take advantage of these units.

retail price: $19,500

Physical Therapy

Certified physical therapists help you get the best mobility with exercise designed for paraplegic and quadriplegic exoskeleton robot users . 1 year subscription.

retail price: $1,200

Psychological Therapy

Certified psychological therapists help you deal with anxiety and depression. Group therapy designed for paraplegic and quadriplegic exoskeleton robot users . 1 year subscription.

retail price: $1,200

Technical support and upgrades

Certified exoskeleton robots' technicians will do any parts repairs, changes or upgrades to your exoskeleton robot hardware or software.  1 year subscription.

retail price: $1,200

Piggy bank crowd buy

Suppose you want to help get the coolest crowdfunded project ever get going, but you also want to invite your friends or family to participate with you? We've got that figured out and you won't believe how easy it can be.

We call it a "Piggy Bank" and it's as simple as any other kind of indiegogo perk. All you have to do is buy a Piggy Bank perk, simply mention in a comment that your contribution is for your recipient.

Since you're being generous, we will be too! If you and your gift giving team can get to 90% of the purchase price of a single unit or service, we'll throw in the other ten percent. Once you've raised the correct amount for your recipient, we'll be that much closer to the goal of donating exoskeleton robots, and you'll be that much closer to seeing your beneficiary receive their brand new unit with a little note from you and your compliments.

At its simplest, this project is about giving back. It's about taking technology to the next level and sharing the benefits of that technology with everyone. We have a great opportunity to do something amazing with our exoskeleton project. Let's make everyone a part of it!

Once you’ve chosen your perk, you can also opt to add an additional donation – which will directly support exoskeleton robots donations.

Retailers' discounts

Are you looking for business opportunities on a new niche market? We offer you big retailers' discounts and our support.

This is your chance to join a business opportunity that is going to not just change the world, but also offer hope.  Select a "Retail down payment pack" perk on the right hand side to start your business.
When you become an exoskeleton robots retailer you become part of a worldwide family of retailers providing an array of products and services for your customers to use, backed by the service and marketing support of our company. We will participate in print publications, digital networks, social media, mobile marketing, public relations, and consumer events.

You’ll tap into a brand new revenue stream attracting people who not only buy our products, but other products in your retail environment as well. We offer an attractive profit margin based upon manufactures’ advertised pricing.

Selling exoskeleton robots products and services also helps the community by generating profits which help fund donations of our products and services for handicapped people have a better life.


Budget and challenges


All hardware products projects have risks and challenges. Our team has been working hard to address every one of them.

If you totally pay for an exoskeleton robot we will be able to build and deliver it. We have double checked our costs structure.  Even if we get a low number of sales, there is no risk in pre-ordering an exoskeleton robot.

If we can't collect our funds goal we may not be able to donate exoskeletons. In this case, Indiegogo funds will also help us with retail package design, website creation, e-commerce setup, and a streamlined order fulfillment process.

Since our design is patent pending we will be very careful with parts detail disclosure.

Mass manufacturing might be a challenge because it's not easy to control a standard product with unique quality. So we are contacting dozens of mature manufacturers to ensure our exoskeleton robots meet high quality standards and are carefully packed for delivery on schedule.

International logistics and customer service are also risks as the team has to communicate with backers at every corner of the world. Fortunately, we have experienced customer support personnel with logistic tracking skills and will work diligently to reply backers promptly.

Our team has successfully worked in many projects and got plenty of experience in handling all these problems. If any unexpected issue occurs, we’ll be keep you informed and work to solve the problem quickly.


Timeline



Our team


Victor Morales (Founder, CEO) - Uruguay
 - Industrial and electronic design

https://www.linkedin.com/pub/victor-morales/a4/279/9b

Alejandra Romero (Chief Sales Officer) - USA
Dinorah Kellogg (Chief Financial Officer) - Uruguay

Bruno Giacomelli (Software Development) - Uruguay
Diego Capretti (Software Development) - Uruguay
Juan Ghiringhelli (Software Development) - Spain
https://www.linkedin.com/pub/juan-carlos-ghirin...
Mateo Capdevielle (Software Development) - Uruguay

Javier Cabrera (Mechanical Design) - Uruguay

Valentina Morales (Design) - Uruguay
Alejandro Ferron (Design) - Uruguay

Beatriz Ferreira (Nurse) - Uruguay

Sylvia Gadea (Physical therapy) - Uruguay

Adriana Pera (Psychology) - Uruguay


Other Ways You Can Help

This project will only become a reality if everyone contributes what they can. Even if you can't make a contribution to the campaign, you can definitely help us make sure we reach our goal! How can you do that? Simple. Use the power of network communications.

Right here on this site we have a ton of tools you can use to get the word out to everyone you know, and even if your friends aren't using social media, you can always send them an e-mail or just call them up.

Record a video about someone who needs an exoskeleton robot and we'll share it in our project campaign page.The most viewed video will win an exoskeleton robot.

You can participate in our referral contest. Simply log in to Indiegogo if you have not already, or create an account by signing up here. Then, visit this campaign page on Indiegogo and look next to the main video to share and copy your unique URL.

Copy your unique URL link to post around the Internet on your Facebook, Twitter, blogs, etc.

We'd like to invite you to contact as many of your friends and family members as possible and ask them to support our campaign. Spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, YouTube. Print our flyers and distribute them. It's going to be amazing when our exoskeleton robots take their first step right next to you, and you'll be one of the people who helped make it possible!

Be part of this new technology that change lives. Help us to help.


Other campaigns to help quadriplegic people
https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/help-me-get-a-new-electric-wheelchair

Get in touch



Backers Enquiries: info@exoskeletonrobots.com
Press Enquiries: press@exoskeletonrobots.com
Business Enquiries: vmorales@exoskeletonrobots.com
story_txt:
Click aquí para la campaña en español 

What peeople say

Exoskeletons and robots
 For decades, science fiction fans have dreamed of donning their own exoskeleton and using it to perform superhuman tasks. What if you could lift several hundred pounds? Think of how fast you could move from one apartment to the other if you could lift any object in your house! You could even lift a box of books!My name is Victor. I'm an engineer and a project manager. I'm also a huge sciencefiction fan. Remember the power-loader from Aliens? We had the concept for that inthe mid-1980s! A lot of people said the communicators from Star Trek and the little pad devices they used would be impossible. Well, we've got them now! In fact, they were both invented by the same company!An exoskeleton would allow any man or woman to exert several tons of torque, pressure or lifting power while performing precision actions. How would this change rescue operations? How might this change construction? What capabilities would this provide people who, because of their physical limitations can't participate in certain occupations or tasks?Many construction, repair, excavation, transport and even search and rescue tasks depend entirely on finding the right tool for the job. Over humanity's history, when the right tool could not be found, often its invention became necessary. Now, we propose to invent the right tool for every job. Equipped with an exoskeleton, any human being will have the ability to go anywhere and do just about anything a human body is capable of with several orders of magnitude more power and durability than otherwise. It is not hard to see how this would change the world. A single person would instantly become capable of building a house, or even a small office building. Dangerous ordeals like a child trapped at the bottom of a well would no longer put dozens of lives at risk. No underground worker or car accident victim would ever be trapped again. No victim of an earthquake would ever be at risk of never being found. Handicapped people would not only have their mobility restored, but improved beyond what it originally was. The ability to exert maximum power at the exact location where it can do the most good is what an exoskeleton can do for humanity. It will change the world in ways that nobody has ever even dreamed before.I don't want to reinvent the wheel. I know there are exoskeletons out there. But I want to build affordable exoskeleton robots which can be customized.For this reason, we would appreciate your support so we can make this compelling vision a reality. Be one of our pre-release customers!   
Stretch goals

To patent our exoskeleton robot we need $500. To donate one Scout exoskeleton we need to achieve our stretch goal of $20,000. This includes materials and manufacturing. We will increasingly donate
exoskeleton robots, technical support, physical therapy and
psychological therapy while we achieve our stretch goals. If we hit our stretch goal of $100,000 we'll donate two Scout exoskeletons, give our exoskeleton customers free technical support and software upgrades for 1 year. With $300,000 we'll donate 3 Scout exoskeletons, give our exoskeleton customers free psychological and physical therapy for 1 year.What you getBuilding a general purpose external powered skeleton robot (exoskeleton robot) for use by human beings is not a project only limited to certain kinds of applications. We consider our devices to be “general purpose” machines, which can be used by the handicapped, workers in physically demanding jobs, or anyone with a need for more power.There are a variety of control mechanisms built in to our exoskeleton models. A user can control their unit by voice commands or remote control, and each unit is capable of communicating with other devices and control mechanisms through the GPS system, Bluetooth or Wi-Fi. Exoskeletons will be equipped with digital cameras.Our company will provide training, technical support and certification for licensed professionals to work with those who are learning how to utilize the exoskeleton as well. Physical therapists, psychotherapists and medical professionals will be able to obtain the latest research on how exoskeletons can be used to advance the physical capabilities of their patients in a wide variety of applications.We consider this last point to be of particular importance. This technology is far too valuable to be limited to only a subset of its possible uses. Professional certification will ensure the widest adoption.
We'll also have phone appsand a Google Glass application All our exoskeleton robots can be remote controlled through our iPhone, Android and Google Glass applications. This lets you make your 
exoskeleton fetch things, go out to take a picture or record videos or 
stream videos to your phone or tablet. If you can't use your hands to 
control these gadgets then you can use your voice or our eye control 
system. Special training is included with every Independence exoskeleton
 robot units. 




Scout Exoskeleton Robot
Robotic legs and chest that lets you transport heavy objects. Ideal for trekking or people with walking problems.
retail price: $14,500











Independence Exoskeleton Robot
Equipped with robotic hands this exoskeleton lets you grab and  lift objects. Quadriplegic users can take advantage of these units.
retail price: $19,500













Physical Therapy
Certified physical therapists help you get the best mobility with exercise designed for paraplegic and quadriplegic exoskeleton robot users . 1 year subscription.
retail price: $1,200










Psychological Therapy
Certified psychological therapists help you deal with anxiety and depression. Group therapy designed for paraplegic and quadriplegic exoskeleton robot users . 1 year subscription.
retail price: $1,200











Technical support and upgrades
Certified exoskeleton robots' technicians will do any parts repairs, changes or upgrades to your exoskeleton robot hardware or software.  1 year subscription.
retail price: $1,200

story:
Change


Change is happening at La Yaguita. Things are moving in the right direction. This school needs more classrooms. The community needs education in order to continue its turning point. You can have a say in this now. Help complete reconstruction of the school's left side building so that more children can be a part of the change!


Location and background

La Yaguita de Pastor is a neighborhood of 40,000 people with acute financial and spiritual need. Set across the river from the city center, La Yaguita was once a quiet town of poor, but honest people. In the 1990s, the city experienced escalating crime rates, abetted by intense police actions. Its public school is packed beyond enrollment limits, leaving undocumented children on the streets. Private schools in the neighborhood charge between $400-$600 pesos per month ($9-$13 US dollars) - beyond the range of affordability for most families, which on average make between $5,000-$6,000 ($110-$135 US) a month. The unemployment rate in the community is roughly 40%. The neighborhood’s high rates of crime and poverty are associated with inversely low levels of education. 


Birth of a dream

In 2008, Ramon Antonio Jorge, pastor of Iglesia Biblica Cristiana la Yaguita, challenged his church to open a small preschool and homework area to give these children a home away from home while their parents were at work. Because they did not have a place to do this, the church building was used to set up the first classrooms for the children. Hogar de Crecimiento Integral opened its doors in 2009.

Since then the school has received over $69,000 US dollars in donations from generous people and organizations, both local and international, and this has made it possible for Ramon's vision to shift from being just a dream to becoming a reality!


Impact on the community

  • School currently teaches 100 children every day, across three classrooms in morning and afternoon shifts.
  • Children receive at least three lunches per week.
  • In preschool, children follow a curriculum In preschool, children follow a curriculum informed by international standards and the Dominican curriculum.
  • Tuition fee is $150 - $200 pesos, although realistically it should be around $400 in order to cover expenses.
  • Children are taught from a Christian worldview.
  • School has 7 teachers and 3 support staff.

Thursday nights and on Sundays, the school building shifts to its original purpose of serving as a Church for the community, led by pastor Ramon.


Why stop there?

Your support will go towards our primary goals, which are:

  • Reconstruction of the entire left side building, floors 1 and 2, to expand capacity and reach out to more children.
  • School materials (whiteboards, chairs, desks, etc.)

    Our subsequent goals are:

    • Reconstruction of second-floor of right side building for two more classrooms.
    • Focus on ECE and support for higher levels of education.
    • Supervise and help with curriculum.
    • Help with professional development and training of teachers.
    • Certify the teachers. This will enable the government to officially recognize the school and provide the monthly payments to the teachers.
    • Sponsorship of both students and teachers (if you’re particularly interested in this, please contact us at scsfoundation@scs.edu.do)
    • Train teachers in education for special needs children.
    • Build the new Church (2016)
    • Renovation of the first-floor classroom on the right side building, once the new Church is built in the adjacent land, 
    Ramon's vision is far greater than the school's current state. The end goal is to keep developing the school and make it sustainable so that it can have a maximum impact on the community. The quality of education matters. Kids still not attending school matters. Disabled children without access to education matter. The community matters!

    For more information on the school please see the pictures and video in the gallery.


    Other ways to help

    If you're unable to make a donation at this time, please consider sharing the campaign link with your friends and loved ones: http://igg.me/at/layaguita

    Also, please consider a prayer for the school, kids, teachers, staff, donors and the community. Pray that the Lord keeps placing pieces around the school so that its positive impact in the community continues to grow and lives continue to be changed!


    About us

    Hogar de Crecimiento Integral and other similar schools throughout the country are in a corporate relationship with the Santiago Christian School Foundation, which has a 501 [c] [3] tax-exempt status. 

    Our Indiegogo campaign team consist of:

    Seth Cohen - Director of  Santiago Christian School. Has an EdD in Educational Leadership from Temple University, an MBA from Dowling College and a BA in Secondary Education/History from Wheaton College. He also served as Headmaster at Spruce Hill Christian School and City Center Academy in Philadelphia for fourteen years.

    Wayne Lynch - Former Treasurer and Director of Santiago Christian School and also one of 107 ACFREs from the Association of Fundraising Professionals (AFP), with 40 years of experience in fundraising and education. See more about him and his work here.

    Bob Simrak - Treasurer of Santiago Christian School Foundation. Has over 30 years experience in Christian ministry with Crossworld (formerly UFM International), RBMU (now merged with World Team) and Cedar Grove Christian Academy in Philadelphia.

    Luis Jose Checo Gobaira - Campaign manager and Development Coordinator at Santiago Christian School, with a bachelor's degree in Business Administration from PUCMM.


    Acknowledgements

    To Jean Hache. A leader in the city of Santiago and passionate about helping develop education in our nation. He has been involved with the school at La Yaguita for the last couple of years and through two of his companies, SERVEX and BII, has funded a good part of its development.

    To Jessica Kuhlman. Her fantastic thesis project about La Yaguita, in partnership with Journeyman International, has been an inspiration to all involved in the development of the school. See more about Jessica here and see more about her thesis at this Studio E Architects' recent blog post.

Has an EdD in Educational Leadership from Temple University, an MBA from Dowling College and a BA in Secondary Education/History from Wheaton College. He also served as Headmaster at Spruce Hill Christian School and City Center Academy in Philadelphia for fourteen years.
Wayne Lynch - Former Treasurer and Director of Santiago Christian School and also one of 107 ACFREs from the Association of Fundraising Professionals (AFP), with 40 years of experience in fundraising and education. See more about him and his work here.
