story:
Physics Classroom Needs

Hello! I am a Science teacher working at Boston Day and Evening Academy, a Horace Mann Charter School within the Boston Public School system.  I studied Biology and Chemistry in college and discovered Physics in the years after I graduated.  Since then, Physics has been my passion.  After college, I worked as a chef for many years.  Eight years ago I changed profession and became a Science teacher at a school that uses competency based teaching and assessment to re-engage high need, off-track students in their education.  I have worked diligently over the years to create engaging and rigorous curriculum, and I am always looking for ways to up my game in the service of my students. 


With every year that passes, the cost of running a school district increases with inflation at the same time that funding either decreases or hovers at the same level. The result is that every year, schools are cutting expenses to keep their budgets balanced.  These budgetary changes inevitably require cutting vital supports, including personnel, programs, and classroom resources.  We are at this point.


I created this campaign to generate funds for my classroom so that my students can have access to both a remarkable new online text book, ergopedia, and to WebAssign, an online instructional system that offers content and supports instant assessment—a crucial component of effective competency-based practice. These two resources will greatly enhance my students’ in- and out-of-class experiences and give me more time to provide instruction and support at their various levels of need.


Your donation will help to provide my students with a brilliant, thorough and engaging e-text book that animates physics principles through interactive text. I am especially enthusiastic about this textbook because it will help students address their misconceptions about Physics principles and get them excited about content through its interactive platform.  I have consulted with colleagues who are already using this e-text in their classrooms at other schools and they all endorse it without exception.

Check out this amazing resource for yourself at:  Ergopedia.com

But there’s more!  Your donation will also give students access to the amazing WebAssign; an online “problem set” website that lets teachers build interactive homework assignments that allow students to work together on difficult problems.  One unique aspect of WebAssign is that each student is given the same problem set but with different numbers.  This facilitates students working together, but also requires that they work through their own individual problems.  Even better, WebAssign provides instant feedback on each problem, and allows students to revisit their work when they get incorrect answers.  This is such a great way to work through different problems because it affords every student the opportunity to troubleshoot the method they used to solve those problems. Thus, learning is focused on both the resolution and the process.

Here is a link to Webassign.

A $1300 donation will provide 50 copies of the essential physics e-text with DVD that allows the text to be used on any computer with a web browser.  The e-text book can be accessed on line from any computer,  tablet, or smart phone with an internet connection and browser.  The license for these books lasts for six years.

A donation of $1650 will pay for year long subscriptions for each of my students for the next school year.  


Perks

In addition to knowing that you have provided access to knowledge for students who have not previously experienced academic success, a donation will get you:

  • a personalized letter from a student showing how you, the donor, have impacted the student

  • a BDEA t-shirt

  • classroom photographs, and

  • your name on a plaque on the classroom wall


Thank you so very much for your consideration.  I look forward to hearing from you.
story_txt:
Physics Classroom Needs
Hello! I am a Science teacher working at Boston Day and Evening Academy, a Horace Mann Charter School within the Boston Public School system.  I studied Biology and Chemistry in college and discovered Physics in the years after I graduated.  Since then, Physics has been my passion.  After college, I worked as a chef for many years.  Eight years ago I changed profession and became a Science teacher at a school that uses competency based teaching and assessment to re-engage high need, off-track students in their education.  I have worked diligently over the years to create engaging and rigorous curriculum, and I am always looking for ways to up my game in the service of my students. 
With every year that passes, the cost of running a school district increases with inflation at the same time that funding either decreases or hovers at the same level. The result is that every year, schools are cutting expenses to keep their budgets balanced.  These budgetary changes inevitably require cutting vital supports, including personnel, programs, and classroom resources.  We are at this point.
I created this campaign to generate funds for my classroom so that my students can have access to both a remarkable new online text book, ergopedia, and to WebAssign, an online instructional system that offers content and supports instant assessment—a crucial component of effective competency-based practice. These two resources will greatly enhance my students’ in- and out-of-class experiences and give me more time to provide instruction and support at their various levels of need.
Your donation will help to provide my students with a brilliant, thorough and engaging e-text book that animates physics principles through interactive text. I am especially enthusiastic about this textbook because it will help students address their misconceptions about Physics principles and get them excited about content through its interactive platform.  I have consulted with colleagues who are already using this e-text in their classrooms at other schools and they all endorse it without exception.
Check out this amazing resource for yourself at:  Ergopedia.com
But there’s more!  Your donation will also give students access to the amazing WebAssign; an online “problem set” website that lets teachers build interactive homework assignments that allow students to work together on difficult problems.  One unique aspect of WebAssign is that each student is given the same problem set but with different numbers.  This facilitates students working together, but also requires that they work through their own individual problems.  Even better, WebAssign provides instant feedback on each problem, and allows students to revisit their work when they get incorrect answers.  This is such a great way to work through different problems because it affords every student the opportunity to troubleshoot the method they used to solve those problems. Thus, learning is focused on both the resolution and the process.
Here is a link to Webassign.
A $1300 donation will provide 50 copies of the essential physics e-text with DVD that allows the text to be used on any computer with a web browser.  The e-text book can be accessed on line from any computer,  tablet, or smart phone with an internet connection and browser.  The license for these books lasts for six years.
A donation of $1650 will pay for year long subscriptions for each of my students for the next school year.   
Perks
In addition to knowing that you have provided access to knowledge for students who have not previously experienced academic success, a donation will get you:

a personalized letter from a student showing how you, the donor, have impacted the student 
a BDEA t-shirt
classroom photographs, and 
your name on a plaque on the classroom wall

Thank you so very much for your consideration.  I look forward to hearing from you.

story:
Hi, Welcome to the campaign!

This summer, I will be traveling to Ladakh, India to do some non-profit work with both Operation Groundswell and other local nonprofits like "17000ft". 

In brief, Ladakh is a rural village that is cut off from the main cities six months out of a year because of harsh conditions.So as volunteers, we will be working with 17,000ft foundation to work on needs-based projects in Ladakh. Those projects mainly aim to improve education and make going to school a fruitful and safe experience for these kids to enjoy all throughout the year. To accomplish this, we will be mainly doing the following:

- Rebuilding infrastructure 

- Setting up libraries

- Providing the schools with technology to enhance information retention

- And more.. (based on the needs for the community!)

During the forty day period that we will be staying in India, backpacking and volunteering, we hope to create maximum impact; however, in order to do that we will need your help  to provide those materials in preparation for our trip. All donations will go directly into making this project a reality.


Unfortunately, we are now limited on time and the date of the trip is coming closer. We have only raised about 15% of our goal so far through this website and other means, but we are looking to hopefully raise 100% before June 8th! 


PLEASE NOTE:

1. Deadline of the campaign is actually June 20th and NOT June 28th.

2. Goal is set 10 $500 as a minimum and not a cap to the funds. Obviously, the more funds we collect, the better! WE ONLY SET THE GOAL TO $500 FOR TECHNICAL REASONS, BUT WE AIM TO RAISE $3500.

While this is my personal donation page, the rest of the volunteers and I really appreciate your help in making this happen! Thank you.

story:
My name is Jeff. I'm the Founder of Noble Initiatives, an organization that provides hope and education to people caring for someone living with a Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorder (FASD). 
____________________________________________________________________________

Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorder (FASD) is an umbrella term that describes a range of conditions that result from prenatal alcohol exposure. FASD is not the diagnosis. The specific diagnosis within the spectrum include: 

FASD is a lifelong disability which includes a range of effects, including developmental, physical and behavioural symptoms.  
http://www.asantecentre.org/What_is_FASD.html
____________________________________________________________________________

I began this journey about seven years ago when my partner and I became foster parents to a young man who was living with Fetal Alcohol Syndrome. I remember all too well the confusion, the frustration and sometimes the sheer madness! But, like most adventures, there have been tons of A-Ha! moments, small wins and happy accidents. 

Nowadays, I provide support and coaching to FASD caregivers and allies all over the world through social media, over the web, on the phone, face to face, over coffee, in the classroom, at the gym and even at your in-laws. Some might say I'm a little passionate about my job. 

But now, I want to take my show on the road!



Here's me doing an interview with my friend Emily Travis. 

And here is me having some fun spreading awareness while celebrating September 9th - International FASD Awareness Day.

Here are the facts, Jack. There are tens of thousands of people living across North America with an FASD. Which also means that there are tens of thousands more caring and providing support to those folks. The tricky part though is that many people (and the people caring for them) don't even know they have an FASD.

The statistics behind those born with an FASD in North America is very difficult to track down for many reasons: stereotypes, not enough knowledge, not enough support and diagnosis services, myths, shame, etc. However, there are a few numbers to consider: 

FASD is very difficult to diagnose, scientists and doctors are still learning about it, there are very few resources available and the truth is, there is tons of misinformation floating around making it extremely difficult for caregivers and support workers to know what the heck they are supposed to be doing!

So, I want to do something about it. Here's where I need your help.

My team and I have been working tirelessly over the past few months organizing a North American tour to spread FASD awareness and education. We will be making 25 stops in cities small and large to rock the house and empower, educate and energize FASD caregivers, support persons and allies.

But, I can't do this by myself. I need your help. 

Here's the Plan: 
We need to raise $30,000.

Where does the money go?

Our Tour Coordinator Extraordinaire, Cheryl has estimated the costs of my travel, hotel and food at about $25,000. The rest of the money will go to miscellaneous costs such as the wicked awesome rewards that contributors will receive, shipping and coffee. I'm going to need coffee. 

The best part? Because we are raising all the money to get this show on the road, most (if not all) events will be FREE!


MSM I North American Tour 2015  Tour Stops

September 8 Powell River, BC
September 9 Vancouver, BC
September 11 Olympia, WA
September 12 Yakima, WA
September 14 Baker City, OR
September 16 Los Angeles, CA
September 18 Thatcher, AZ
September 20 Cochin, SK
September 21 Meadow Lake, SK
September 22 Battleford, SK
September 23 Lakeland Centre, AB
September 24 Edmonton, AB
September 25 Calgary, AB
September 28 Dauphin, MB

October 1 Walker, MN
October 2 Elk River, MN
October 3 St. Louis Park, MN 
October 5 Sault Ste. Marie, ON
October 7 Barrie, ON
October 10 Hamilton, ON
October 13 Indiana
October 17 Atlanta, GA


MSM Tour Team 

Jeff Noble
Speaker and Workshop Facilitator 
Disclaimer: Guaranteed to provide you with A-Ha! moment and light bulb moments of discovery. 

Tara Soucie 
Creative Strategist 
Making handouts and presentations awesome since 2010.

Cheryl Horn
Tour Coordinator 
Keeps everyone organized and the show on the road! 


Perks

We really tried to put our thinking caps on to come up with some great rewards for our contributors. 

You will find all sorts of different options and rewards that contributors will get for supporting our project. 

Our contributors will get exclusive updates from the road, be invited to participate in Jeff's Caregiver Kick Start!, and, of course, be part of this dream. And if that’s not enough, we’ve got lots of pretty sweet perks that you will want to get your hands on.


This is a win-win folks. If you donate, you get some pretty awesome goods. I get to tour North America. And our world gets a little more FASD friendlier. 

Here's a sneak peak of some of the merch: 

You can get your hands on a copy of Jeff's first book. 


And grab a copy of his second book, while you are at it. 


Plus a seat in: 

Experience Jeff's online coaching program that offers education and support to FASD caregivers through live coaching calls, online learning modules and other leading FASD experts.

Enjoy an exclusive invitation to a private Facebook group that will provide you with tour updates and insider information.


We are currently in production mode of an official tour poster, t-shirt and mug that contributors can expect to be sporting really soon. Plus, there are many perks that are virtual, so check out the entire list of perks for what to expect and look forward to. We will update with pictures as soon as they are available and keep you all up to date with dates and timelines. 

Update!
We've been working hard at Noble Initiatives headquarters. 
Check out the t-shirt and mug design! Official Tour Poster to come soon.
The t-shirt and mugs will only be available through this fundraising campaign - these are truly exclusive and one-of-a-kind!


The goal is to have all rewards produced, sent, in your homes (or arranged, if virtual) by November 2015.

Risks and Challenges

My team and I believe that it is time to start making some real noise for FASD awareness. Cheryl, Tara and I have been making phone calls, confirming dates and arranging all the details to have 25 successful (and mostly FREE!) tour dates. With that being said, these types of things usually don't go on without a hitch. If there are any delays in production or arranging and setting up of rewards, we anticipate that some of our rewards may take longer than possible to get out to you. If any delays or changes take place, we'll stay in touch with our supporters and keep them in the loop about any delays!

Otherwise, we do not anticipate any major setbacks as we have already confirmed and arranged many of tour locations, contact people and even sold out a few of our locations! If there are changes or mishaps regarding the actual tour, dates and locations, we will ensure folks are aware and up to date and receive the training no matter what.

But, to be really honest gang, we have put together a really amazing team of people who are extremely committed to this goal and we are all confident that this tour is going to rock the house!

story:
At Crazylife our motto is "Inspiring Change by Being Different". We are taking that motto and applying it with Crazylifeontour UK. Crazylifeontour UK will consist of talks at 83 universities across the UK, starting on the 6th October 2015 till 15th June 2016. These talks focus on Rape Awareness and Combatting Rape Culture performed by Liam Wilding. Also we are supporting UK rape and mental health charities including Rape Crisis England & Wales, Survivors UK and SANE.

We at Crazylife are extremely passionate about rape as our founder Liam Wilding has personal experience as a rape victim and knows how hard it is to deal with being a victim of such a horrible crime. It has taken him along time to get to where he is mentally and now he is ready to make a difference. He is using his experience as a rape victim and the issues in our society he suffered through to help make a difference by highlighting these issues and helping rape victims seek support through our tour and media surrounding the tour.

Once the tour is complete we intend to launch a petition to start an education program for GCSE students on sexual responsibility focusing on consent, impacts of rape on victims and those around the victims, where victims can get support and how to support victims of sexual assault. We hope the reach of the tour will make the petition a success.

As you can imagine a tour of this magnitude is very expensive to run. The funds raised will be used to go towards providing necessary equipment, travel costs, accommodation costs as well as living costs as Liam Wilding will be working full-time during the tour. It will also provide us with the ability to reach as many people as possible through media surrounding the tour. After careful and detailed financial planning we have projected the cost of running the tour and making it a success will be around £90,000. 

We are offering a variety of perks including newsletters, personal emails, personal phone calls and being put on a list of substantial contributors on our website crazylife.co.uk under our crowd funding page. 

Due to the expected reach of the tour and the surrounding media being at 5,000,000 people, we see this as a great advertising opportunity for business so we have decided to offer 4 sponsorship opportunities for donations of £30,000 or above so if you are a looking for advertisement for your business we strongly urge you to take this opportunity.

If we do not reach our goal we will use the funds to start the tour and continue to search for sponsorship for the rest of the tour, during the period of the tour funded by your donations.

As you can imagine doing a tour based around such a difficult and personal subject will be very difficult for Liam but he has battle and overcome so many difficulties as a result of the rape including alcoholism bulimia, PTSD, depression and a personality disorder so we have full confidence in his ability to conduct this tour. Also he has the support of his business partner and closest friend Alberto by his side who has always been a huge support for Liam and will be by his side throughout the tour.

We hope you donate to this opportunity as it has the potential to make a huge impact on so many people and if successful could help combat rape and rape culture which is a huge problem in our society.

Even if you cannot donate we would be very grateful if you could talk about our campaign to your friends swell as sharing our campaign on social media as it is a great opportunity to make a difference in this world.

story:
What we want to do:

The Friends of the Dominion Astrophysical Observatory Society is a newly incorporated not-for-profit society dedicated to bringing science education and outreach back to the Centre of the Universe, the visitor's centre on Observatory Hill. 

We are people involved in astronomy research and education, astronomy enthusiasts, parents of school-aged children, and other dedicated members of the community.

Our vision is to ignite the imagination and passion for scientific inquiry both among today's youth and the general public. The children who today ask "why?" or "how?" are going to be the adults who bring the world into a new era of scientific discovery. They will also grow to be the next generation of technical innovators who will help drive Canada's economy and act as guardians of the environment.
Our vision is a new Centre of the Universe experience. Visitors will be dazzled by the latest astronomical images, art work, and sculptures when they enter the foyer. Further inside, they will stand on an alien worlds using 3D technology, see the night sky far from city lights, explore the unique ways First Nations related to the sky, hear live or recorded music inspired by astronomy, and sharpen images using the latest Canadian technology (did you know that the Observatory makes a major contribution to the instruments for some of the world's most powerful telescopes?).
Our immediate goal is to restart school tours of the Observatory. In the past, school groups were able to come to the Observatory for field trips. They were able to see what work was being done in the world of astronomy and listen to presentations about astronomy. They were able to see the science at work, and to learn about the rich history of the historic Plaskett Telescope.  Currently, school groups have no access to the Observatory. Public access is limited to a few Saturday nights in the summer staffed by local amateur astronomers from the Royal Astronomical Society of Canada and over-subscribed summer camps for younger children. 
To restore the educational experiences we need to provide paid, enthusiastic educators to open the eyes and imaginations of school children, youth, and others. We will also begin to update the display materials at the visitors centre in order to work towards this long term vision.
We want to continue what has been recently implemented at the Observatory - FREE ADMISSION for the public. 
With financial support from the community, we can again open the Observatory and Visitors Centre to school groups throughout the week. We can increase access to the Observatory so that it can be open every Friday and Saturday throughout the summer. 

How do we bring education back to the Observatory:

Our initial goal is to raise $9,500 to be used as matching funds against grant proposals to fully fund our school tours programme.  It will also cover equipment which will start to improve the quality of presentations on Observatory Hill.

With your donation, you have the opportunity to sign up for membership with the Friends of Dominion Astrophysical Observatory Society. You can choose to get regular updates and opportunities to be part of an exciting new era of science education at the Observatory.
Our long term vision will of course cost far more than this initial request. Other science outreach will follow according to our plan to fully fund the education programme and incrementally renovate the Visitors Centre in time for the Observatory Centenary in 2018.

The Impact

With a paid educator at the Observatory, we can once again help to ignite the imagination and passion for scientific inquiry among today's youth. Now more than ever, we need a scientifically literate generation -- critical thinkers who can question, create, and innovate.

We want to ensure that people in the community have access to this valuable resource and the associated education that this historic and educational landmark encompasses. 

What is the challenge?

The challenge is to provide high quality, accessible, and interactive astronomy and science education to youth and the public in partnership with schools and community groups, always keeping it fresh and  getting the most bang for the buck.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share our campaign, join our organization, or just tell a friend about it.

Encourage interest in astronomy and the sciences in general. Support the idea of keeping the Dominion Astrophysical Observatory open to the public. 

Some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help. Contact us through our website: http://www.observatoryhill.org/

They were able to see the science at work, and to learn about the rich history of the historic Plaskett Telescope.  Currently, school groups have no access to the Observatory. Public access is limited to a few Saturday nights in the summer staffed by local amateur astronomers from the Royal Astronomical Society of Canada and over-subscribed summer camps for younger children. 
To restore the educational experiences we need to provide paid, enthusiastic educators to open the eyes and imaginations of school children, youth, and others. We will also begin to update the display materials at the visitors centre in order to work towards this long term vision.
We want to continue what has been recently implemented at the Observatory - FREE ADMISSION for the public. 
With financial support from the community, we can again open the Observatory and Visitors Centre to school groups throughout the week. We can increase access to the Observatory so that it can be open every Friday and Saturday throughout the summer.    How do we bring education back to the Observatory:
Our initial goal is to raise $9,500 to be used as matching funds against grant proposals to fully fund our school tours programme.  It will also cover equipment which will start to improve the quality of presentations on Observatory Hill.
With your donation, you have the opportunity to sign up for membership with the Friends of Dominion Astrophysical Observatory Society. You can choose to get regular updates and opportunities to be part of an exciting new era of science education at the Observatory.
Our long term vision will of course cost far more than this initial request. Other science outreach will follow according to our plan to fully fund the education programme and incrementally renovate the Visitors Centre in time for the Observatory Centenary in 2018.
   The Impact With a paid educator at the Observatory, we can once again help to ignite the imagination and passion for scientific inquiry among today's youth. Now more than ever, we need a scientifically literate generation -- critical thinkers who can question, create, and innovate. 
We want to ensure that people in the community have access to this valuable resource and the associated education that this historic and educational landmark encompasses. 
What is the challenge?
The challenge is to provide high quality, accessible, and interactive astronomy and science education to youth and the public in partnership with schools and community groups, always keeping it fresh and  getting the most bang for the buck.

    Other Ways You Can Help Share our campaign, join our organization, or just tell a friend about it.
Encourage interest in astronomy and the sciences in general. Support the idea of keeping the Dominion Astrophysical Observatory open to the public. 
Some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help. Contact us through our website: http://www.observatoryhill.org/

story:
This summer in true Oglethorpe style, our president,       Larry Schall, decided to experience  today's sharing         economy by becoming an Uber driver.

While engaged in this active learning, he was also securing additional dollars for scholarships for first-time college students entering Oglethorpe University by donating his fares to the scholarship fund for new students in need of financial help. 

 You can help us double the amount of dollars for               student scholarships by taking a virtual "ride" with           Larry.

Pick a destination from one of four places and contribute the fare to the Oglethorpe Annual Fund.
With your help we can gain an additional $300 for incoming students who with a few more dollars can fully engage in their Oglethorpe learning experience.
This campaign is TODAY only - so make your gift NOW.

 Other Ways You Can Help
  • Get the word out and share the link with your friends on social media and online.
  • Use the Indiegogo tools to help us spread the message and reach our goal!

See the national coverage on these sites:

Bloomberg | The Washington Post | USA Today

story:
We humbly ask for your support as we strive to foster health and wellness, empowerment and safety, locally and globally, through the practice of yoga.

(UPDATE: Geni Donnelly will no longer be able to join us in Bali for the YTT for unforeseen reasons, though she will still be managing the global and local charities for Yogamour during that time.) Kerri Eiker and Toni Wilhelm, yoga teachers and team members of Yogamour, a non-profit located in Frederick Maryland, humbly ask for your financial support as we deepen our education, refine our skills, and open our hearts in service to our communities. Yogamour adheres to the yogic philosophy of "seva" or selfless service by bringing our practice off of the mat and into our local and global communities. Through the work of our teachers and volunteers, we have been able to provide these communities with worthwhile services.


Yogamour Yoga and Mindfulness Classes in Jaipur, India

Training Our Teachers:

We are overjoyed that Toni and Kerri have been accepted to an advanced yoga teacher training, Shakti Initiation: an all female 500 Hour Women's Leadership & Yoga Training,  in Bali Indonesia.  The long distance learning portion of our studies officially began in September with weekly conference calls to discuss assignments and readings. The month-long training immersion itself, takes place in February of 2016. 

Our plans:

Upon completing the SHAKTI Leadership Program, we plan to bring our advanced and embodied knowledge back to the US and beyond. Our advanced training, focused on leadership, will allow us to offer more comprehensive seva workshops and yoga classes.  We plan to bring the treasure of compassionate curiosity, empowerment, and leadership skills to everyone in our lives, here and abroad, including our future yoga students.

About Yogamour and our work:

Yogamour’s mission is to foster health and wellness in under-served communities through local and global outreach, while inspiring members to bring their ‘yoga’ off of the mat and into the world in the form of ‘seva’ or selfless service.

Local work: 

Yogamour has developed and successfully presented several 8 week trauma sensitive yoga and mindfulness programs for Heartly House. For over 30 years, Heartly House has been serving Frederick County residents who have been impacted by domestic violence, sexual assault, and child abuse.  Domestic Violence: Healing through yoga 

Our local seva teachers offer on-going donation classes at the Bernard Brown Community Center in Frederick, Maryland. Donations for these classes benefit relative community projects and global services.

Also, Yoga for Cancer, Nutrition and Wellness programs will be offered by Yogamour at local cancer centers. 


Yogamour Seva - Donation Yoga Classes at the Brown Community Center


Global Work: 

Yogamour seva projects currently operate in Thailand and India by creating free health care clinics and the offering of proper support of education through volunteerism and the participation of partner non-profit organizations. We have provided aid for over 300 children that are severely impoverished, at risk of being trafficked, joining the workforce at a young age or simply having extremely limited options in life.


Yogamour Education Project and Henna Fun at the Vihaan School in India



Yogamour Dental and Eye Clinic Projects for the Akha Hilltribe School in Thailand

How can you help and what's in it for you?

Donate whatever feels right for you. Every little bit helps. Perks are offered, if you would like a little something extra for your kindness. Otherwise, the gift you'll receive is our gratitude, the gift of giving and knowing you've had a positive ripple effect in the world!

Even if you cannot contribute, please spread the word via your Facebook, Twitter or by whatever means you can. Just grab the link and pass it on. Help us, Help Them!

Where is the money going?

Indiegogo fees: 8% of all donations raised (plus 30 cents per transaction)

Shakti Initiation training: $4500 each

plane tickets: $1200 each

books: $65 each

immunizations: $100 each

travel insurance: $300 each

Your generous donation will provide a healing touch to so many lives and is also tax deductible. 

Anything we make above and beyond our goal will go to yogamour's local charitable programs. If you prefer to make a direct donation to the yogamour projects, please visit www.yogamour.org. 

Thank you so much for visiting and reading about our campaign!


With love and gratitude,

The Shaktinis

story:
PADMAPUR VILLAGE SCHOOL

We are collecting funds for the construction of a primary school in Padmapur Village, Saharsa, Bihar, India.  This is an extremely poor and isolated village, without any proper transport connections or any real school.  At the moment, the children are studying under the trees as they wait for the school to be built!  The fund collection is being co-ordinated by AMURTEL Germany.  Our local volunteers in India are supervising the construction, and one of our European volunteers will visit and follow-up on the progress. 

A school for the village children has the capacity to change the prospects of the whole village, and the future of every child and family involved.  Our school will be managed by women, with an important focus on the enrolment of girls.  We are convinced that quality rural schools are also an important contributor to sustainable development. 

The total cost of construction of the 8 classroom is just 5000 dollars, a very small amount considering the potential impact.  Some of the money has already been collected, and this campaign is to collect the remaining 2000 dollars.  Because we are working with local volunteers, with a knowledge of the area, we are able to do the work at a minimum cost.  With just 2000 dollars more we can complete the whole building as quickly as possible, and our children can have classrooms to shelter them from the winter cold, summer heat and monsoon rains.  Even if we don´t collect all the money with this campaign, your donations will still go towards construction, and we will continue fundraising until we have enough.  There is no doubt that this project will be completed.

When you donate over 250 dollars, we will send you a  framed photo signed by the students!
If you can´t donate much, consider giving just 5 dollars and sharing this campaign with everyone you know!
From January-July this year we  of were successful in collecting 2800 euros for construction of another school in Shivpuri, Madhya Pradesh, and the 1200m2 building, with 120 students is now completed.  With your help, this next project can be equally successful!

story:
Help fund the statewide tour of a live documentary play about the struggle to save public education in Pennsylvania.

After standing-room-only shows at Philadelphia’s National Constitution Center in April, we’re taking this compelling play about the precarious state of public education back to the people who lent us their voices and stories. This October, we’re traveling across the state, putting on free performances to spark conversations and engage citizens.

School Play is a work of grassroots theatre, woven from the narratives of hundreds of Pennsylvanians affected by our state’s school funding crisis. The play is entirely crowd-sourced; the script is derived from the words of students, parents, educators and legislators, and is available online for anyone to perform.

Artists Arden Kass, Seth Bauer and Edward Sobel created School Play out of our personal concern for our kids and our communities. The result is a funny, sad, straight-talking documentary theatre piece, told through the words of real people.

You can read more about School Play here, here, here and here.


Our show is free for all - every cent you give helps us reach more people.

Through fantastically generous donations, we have already raised the bulk of our tour budget. The final, critical $15,000 will fund the following essentials:

  • Press Agent/Social Media Consultant – to ensure that School Play will have the impact our public education system needs and deserves
  • Sound equipment rental– so you can actually hear our fabulous cast!
  • Sets – one big banner and six (matching) folding chairs are all we need
  • Vehicle Rental – so we don’t have to cross our fingers and rely on our own antiquated artist cars
  • Travel Overtime –our actors deserve overtime pay for the great job they do (and the lousy food on the road)
  • Videographer – to document our interactions with audiences along the way 

If we don’t achieve our full goal, yes, we will still hit the road (this show must go on!),  and our hardworking cast will put on a first rate performance under any circumstances. However, it’ll be an even more bare-bones production and, more importantly, we won’t be able to stop for spontaneous performances or generate the kind of impact we’ve seen this play have. But we will get this bus on the road because we’re already booked into venues!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • BUTTS IN SEATS! In Philly? Attend a free reading at Philadelphia Theatre Company at the Suzanne Roberts Theatre on September 16th at 7pm. 
  • PACK THE HOUSE. Have friends or family in PA? Check our tour schedule and drag folks to our free events. Write to your state legislators and get them in here, too!
  • BE A GOOD ACTOR. Host a reading or production of your own. Everything you need is available online. Just keep us posted so we can brag about your event. Or simply read our script and quote it, often! (If you’re an actor, check out these extraordinary characters – they make amazing audition pieces.)
  • TALK ABOUT US, PLEASE! Like us on Facebook. Tweet about the play or post pictures and images from presentations you’re in.
  • DROP THE MIC. By putting genuine human faces and voices to the stories of those affected by the neglect of our public education system, School Play helps make a complex problem relatable to everyone. By engaging hearts and minds in diverse communities, it helps empower our audiences to demand the “thorough and efficient” public education promised by our state constitution. Read our play. Then, deliver a monologue of your own.

story:
MAIN GOAL 

Improve physical and cognitive development of children, prenatal through age five, through an evidence-based approach to child well-being.

1. NUTRITIONAL SUPPLEMENTATION:

Use whole, culturally acceptable foods to supplement dietary deficiencies on a daily basis.

2. COOKING/FEEDING EDUCATION:

Educate and train mothers in food preparation and appropriate breastfeeding and feeding practices.

3. HYGIENE:

Focus on environmental issues related to improving sanitation, creating a hygienic environment, and utilizing purified water.

4. COGNITIVE STIMULATION:

Teach parents cognitive stimulation techniques to improve children’s mental development.

5. MONITOR:

Monitor growth and development at all stages of intervention to evaluate success and to compare our program to results achieved from other common interventions used in Guatemala.

MAIN GOAL Improve physical and cognitive development of children, prenatal through age five, through an evidence-based approach to child well-being.
1. NUTRITIONAL SUPPLEMENTATION: 
Use whole, culturally acceptable foods to supplement dietary deficiencies on a daily basis.
2. COOKING/FEEDING EDUCATION: 
Educate and train mothers in food preparation and appropriate breastfeeding and feeding practices.
3. HYGIENE: 
Focus on environmental issues related to improving sanitation, creating a hygienic environment, and utilizing purified water.
4. COGNITIVE STIMULATION: 
Teach parents cognitive stimulation techniques to improve children’s mental development.
5. MONITOR: Monitor growth and development at all stages of intervention to evaluate success and to compare our program to results achieved from other common interventions used in Guatemala.

story:
We're Building a Farm Preschool!

"Within the child lies the fate of the future" - Maria Montessori

Roots & Wings Montessori, Inc. (501c3) is the realized passion of a dedicated group of individuals who want to contribute to Kansas City by providing a quality, nature-based Pre-K education to students in the metro area.  We have a vision of creating a one-of-a-kind farm school that will serve children and build a supportive community focused on educating future generations.

Roots & Wings Montessori Farm School is being created to address the existing and increasing demand for a unique and extraordinary early childhood education.  Once the Pre-K program is in stable operating mode, we plan on an implementing an aggressive capital campaign to expand the school program, adding grade levels year over year until it serves students Pre-K through the 12th grade. 

Here's How You Can Help

We are raising money for the purchase of the property and renovation of the existing 4615 sq/ft home that will be converted into a four classroom school.  Your partnership is needed to provide this unique opportunity to the kids in KC!

This house sits on 52 pristine acres seven minutes from three major highways in Kansas City, KS.  The property houses an existing horse stables, milk barn, goat barn, chicken coop and will provide the space for a 5 acre organic farm and homestead.

Your contributions will be used to directly impact the education of 72 Pre-K children in the Kansas City metro area.  This education initiative is innovative to Kansas City - it is about educating the "Whole Child" by reintroducing unstructured, free play back into the curriculum for Pre-K students.

There are more than 70 students on the waiting list... and the list grows longer every day.  All of this without marketing - just word of mouth.

Risks & Challenges

The longer it takes us to raise the funds to purchase the property and renovate the existing house, the higher the risk of the property going to another interested party.  We have an amazing relationship with the seller, and he has been a cheerleader in helping us navigate city codes, inspections, site planning, and other pre-purchase activities.  He will only wait so long, though, so we need your help!

Your Partnership is Crucial in MANY Ways

Your financial contributions are appreciate, but we also invite you to connect with us on Facebook (rootsandwingskc), Twitter (@rootsandwingskc), or visit our website (www.rootsandwingskc.org) to share our story with your friends and family and help us by keeping our story in the forefront of your minds.  The opportunity we are creating will impact many generations to come.

We've done this before - but we need your help in building a bigger program

"The children and nature movement is fueled by this fundamental idea: the child in nature is an endangered species, and the health of children and the health of the Earth are inseparable." - Richard Louv

Roots & Wings Montessori Farm School is the expanded vision of our current school, Little Sprouts Montessori.  Little Sprouts Montessori was established in 2005 by Natalie Reeder, who had previously worked for Christot’s Montessori Day School in Shawnee, KS from 2001-2005. As a certified Montessori teacher who believes education is not only a methodology, but also a way of life, it was a dream of hers to own and operate a nature-based Montessori preschool. The dream started in a portion of her renovated basement with 3 students while she simultaneously homeschooled her two children and waited tables four nights per week to make ends meet. Natalie has a varied and valuable work history that helped shaped her into a well-rounded and highly effective Montessori teacher. As a previous yoga instructor, private vegan chef and landscape artist, Natalie has incorporated this background into her Montessori teaching style over the past 13 years. Natalie believes that in addition to the “basics”, we must provide a full range of educational and creative opportunities. Little Sprouts Montessori nurtures and leads children through a physical, intellectual, spiritual, and social-emotional path that is well prepared but constantly changing to meet the children's every need and interest. When children are introduced to their academic foundation through self-discovery and fun, they can move through their school career driven by an inner desire to learn.

Watching the Children Thrive in Nature

"Play gives children a chance to practice what they are learning." - Fred Rogers

Little Sprouts provides its students with a beautiful, comfortable, inviting  classroom to grow in and loving, safe, encouraging teachers to guide them in their developing interests.  Little Sprouts Montessori’s mission is to teach essential life skills and support academic learning through hands-on activities. A Montessori education is referred to as an “education for life”. The program is strong in academics, while stressing life skills such as problem solving, courteous behavior and self-expression. The holistic approach, addresses each child individually to maximize their potential. They are dedicated to helping each child discover their unique potential academically, socially and interpersonally.  Just as they nurture and grow the plants in their garden, the students are nurtured and blossom into confident and joyful little people. 

The Time to Expand is Now

We have located the perfect property for Roots and Wings Montessori Farm School.  It is set on 52 pristine acres, only seven minutes from three major highways.  We want to continue the vision of Little Sprouts Montessori to meet the existing and increasing demand for a unique and extraordinary early childhood education. We are creating a Montessori-based, ecologically sustainable environmental education program.  Our vision is to renovate the existing 4,615 sq. ft. home into four classrooms with an attached greenhouse. The school will start out with two toddler (18 mo.-3 years) classrooms and two Primary (3 yrs.-6 yrs.) classrooms, adding grades each year until Roots and Wings Montessori Farm School grows to serve children from Pre-K through 12th grade. 

This is model of education is loosely based on Hershey Montessori School in Concord, OH and Nature’s Classroom Institute in Mukwonago, WI. The two story historic barn built in 1885 will be renovated and converted into a multi-use building to be used as an additional classroom for the students, a workshop space for continuing education for  parents, teachers and community; offering classes on yoga, nutrition, and homesteading. The lower level will continue to support stables for the horses. The barn will be historically preserved thereby the children and community at large will be able to appreciate this local historical landmark. The existing stables will be renovated and at least two horses will be acquired for the purpose of offering riding lessons to the students.

The Students Will Work and Run the Farm

"What is learned with joy will not soon be forgotten." - unknown

The students will be involved in every aspect of running and working the farm.  Up to five acres of land will be devoted to organic farming, including an orchard with apple, peach and pear trees, raspberries, blackberries, blueberries and strawberries, grapes, walnut, pecan, almond and hazelnut trees, as well as sugar maples for tapping and making maple syrup with the students. The water source will either be from a well or a water catchment system from a fresh water stream on the property that runs year round.  We intend to establish a one acre Monarch Way Station as a sanctuary for the Monarch butterflies; providing a beautiful experience for the children to witness the migration of the Monarch butterflies every year. There are plans to construct a pond on the property where the children will explore pond life and learn how to fish, thus learning biology and basic life skills. Additionally, sheep and goats will be added to the farm, and the students will have lessons on milking and making goat milk soap, shearing sheep, cleaning, dying, and creating yarn from wool. Bees will be kept on the property and the children will have lessons on how to make natural products from the bees wax such as candles, lip balms, and lotions, not to mention the sheer pleasure of eating fresh honey!

Working to Minimize our Carbon Footprint

"We cannot expect a generation of children that are not connected to the Earth to care about saving her." - unknown

In addition to being an innovative leader in education, the sustainable Roots and Wings Montessori Farm School will be progressive in its design and stand out as an inspiration to all who visit. The property will harness the suns energy through solar and passive solar energy for all of the buildings, a solar panel garden, geothermal heating and cooling and green technology. The water will be provided by the stream, ponds and a possible well. One of the main objectives of Roots & Wings is to close the child/nature gap and thereby reconnecting children to the source of all life, our Earth, and in turn healing it.
story_txt:
We're Building a Farm Preschool! "Within the child lies the fate of the future" - Maria Montessori
Roots & Wings Montessori, Inc. (501c3) is the realized passion of a dedicated group of individuals who want to contribute to Kansas City by providing a quality, nature-based Pre-K education to students in the metro area.  We have a vision of creating a one-of-a-kind farm school that will serve children and build a supportive community focused on educating future generations.
Roots & Wings Montessori Farm School is being created to address the existing and increasing demand for a unique and extraordinary early childhood education.  Once the Pre-K program is in stable operating mode, we plan on an implementing an aggressive capital campaign to expand the school program, adding grade levels year over year until it serves students Pre-K through the 12th grade. 



Here's How You Can Help

We are raising money for the purchase of the property and renovation of the existing 4615 sq/ft home that will be converted into a four classroom school.  Your partnership is needed to provide this unique opportunity to the kids in KC!
This house sits on 52 pristine acres seven minutes from three major highways in Kansas City, KS.  The property houses an existing horse stables, milk barn, goat barn, chicken coop and will provide the space for a 5 acre organic farm and homestead.
Your contributions will be used to directly impact the education of 72 Pre-K children in the Kansas City metro area.  This education initiative is innovative to Kansas City - it is about educating the "Whole Child" by reintroducing unstructured, free play back into the curriculum for Pre-K students.
There are more than 70 students on the waiting list... and the list grows longer every day.  All of this without marketing - just word of mouth.


Risks & Challenges


The longer it takes us to raise the funds to purchase the property and renovate the existing house, the higher the risk of the property going to another interested party.  We have an amazing relationship with the seller, and he has been a cheerleader in helping us navigate city codes, inspections, site planning, and other pre-purchase activities.  He will only wait so long, though, so we need your help!

Your Partnership is Crucial in MANY Ways

Your financial contributions are appreciate, but we also invite you to connect with us on Facebook (rootsandwingskc), Twitter (@rootsandwingskc), or visit our website (www.rootsandwingskc.org) to share our story with your friends and family and help us by keeping our story in the forefront of your minds.  The opportunity we are creating will impact many generations to come.


We've done this before - but we need your help in building a bigger program



"The children and nature movement is fueled by this fundamental idea: the child in nature is an endangered species, and the health of children and the health of the Earth are inseparable." - Richard Louv
Roots & Wings Montessori Farm School is the expanded vision of our current school, Little Sprouts Montessori.  Little Sprouts Montessori was established in 2005 by Natalie Reeder, who had previously worked for Christot’s Montessori Day School in Shawnee, KS from 2001-2005. As a certified Montessori teacher who believes education is not only a methodology, but also a way of life, it was a dream of hers to own and operate a nature-based Montessori preschool. The dream started in a portion of her renovated basement with 3 students while she simultaneously homeschooled her two children and waited tables four nights per week to make ends meet. Natalie has a varied and valuable work history that helped shaped her into a well-rounded and highly effective Montessori teacher. As a previous yoga instructor, private vegan chef and landscape artist, Natalie has incorporated this background into her Montessori teaching style over the past 13 years. Natalie believes that in addition to the “basics”, we must provide a full range of educational and creative opportunities. Little Sprouts Montessori nurtures and leads children through a physical, intellectual, spiritual, and social-emotional path that is well prepared but constantly changing to meet the children's every need and interest. When children are introduced to their academic foundation through self-discovery and fun, they can move through their school career driven by an inner desire to learn.

Watching the Children Thrive in Nature
"Play gives children a chance to practice what they are learning." - Fred Rogers
Little Sprouts provides its students with a beautiful, comfortable, inviting  classroom to grow in and loving, safe, encouraging teachers to guide them in their developing interests.  Little Sprouts Montessori’s mission is to teach essential life skills and support academic learning through hands-on activities. A Montessori education is referred to as an “education for life”. The program is strong in academics, while stressing life skills such as problem solving, courteous behavior and self-expression. The holistic approach, addresses each child individually to maximize their potential. They are dedicated to helping each child discover their unique potential academically, socially and interpersonally.  Just as they nurture and grow the plants in their garden, the students are nurtured and blossom into confident and joyful little people. 
The Time to Expand is Now
We have located the perfect property for Roots and Wings Montessori Farm School.  It is set on 52 pristine acres, only seven minutes from three major highways.  We want to continue the vision of Little Sprouts Montessori to meet the existing and increasing demand for a unique and extraordinary early childhood education. We are creating a Montessori-based, ecologically sustainable environmental education program.  Our vision is to renovate the existing 4,615 sq. ft. home into four classrooms with an attached greenhouse. The school will start out with two toddler (18 mo.-3 years) classrooms and two Primary (3 yrs.-6 yrs.) classrooms, adding grades each year until Roots and Wings Montessori Farm School grows to serve children from Pre-K through 12th grade. 
This is model of education is loosely based on Hershey Montessori School in Concord, OH and Nature’s Classroom Institute in Mukwonago, WI. The two story historic barn built in 1885 will be renovated and converted into a multi-use building to be used as an additional classroom for the students, a workshop space for continuing education for  parents, teachers and community; offering classes on yoga, nutrition, and homesteading. The lower level will continue to support stables for the horses. The barn will be historically preserved thereby the children and community at large will be able to appreciate this local historical landmark. The existing stables will be renovated and at least two horses will be acquired for the purpose of offering riding lessons to the students.

The Students Will Work and Run the Farm
"What is learned with joy will not soon be forgotten." - unknown
The students will be involved in every aspect of running and working the farm.  Up to five acres of land will be devoted to organic farming, including an orchard with apple, peach and pear trees, raspberries, blackberries, blueberries and strawberries, grapes, walnut, pecan, almond and hazelnut trees, as well as sugar maples for tapping and making maple syrup with the students. The water source will either be from a well or a water catchment system from a fresh water stream on the property that runs year round.  We intend to establish a one acre Monarch Way Station as a sanctuary for the Monarch butterflies; providing a beautiful experience for the children to witness the migration of the Monarch butterflies every year. There are plans to construct a pond on the property where the children will explore pond life and learn how to fish, thus learning biology and basic life skills. Additionally, sheep and goats will be added to the farm, and the students will have lessons on milking and making goat milk soap, shearing sheep, cleaning, dying, and creating yarn from wool. Bees will be kept on the property and the children will have lessons on how to make natural products from the bees wax such as candles, lip balms, and lotions, not to mention the sheer pleasure of eating fresh honey!

Working to Minimize our Carbon Footprint

"We cannot expect a generation of children that are not connected to the Earth to care about saving her." - unknown
In addition to being an innovative leader in education, the sustainable Roots and Wings Montessori Farm School will be progressive in its design and stand out as an inspiration to all who visit. The property will harness the suns energy through solar and passive solar energy for all of the buildings, a solar panel garden, geothermal heating and cooling and green technology. The water will be provided by the stream, ponds and a possible well. One of the main objectives of Roots & Wings is to close the child/nature gap and thereby reconnecting children to the source of all life, our Earth, and in turn healing it.

story:
Short Summary

Inno Garage, the company behind world's fastest organic fertilizer and world's first compact forest is up with an other innovation - Neo Quotient - A solution to make education and basic skills accessible across the globe. 

Neo Quotient is a SaaS platform that helps kids across the globe in improving their skills and intellect. These skills are especially important in the case of kids from developing and war-torn countries with limited access to school. Education is the only source to end the conflict in many of the countries. Your contribution will help in making the world a better place. 

While, you gain good karma by helping these kids in getting better education, you will also get a complementary licence of the Neo Quotient to your email account. 

The complimentary account will help you in avoiding deadly brain disorders like Alzheimer's, cerebral palsy and memory loss. This product also helps your kids in improving their intelligence in a gamified manner. So, what are you waiting for? Contribute right away and gift yourself a better world. 

Why Neo Quotient :

There are thousands of sites that are available on the internet that provide knowledge. One may ask why only Neo Quotient ? 

  • Research-Backed Syllabus: Our unique pedagogy bases itself on research of over 200 educationists and over 100 course designers. 
  • Psycho-metrics: Our course is designed to assess and improve the psychology of the kids
  • Artificial Intelligence: The course is designed to accommodate artificial learning. This helps the course in effectively improving as the improving with the passing time. 
  • Geographical Variance: The learning requirements changes dramatically based on the region and language. Biggest challenge for us is to create standardized syllabus with geographical variance. 

Website can be accessed across mobile, desktop, tablet and laptop platforms, all the existing browsers and works in even low connectivity. The real-time analytics of the site help in improved learning of the students. We also provide expert analysis of each of the tests that the kids take and help them in improving their skills. 

Challenges:

In developing this platform, we have the following problems. :

  • Geographical Variance: The learning requirements changes dramatically based on the region and language. Biggest challenge for us is to create standardized syllabus with geographical variance. 
  • Technology : The biggest issue is acquiring technology. We have another 300 man hours of work left on the website and need help with server to provide flawlesss experience to the kids. 

Funding Breakdown

We look forward to raise 100,000 USD. This amount will be spent judiciously on :

  • Helping the Kids: We will be providing the  tool to about 10,000 kids in Asia and Africa. It will cost us about 9 $ to provide the tool for one year to the donors and the kids. 
  • Tool Enhancement: We have developed a tool that functions well. However, UI has to be improved.
  • Server: Server Has to be upgraded if we have to accommodate 20,000 kids (10000 beneficiaries + 10000 Donors). 

The Impact

Over 10,000 kids will be benefited though this program. Think of the impact it will have in the countries will literacy rate of less than 40% 

Other Ways You Can Help

It's okay if you are not able to contribute FINANCIALLY. But, that is not the only way you could contribute.

1.  Come teach a class online: Please send your interest and the topic you can teach. Help hundreds of students in understanding a subject better. 

2.  Help spread the word: Share a word on your social profiles. Be it facebook, twitter or myspace! Who knows your friend's contribution may help us reach a new kid!

story:
Short Summary

SPF Maker Club started out as a small group dedicated to bringing the Maker Movement to the Scotch Plains - Fanwood community. The first meeting hardly received any interest, in fact, we only had one visitor. As the club's president, a sophomore in high school with the skills but not the supplies, I didn't believe that SPF Maker Club could succeed. With no funding, it didn't seem feasible, and so an entire summer went by and SPF Maker Club didn't meet. Then, towards the end of the summer, my mother encouraged me to try a Mini Maker Faire in the park near our house. With little enthusiasm, I organized the faire, posted flyers around the town, and on the day of the faire, hunkered down and waited. And what do you know? Forty people showed up!

SPF Make took off from there. For the past two years, we have had monthly Maker meets, participated in the New Jersey Makers Day, gotten our own 3D printer and just last month, got selected as a Maker Camp affiliate site! All self-funded with no cost to our members. But, in the process of organizing our Makers Camp, we have found ourselves faced with raising the money for possibly the most dreaded challenge of all: liability insurance....

What We Need & What You Get

SPF Make's goal is to keep the Makers Camp as accessible as possible for our local makers. The high school has approved the use of their facilities for the Maker Camp, but they require liability insurance, and the estimated cost is upwards of $1,200! 

For a self-funded group, it's either charge our campers $50 a week, or raise the money to cover the costs. All donations to SPF Make will go into lowering the cost of admissions (hopefully to zero!), to give our campers the best, most accessible experience possible. 

If SPF Make does not receive enough to run the camp, all donations will go right back to our funders. Contributors - expect great surprises at your doorstep!

The Impact

The Maker Movement has spread to communities all over world because it strives to verse its youth in technology and innovation, necessities of this day and age. Scotch Plains has a strong school system, but as a community, it lacks in it's drive to get it's hands dirty and break things. Whereas other towns have embraced the Maker Movement, with makerspaces and mini maker faires, Scotch Plains-Fanwood is lagging behind. 

The SPF Maker Camp opens all of these opportunities to children in the Scotch Plains (and Fanwood) community and beyond. And most importantly, our goal is to offer it to them for free - to introduce any and every child with the curiosity and the interest, and expose them to a world where creation is at their fingertips and learning is always fun. 

Risks & Challenges

Time. We don't have that much time, at all...

The Maker Camp, in all honesty, was a spur of the moment thing. I was on my computer during class (I was supposed to be writing an essay) surfing the internet for something to build for our next Maker Club meeting, and the Maker Camp site showed up. I saw the "Become an affiliate" button, filled out the form and promptly forgot about it. Two weeks later, I got an email titled "Congratulations..." and the rest is history. 

That was also two weeks before school let out. 

Now, SPF Make is organizing a summer camp in under four weeks, and there is a good chance that without sufficient funding, we won't be able to offer the full extent of the camp. Liability insurance coverage in such short time remains a risk, however, there's a chance we will make it. The SPF Maker Camp's success rests on our contributors. All the key components of the camp are in place, our volunteers are ready, our projects have been chosen, but to get all the parts moving, we need donations. The oil for this machine. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Interested in supporting SPF Make outside of just donations? There are plenty of ways to help out. 

  • Spread the word!
  • Support us on our social media accounts or offer us some project ideas
  • Send us some of your junk! Really. We'll recycle your old electronics, use the arts and crafts supplies, tools... You get the idea. As long as it's clean and non-toxic, we'll take it. One man's trash is another man's treasure.
  • Are you a local? Stop by at one of our meetings! You can join the club or volunteer - we love new faces.
