story:
Helping Hands Around the World plans to provide a school for under-served children in Biara, Nigeria.  Over the course of the last few years, this part of the world has fallen into increasingly abject poverty.  The average family in the region lives on less than $1 per day.  This is a region where 65% of children receive no primary education, because their families cannot afford to send them to school.  As a result, the cycle of local poverty and poor educational opportunity is deepening.  Today, many children in Ogoniland, Nigeria, do not have an equivalent access to educational opportunities as do their peers in other parts of Nigeria.  A recent research survey in Ogoniland revealed that 40% of Ogoni children do not have any primary education, 60% of Ogoni children do not have access to secondary education, 75% of children do not have college education, and 90% of adults do not have full-time employment.  The lack of access to basic educational facilities and gainful employment is of course related, and it reinforces a continual cycle of deepening poverty in the region -- poor families unable to afford school fees, books, uniforms and shoes for their children produce future generations with access only to more of the same, or worse.  To further worsen the already bad situation, due to a regional teacher strike in the area, there was no schooling in the area at all last year.

To begin to address this situation, The Dookue Memorial School, was established to improve access to a better quality of education for the children of Biara, Ogoniland and build foundations for a better future.  The name of the school honors Chief Dookue Naanee.
The Dookue Memorial School is named for a man who valued education.  Though he did not complete high school, Chief Dookue Naanee knew the value of education.  He helped many families, in Biara, to invest in their children by paying school fees for those children to go to elementary and secondary school.  He even had the opportunity to help with providing funds for college bound students. Chief Dookue was a farmer and made his money from what he produced from his land.  He had five children of his own and all graduated from high school and had opportunities to go to college.  This man was my father.  He had knowledge that went far beyond his education.  He was widely respected by the community he lived in and by the neighboring towns surrounding Biara. Though my father has passed away, before he died his last words to me was to "take care of the children."  I believe this project is the epitome of how he felt about children and education.  Since education was very important to him this project goes hand in hand with the support he gave all of his life.  Being his eldest son, I have the utmost respect for all he has done and this school would be a great way to carry on his legacy of making sure each child should have the opportunity to receive an education.

Dookue Memorial School will also provide a generation of youth in the area the ability to eat healthy meals at the school to guarantee that they are prepared for the learning process, and to provide an atmosphere where the same children are able to learn and develop habits for continuing education.  Dookue Memorial School already has one unimproved building in place, as well as a small staff of teachers and administrators who are ready for the program to launch.  Any funds obtained in this campaign will be used for teacher salaries, nutrition for the students, desks, chairs, educational infrastructure, supplies, and a small number of computers so that the children can be exposed to, and benefit from, high-tech learning tools.

Description of Existing Site, and Plans for the Future

The land and some unimproved structures has been donated for use to the school.  The students of the school will have access to  classrooms, a computer lab, and a library.  Each classroom will have one teacher, and one assistant teacher.  In each classroom, the student body will consist of 30 children between the ages of four and six years.  One kitchen staff and the two assistant teachers will cook, make sure all of the children are fed, and perform cleanup duties.  There will be one administrator and one office staff to keep and maintain records, to promote the vision and mission of the school, and to provide backup for other duties as needed.  The facility has a kitchen and several classrooms, with bathrooms on the first floor.  On the second floor there are eight rooms and two bathrooms for classrooms and storage areas, with an extra room allowing for future expansion of capacity to serve more youth in the area, once the program is in place and fully staffed.

The computer lab will house computer systems so that the students are able to learn, communicate, and familiarize themselves with technological learning tools, sometimes for the first time.  The Learning Center will aid in educating and empowering the youth so that the cycle of poverty as a by-product of an educational lack can come to an end.

Dookue Memorial School will set as the first and most important step towards the transformation of an area that is universally affected by poverty.  Children in the area regularly go from morning until night without food or any kind of nutrition.  Helping Hands recognizes this as a major roadblock of the learning process, and because of that, will have a program in place that will allow for students to receive breakfast and lunch during school days.  This will ensure that our efforts have the most effective possible results, and that the students are properly equipped for a learning environment.

What We Need 

Our goal is for $15,000. The funds will be going for supplies and equipment as well as funding the salaries for teachers and administrative staff.  Below is a breakdown of the items we will need.                                                                                  .

  • 40 Student desks
  • 40 chairs
  • Blackboard
  • Chalk
  • Whiteboard
  • Generator
  • Refrigerator
  • 22 Computers
  • 3 Printers
  • 20 Ipad
  • Office supplies (office desks, tables, chairs; paper, pencil, paper clips; file folder, etc.)
  • Staff salaries for 1 year (4 teachers/aides, 2 administrative office staff $125/month), $9,000
  • Kitchen supplies (pots, pans, trays, etc.) 

What you Get

  1. For a $25.00 contribution - A Helping Hands Around the World wristband.
  2. For a $100.00 contribution - A Helping Hands Around the World T-Shirt.
  3. For a $1000 contribution - A Donor sign with your name on it displayed in the School.

We are sure we will reach our goal but if we don't, any contributions received will still be used for the a scaled down version of our project.  This may involve serving less students and hiring less staff with the anticipation that we will be able to increase services at a later time.

The Impact

Helping Hands Around the World is a nonprofit humanitarian organization dedicated to working with families, children, and the global community in order to allow the children of the world to reach their full potential through economic and educational empowerment.  The goal of our organization is to increase access to quality education in under-served areas, to promote educational wellness, and to empower positive change in communities.  The mission of Helping Hands Around the World is to promote economic empowerment by provisioning funds, goods and services in any part of the world seeking support and financial assistance, to provide access to education to children and families through community-based solutions, and to promote positive change to communities based on awareness of the responsibility to the rest of the world,

Your contribution to Dookue Memorial School will make what was impossible, possible.  You will have the opportunity to help children who would otherwise not have the opportunity to go to school. These children would live in despair and without hope.  This is our chance to help these families break the cycle of poverty.  Your contribution would allow these children to go to a school locally thus providing a great relief for the families who are unable to afford the expense of school let alone the cost of other expenses like food and sometimes room and board.  You will be giving these children a chance to compete with the rest of the world.  The future of our children depends on all of us to help make the future of the world and of our children brighter.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute, it doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Ask friends, family and co-workers to get the word out and make some noise about our project.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools, social media including but not limited to Facebook.
  • Visit our website, www.helpinghandsaroundtheworld.com, for more information and updates on the project.
story_txt:
Helping Hands Around the World plans to provide a school for under-served children in Biara, Nigeria.  Over the course of the last few years, this part of the world has fallen into increasingly abject poverty.  The average family in the region lives on less than $1 per day.  This is a region where 65% of children receive no primary education, because their families cannot afford to send them to school.  As a result, the cycle of local poverty and poor educational opportunity is deepening.  Today, many children in Ogoniland, Nigeria, do not have an equivalent access to educational opportunities as do their peers in other parts of Nigeria.  A recent research survey in Ogoniland revealed that 40% of Ogoni children do not have any primary education, 60% of Ogoni children do not have access to secondary education, 75% of children do not have college education, and 90% of adults do not have full-time employment.  The lack of access to basic educational facilities and gainful employment is of course related, and it reinforces a continual cycle of deepening poverty in the region -- poor families unable to afford school fees, books, uniforms and shoes for their children produce future generations with access only to more of the same, or worse.  To further worsen the already bad situation, due to a regional teacher strike in the area, there was no schooling in the area at all last year.To begin to address this situation, The Dookue Memorial School, was established to improve access to a better quality of education for the children of Biara, Ogoniland and build foundations for a better future.  The name of the school honors Chief Dookue Naanee.
The Dookue Memorial School is named for a man who valued education.  Though he did not complete high school, Chief Dookue Naanee knew the value of education.  He helped many families, in Biara, to invest in their children by paying school fees for those children to go to elementary and secondary school.  He even had the opportunity to help with providing funds for college bound students. Chief Dookue was a farmer and made his money from what he produced from his land.  He had five children of his own and all graduated from high school and had opportunities to go to college.  This man was my father.  He had knowledge that went far beyond his education.  He was widely respected by the community he lived in and by the neighboring towns surrounding Biara. Though my father has passed away, before he died his last words to me was to "take care of the children."  I believe this project is the epitome of how he felt about children and education.  Since education was very important to him this project goes hand in hand with the support he gave all of his life.  Being his eldest son, I have the utmost respect for all he has done and this school would be a great way to carry on his legacy of making sure each child should have the opportunity to receive an education.

Dookue Memorial School will also provide a generation of youth in the area the ability to eat healthy meals at the school to guarantee that they are prepared for the learning process, and to provide an atmosphere where the same children are able to learn and develop habits for continuing education.  Dookue Memorial School already has one unimproved building in place, as well as a small staff of teachers and administrators who are ready for the program to launch.  Any funds obtained in this campaign will be used for teacher salaries, nutrition for the students, desks, chairs, educational infrastructure, supplies, and a small number of computers so that the children can be exposed to, and benefit from, high-tech learning tools.
Description of Existing Site, and Plans for the Future
The land and some unimproved structures has been donated for use to the school.  The students of the school will have access to  classrooms, a computer lab, and a library.  Each classroom will have one teacher, and one assistant teacher.  In each classroom, the student body will consist of 30 children between the ages of four and six years.  One kitchen staff and the two assistant teachers will cook, make sure all of the children are fed, and perform cleanup duties.  There will be one administrator and one office staff to keep and maintain records, to promote the vision and mission of the school, and to provide backup for other duties as needed.  The facility has a kitchen and several classrooms, with bathrooms on the first floor.  On the second floor there are eight rooms and two bathrooms for classrooms and storage areas, with an extra room allowing for future expansion of capacity to serve more youth in the area, once the program is in place and fully staffed.
The computer lab will house computer systems so that the students are able to learn, communicate, and familiarize themselves with technological learning tools, sometimes for the first time.  The Learning Center will aid in educating and empowering the youth so that the cycle of poverty as a by-product of an educational lack can come to an end.
Dookue Memorial School will set as the first and most important step towards the transformation of an area that is universally affected by poverty.  Children in the area regularly go from morning until night without food or any kind of nutrition.  Helping Hands recognizes this as a major roadblock of the learning process, and because of that, will have a program in place that will allow for students to receive breakfast and lunch during school days.  This will ensure that our efforts have the most effective possible results, and that the students are properly equipped for a learning environment.
What We Need 
Our goal is for $15,000. The funds will be going for supplies and equipment as well as funding the salaries for teachers and administrative staff.  Below is a breakdown of the items we will need.                                                                                  .

40 Student desks
40 chairs
Blackboard
Chalk
Whiteboard
Generator
Refrigerator
22 Computers
3 Printers
20 Ipad
Office supplies (office desks, tables, chairs; paper, pencil, paper clips; file folder, etc.)
Staff salaries for 1 year (4 teachers/aides, 2 administrative office staff $125/month), $9,000
Kitchen supplies (pots, pans, trays, etc.) 

What you Get

For a $25.00 contribution - A Helping Hands Around the World wristband.
For a $100.00 contribution - A Helping Hands Around the World T-Shirt.
For a $1000 contribution - A Donor sign with your name on it displayed in the School.

We are sure we will reach our goal but if we don't, any contributions received will still be used for the a scaled down version of our project.  This may involve serving less students and hiring less staff with the anticipation that we will be able to increase services at a later time.
The Impact
Helping Hands Around the World is a nonprofit humanitarian organization dedicated to working with families, children, and the global community in order to allow the children of the world to reach their full potential through economic and educational empowerment.  The goal of our organization is to increase access to quality education in under-served areas, to promote educational wellness, and to empower positive change in communities.  The mission of Helping Hands Around the World is to promote economic empowerment by provisioning funds, goods and services in any part of the world seeking support and financial assistance, to provide access to education to children and families through community-based solutions, and to promote positive change to communities based on awareness of the responsibility to the rest of the world,
Your contribution to Dookue Memorial School will make what was impossible, possible.  You will have the opportunity to help children who would otherwise not have the opportunity to go to school. These children would live in despair and without hope.  This is our chance to help these families break the cycle of poverty.  Your contribution would allow these children to go to a school locally thus providing a great relief for the families who are unable to afford the expense of school let alone the cost of other expenses like food and sometimes room and board.  You will be giving these children a chance to compete with the rest of the world.  The future of our children depends on all of us to help make the future of the world and of our children brighter.  
Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can’t contribute, it doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Ask friends, family and co-workers to get the word out and make some noise about our project.
Use the Indiegogo share tools, social media including but not limited to Facebook.
Visit our website, www.helpinghandsaroundtheworld.com, for more information and updates on the project.

story:
Short Summary

We wish to promote the peace process.

We are located on the border between Israel to Palestine

Making our farm an ideal location where Israeli and Palestinian children can meet,

get to know one another, While learning about nature, Fish and the environment.

We want to develop and to contribute to the regional Community out of our

Knowledge and experience which we accumulated over the past few years,

To bring people together, to enrich them and inform them about nature.

Environmental, educational and peace promoting project.

ABOUT US:

We are MOR-DAG, ornamental fish farm.

We are breading fish in a unique technological facility, environmentally friendly,

inside a greenhouse.

But our fish farm is much-much more: we are using the sun energy in order to

Create algae and zaoflnkton (=tiny water creatures) inside our ponds,

And also in order to heat the ponds and to save energy (combines thermal screen).

Our green water farm simulate a river so the fish are growing in a natural

Healthy environment.

Combined high technology filters and water recycle.

The farm workers are Palestinians and Israelis that are working together

At 100% cooperation and mutual respect and with a friendly spirit.

Research & Development:

We are now starting a new project of breeding and growing rare endangered

Varieties of fish.

History and Nostalgia

MOR-DAG farm established at 01/01/2009.

The farm supervised by the Ministry of Israel Agriculture.

Fish of the farm sent to destinations all over the world and survived perfectly long transport conditions over 40 hours of flight. The fish of the farm are healthy and strong in an extraordinary way and are tested regularly in a professional laboratory using fish health veterinarian experts.

Worldview:

All people should stop fighting each other, wars have no winners, only losers on both sides, and people should invest their energies in saving the nature and contribution to mankind, as best they could.
So we all be worthwhile and our lives and especialy our children's lives will improve greatly.

story:
Faveo Moves App: Makes Moving Easy and Affordable

We provide the muscle for packing, loading, and cleaning services a la carte.


Out of 325 million people in the US, 14% move on an annual basis, which is more than 50 million people!

That means that every year Americans move more than 200 tons of stuff!

This is Where Faveo Comes In:

We know from experience that moving can be overwhelming. It always takes longer than you think, it’s exhausting, and if you hire the help of professional movers it can get very expensive. We wanted to find a way to make the lives of people around the world a lot easier by creating a solution for this onerous chore.

This is where the Faveo Moves app comes in! With Faveo Moves, you can order our moving services from any mobile device on the go. Our professional moving services are there when you need us to help you with the most stressful part of getting your belongings from point A to point B: the packing, unpacking, loading, unloading, and cleaning. Our services are fast, simple, and at $30 an hour, very affordable. With services offered a la carte you only purchase what you need. We’ll take the stress out of your next move without breaking the bank.

  

Mission Statement: “To engender fulfillment with our partners and strengthen community bonds through service and collaboration.”

With this new kind of business model we are strengthening communities by allowing people to help each other through the stress of moving. We are creating jobs and providing benefits those in our community.

Our Helpmates, who are partners, will be able to have flexible schedules that work around their lifestyle, a high-standard pay ($20.00/hour), and the ability to help and network with people in their community.

Customers get reliable help right when they need it at an affordable rate ($30.00/hour/helpmate) and the opportunity to meet someone local who might become their new best friend.

Core Values: Customer Connection, Communication, Integrity, and Safety.

This is How Faveo Moves Works:

Helpmates

It’s simple:

  1. Helpmates, people in the community, sign up through Faveo website to help others with their packing/unpacking, loading/unloading, or cleaning
  2. Background check will be conducted by a third party company
  3. After successful background check, Helpmates provide bank account information for direct deposit purposes and download Faveo App
  4. Helpmates see requests based on their geolocation (can set preferred distance and filter by service they offer)
  5. Helpmates pick up jobs that fit their schedule and earn $20/hr

Customers

Simply log into the app using:

Facebook or your Username and Password


Select:

On Demand (no reservation required) or Scheduled (as far in advance as needed)


Pick the Service you Need:

Packing, Unpacking, Loading, Unloading or Cleaning


After Service is Delivered:

Confirm hours worked and pay via credit card (all services are $30/hr)


Rewards:


Budget:

Goal $20K - to develop Android compatibility and hire a web developer for routine updates and maintenance.

STRETCH GOALS:


Timeline:


Founders:

Xavier Rodriguez | Co-Founder | CEO

Xavier Rodriguez is a serial entrepreneur who is always seeking new mentors and new ways to learn how to do better business.  His strong attention to detail and unwavering determination to be successful has led him to develop the integral parts of what Faveo is becoming. From a small town in New Jersey, he has always sought to improve himself to help his family live a better life. This path led him to become a U.S. Marine serving multiple tours in Afghanistan and the Pacific.


Abel Martinez | Co-Founder | COO

Abel Martinez is strongly committed to helping people and has an unwavering determination to learn and ensure that whatever projects he is involved in are successful. He earned an Associate’s Degree in Business Administration from San Diego Miramar College and is currently a junior at San Diego State University pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree in International Business with an focus in Latin America. Martinez is a U.S. Marine Corps veteran prides himself on his strong attention to detail and high levels of self-motivation. He is constantly seeking new avenues to improve the world we live in.  

Thanks so much for taking the time to check out our campaign. Please share it with anybody who may like it and make sure to get your credit for services today!

Share on Facebook

story:
Short Summary


What We Need 

We are a non profit organisation that teaches English and life skills to students from poor backgrounds in Cambodia.  We are part of SOLS 24/7, a non profit school that has over 200 students.   We urgently need to upgrade and replace some of our school equipment.   The funds raised will be used to replace our projector, broken computers, and for essential building maintenance.

What You Get

You get the chance to help others.  I believe helping goes around and around.  Many people have helped me during my life.  Most of the people that have helped me don't need my help and I can feel a bit bad about this until I realise that I can help others.  Even a small donation will help.

The Impact

The students in our program gain English language and life skills.  These are key to helping them improve their lives and gain good jobs.

The school does wonderful things with very little money.  I have been volunteering as an English teacher at Sols for 2 months and I have seen the changes the program has made to my students.  Both their English and their confidence have improved.  I can help change their lives for the better and so can you.  Please give a little so we have the resources to continue our work.   In a country where the average income is less than $40 per week we need a helping hand. 

Risks & Challenges

There are no real risks and challenges.  All the money donated will go on purchasing this new equipment and essential building maintenance.

The education we are providing our students will help them out of the poverty trap and mean they can become independent citizens and gain well paid employment. 

What else can you do

If you cannot donate please help by;

  • Getting the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Tell your friends and share on facebook
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

About the Video and Technology

The video I have posted was created 3 years ago.  We shared it because it really shows life in the school.  I watched it before I decided to volunteer.

Also please note the internet is very slow and unreliable, so if you have any questions it may take us a little while to reply.

story:
Hi There! 

I'm Manuel and I'm 20 years old. I'm Italian and I live in the south of the country.

Today I ask a small donation to follow my dream.


My dream is to travel in Australia because it is a beautiful country. I like the culture of the place.

If ever I will do this trip is also because I want to know me better.

This is a journey to improve myself and my knowledge about language, culture and traditions.

I need this money because without this money I am not allowed to enter in Australia. I ask this money to you because I haven’t a chance to work because Italy not offer many possibilities.

In Australia with this money I would like to do a Working Holiday Visa, not only for tourism.

This could be a wonderful experience for me and for you, because you would make me very happy.

If I can’t reach the sum I will preserve this money for this trip.

If I make this adventure I will open a page on facebook like a travelogue to show my gratitude.


Thank you.
Manuel.

story:
Our Story

Philadelphia is full of talent. It is also one of the poorest big cities in America, with than 36% of residents living on incomes under $25,000 per year. Philadelphia is also full of opportunities for young musicians, if you have the money. That was where the idea for The Primavera Fund began. Violinist Rachel Segal, her father David, and trumpeter and conductor Kenny Bean, came together to form a program where the most talented, financially challenged young musicians would no longer have to be told no because of money.
The Primavera Fund provides the financial backing for kids' dreams of becoming musicians. And it's not cheap. We budget between $10-15,000 per year for each of our Young Artists. We currently serve 10 young musicians, but we need to do more. We can do it with your help!!!


What We Need

We need your support to bring on more young artists. Each artist receives: private lessons, an instrument on loan from us that will help their development, tuition for youth orchestra, camps, and other activities, training in entrepreneurship and career preparedness, college application assistance, performance opportunities, and much, much more.
We want to grow our program to serve thirty kids at a time, but are currently only able to serve ten. Every contribution will go directly to the kids, and more kids will be able to make their dreams come true.

Impact

So far, we have sent them to Interlochen Arts Camp, Kinkaven Music Camp, and Berklee Jazz Camp. They are all thriving in school, and are all taking either advanced placement or pre-college courses. We are expecting a 100% college acceptance rate, and also expect some to be accepted into top colleges and conservatories. These are things that everyone wants for their kids. We are here to help make it a reality.


Other Ways You Can Help

We accept donations of musical instruments and supplies. Please visit our website at www.primaverafund.org to find out more and to contact us!

story:
Our Why

We created Life Recovery Solutions and our Life Connect App because too many people are dying from addiction and too many families are being destroyed. Unfortunately, 80% of those who are able to get treatment relapse in the first year, many relapse over and over.  The problem is getting worse, with 2.8 million new addicts every year and 27% of teens use drugs regularly.  

For me it is personal, my brother died at 37 from drugs and alcohol and my nephew was 39.  If we can reach 2% of the addicts we can save 600,000 lives and countless families. 

We are asking you to be part of the solution by helping us create an app to help those struggling with addiction to stay clean and sober.  This app gives them a fighting chance.

The Problem

In the United States the cost of addiction is $524 billion and we have 30 million addicts. The cost of in-patient treatment averages $15,000 and many go through treatment 6 or 7 times and some never find sobriety.  The difficulty for those coming out of treatment is staying on the right path and connected to those who care about them most.  Sadly, many end up returning to the same people and places where their troubles originated and the old issues and habits come right back.

Statistics

  • 30 Million Addicts
  • 14.8 million with Mental Illness
  • 7.7 million suffering with PTSD
  • 4.7 on Parole/Probation

How we will use these funds

Every dime we receive through this campaign will be put back into the company to enhance our tools so that we will be able to reach more people and save more lives. It is our mission to transform as many families and lives as we can.  Imagine this... There are 30 million addict in the United States and if we can impact 2%, that is 600,000 lives and countless family members.

The Solution

Life Recovery Solutions has a unique approach to reducing the relapse rate and saving lives.  Our app, Life Connect, helps them change their behavior, keeps them connected with those who care about them the most and focused on their future.  Life Connect is designed to disrupt old triggers and cues and replace them with new positive habits.  The Life Connect tools are integrated with Zoey, our Virtual Health Assistant, and she provides ongoing encouragement and feedback, while assigning the client new tasks throughout the day.  This disrupts the old thinking and creates new positive patterns.  Family, friends and professionals can view the client’s moods, activities, and receive alerts from Zoey when necessary.

The recovery centers and probation offices who use the Life Connect to stay connected with their clients 24/7, automate simple tasks for the client and better manage their caseload.  This reduces the workload for each counselor or officer, enabling them to be more efficient and service their clients more effectively.  

The centers provide these tools to their clients who use Life Connect to stay healthy and on track with their recovery.

The Founders

Ed Stevenson.  Prior to founding Life Recovery Solutions Ed was an executive in the software consulting industry where he spent 25 years filling many key roles with industry leaders such as General Electric, Wipro, Keane and Sapient.  

Ed lost a brother and a nephew to addiction and for the past several years he has also lead several addiction support groups which is where he gained his insights to develop Life Recovery Solutions.

Gail Stevenson, Gail has founded and managed several very successful companies throughout her illustrious career.  Her businesses required her to focus on customer satisfaction, vendor coordination and managed hundreds of clients and transactions.

Objectives

Our objective is to provide tools to the Recovery Industry as well as Parole/Probation to reduce the recidivism rate.

Mission Statement

Transforming lives and families with respect and compassion, and assist the client with the ability to begin healing by staying connected and rebuild healthy relationships with open communication.

Our WhyWe created
Life Recovery Solutions and our Life Connect App because too many people are dying
from addiction and too many families are being destroyed. Unfortunately, 80% of those
who are able to get treatment relapse in the first year, many relapse over and
over.  The problem is getting worse, with 2.8 million new addicts every
year and 27% of teens use drugs regularly.  For me it is personal, my brother died at 37 from drugs and alcohol and my
nephew was 39.  If we can reach 2% of the addicts we can save 600,000
lives and countless families. We are asking you to be part of the solution by helping us create an app to
help those struggling with addiction to stay clean and sober.  This app gives them a
fighting chance.The Problem
In the United States the cost of addiction is $524 billion and we have 30 million addicts. The cost of in-patient treatment averages $15,000 and many go through treatment 6 or 7 times and some never find sobriety.  The
difficulty for those coming out of treatment is staying on the right path and
connected to those who care about them most. 
Sadly, many end up returning to the same people and places where their
troubles originated and the old issues and habits come right back.Statistics

30 Million Addicts


14.8 million with Mental Illness


7.7 million suffering with PTSD


4.7 on Parole/Probation



How we will use these fundsEvery dime we receive through this campaign will be put back into the company to enhance our tools so that we will be able to reach more people and save more lives. It is our mission to transform as many families and lives as we can.  Imagine this... story: Yesterday, Today, Tomorrow
story_txt: Yesterday, Today, Tomorrow

story:
About ImPower

In celebrating the City of Hopewell's 100th Anniversary and in conjunction with the City Council's Strategic Plan, the ImPower Youth Conference will held May 21, 2016. The ImPower Youth Conference will serve as a catalyst for the City of Hopewell's Youth Initiative by providing an event that will empower, engage and educate youth and young adults within the City of Hopewell. The conference will mimic professional career conferences by hosting various breakout sessions, featuring keynote speakers and group discussions.

Our mantra: 


The ImPower Conference being co-sponsored by the Crater Workforce Investment Board. The event will be hosted at both the Beacon Theater and Maude Langhorne Nelson Library. Registration is free to all participants; however, we are requesting a can donation for the Food Pantry or 1 household item for donation to The James House. Attendee must be eligible to enroll in either 9th, 10th, 11th or 12th grade. Sessions will be available for parents as well that will be housed solely in the library.

The ImPower Youth Conference will feature 6 Tracks with consist of 4 breakout sessions each. Tracks include:

1.  Live Well- H.E.A.L

2.  What’s Next?

3.  Reach Higher

4.  The Real World

5.  Making Money

6.  Get Social

Live Well- H.E.A.L will promote the recently passed H.E.A.L resolution, Let’s Move national initiative and will expose participants to healthy eating and active living activities. This track will have a municipal impact due to the fact that if focus on health which is an area that the City of Hopewell scores poorly in within the Commonwealth.

What’s Next? Will focus on “life after high school” and will feature recent HHA graduates. Breakout sessions will explore how to deal with real-life situations as recent graduates come into adulthood. This track will impact the areas of focus that the City of Hopewell as a municipality currently does not have programs to support.

 Reach Higher will promote the national initiative “Reach Higher” that inspired every student in America to take charge of their future by completing education past high school, whether at a professional training program, a community college, or a four-year college or university. This track will also feature alternative options such as vocational school or military service. The goal of “Reach Higher” is for that by 2020, America will once again have the highest proportion of college graduates in the world. This track will have a municipal impact due to the fact that per the 2010 Census, the City of Hopewell educational attainment post High School graduation is low, to include very few residents that have obtained Bachelors’ degrees. Moreover, statistics prove that the industries the majority of Hopewell residents have careers in are non-STEM related, which is opposite of national workforce trends. The goal of this track is to inspire youth to fill 21st century jobs that may fill the skills gap within the City of Hopewell.

The Real World will promote the national initiative “Ready By 21” which focuses on building youth to be ready for the real world by early adulthood. This track will feature sessions that will teach real life skills such as managing funds, leasing apartments/cars, traveling, etc. One session in particular will feature the “Complete Streets” initiative, which was recently adopted by City Council. This session will have a municipal impact because feedback can be used for the Comprehensive Plan. In addition, feedback will help support the H.E.A.L Committees mission.

Making Money will promote the national initiatives “Startup America”, which promotes entrepreneurship and “TechHire” which focuses on STEM and filling/creating jobs for the 21st century. Moreover, this track will feature sessions that teach skills to help youth and young adults land and keep jobs. The track has a municipal impact because it promotes business startups, and building a solid workforce within the City of Hopewell.

Get Social will promote interpersonal skills, and expose participates to networking and the realities of social media usage.


What We Need & What You Get

There are a few more items we still need to get to make this conference a success:

  • Conference Shirt
  • Conference Lanyards & Ribbons
  • Conference Totes 


The Impact

Check out the sponsorship levels to find out more about what you will receive as a sponsor. The biggest return on your investment is the contributing to an event that will directly impact youth and young adults within the City of Hopewell in a postive way. All sessions are designed to either meet attendee where they are in their current life and/or empower each attendee in multiple ways as they enter a new chapter in their lives. You will help change the dynamic of youth experiences within the City of Hopewell and raise the profile and voice of youth citywide.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute financially please support the conference in 1 of 3 ways:

  • Complete any of the Pear sponsorship tasks on customink. Donate less than 5 minutes of your time and become and official sponsor. https://www.pearup.com/impoweryouthconference/rally?og=2467236&fb_action_ids=10154137585851912&fb_action_types=pearupapp%3Ashare&fb_ref=prog_148
  • Volunteer to work the ImPower Youth Conference! Visit ImPower Youth Conference on Facebook to register!
  • Subscribe to our Facebook page at ImPower Youth Conference.
  • Join our social media pages on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter!
  • Spread the word! Register for the conference, tag and share our posts!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Rather Than Cite Research and Statistics,  We Got On the Ground and Started Action in Our Own Small Way To Help Fight the Lack of Basic Educational Access for Impoverished Children in West Africa!

In 2015, We Opened Prince Academy in Enugu, Nigeria, West Africa For Children From Low Income working families and Poor Communities.

Why We're Asking for Your Help:

Since we opened in November 2015, we’ve grown from taking in one child to 22 children to date. Unfortunately, we cannot take in any more children due to the lack of funding needed to continue growing by fixing the dilapidated school building conditions, providing stable school electricity, running water, building renovation, classroom furnishing, expanding classrooms and providing school supplies.

A Brief Introduction:

Hello, my name is Chavey Prince. I am a Clinical Social Worker and Psychotherapist. I reside in Seattle Washington. I am a wife and mom of two little daughters, ages five and under.  I hold a Bachelor’s Degree in Psychology and a Master’s Degree in Clinical Social Work from the University of Houston.  While living in Houston, Texas, I worked with elementary, middle and high school age children at the local school district  level and  with various philanthropic organizations, companies and social work agencies to provide children in low income Houston neighborhoods with safe, free after school community facilities where they can play, read, have access to free internet for home work research and in some cases, also provide free hot meals.

My Passion: Providing Basic Education for Poor Children, One Child at a Time!

I have always had the passion to help children in developing countries accomplish their educational goals. Current research shows a significant disparity between children here in the United States and children in developing countries when it comes to basic educational access and necessities required for early childhood development. I made it my personal endeavor to do my part in aiding with the development of a basic educational and learning environmental framework for poor children in African countries.

Background and Research: The Big Problem

 According to UNICEF report,  40% of Nigerian children aged 6-11 do not attend primary school, with the Northern region recording the lowest school attendance rate in the country, particularly for girls.  It is not rare to see cases of 100 pupils per teacher or students sitting under trees outside the school building because of the lack of classrooms.

The lowest rates of school participation are found in Western and Central Africa and South Asia - See more at: http://data.unicef.org/education/primary.html#s..

A Strong Educational Foundation is the Key to Future Success for All Children!

Other research indicates that despite a significant increase in net enrollment rates in recent years, it is estimated that about 4.7 million children of primary school age are still not in school.  The compulsory, free Universal Basic Education (UBE) Act was passed into Nigerian law in 2004 and represents the Government’s strategy to fight illiteracy and extend basic education opportunities to all children in the country. However, the number of schools, facilities and teachers available for basic education remain inadequate for the eligible number of children and youths. This is more so in urban areas where there is population pressure. Under these conditions, teaching and learning cannot be effective; hence the outcomes are usually below expectation.

In Enugu, Nigeria this disparity exists among children and youth coupled with a dire need for basic school infrastructure and supplies.  Quality educational opportunities are only accessible to those who can afford it, while a vast majority of the local population are poor hard working folks. Basic quality education is unattainable for the children within these low/ no income families and in some cases impossible to achieve.

 Here's What We've Done So Far

Last year, we partnered with Prof. Gloria Agbaroji. PhD, a retired ex - high school principal and college professor in Enugu who has worked over the past 30 years within the Nigerian educational system to ensure children from low income to poor rural areas have opportunities to obtain  basic school educational needs. 


 

Together, we’ve established Prince Academy.  Prince Academy is a day care, nursery and primary school located in Enugu, Nigeria, established in November of 2015.  

We provide an educational, creative and nurturing environment for children from poor/low-income and struggling  families in our community.  Recently, we successfully acquired some new additional school space in an old office building (built in 1978) in need of major repairs. We've been self-funding some of desperately needed repair work while also managing the daily functioning of the Academy. However, with depleted funds, we're unable to continue pushing forward. This is where we need your help and kind generosity.


  Hello! From Our Staff, Teachers and School Children at Prince Academy -February 2016.                

We've Done a Lot In a Short Time!

  But We Still Have More to Do!

In order to transform our school into a safe, conducive environment that fosters progressive and cognitive learning for our school children, we desperately need your backing to help us renovate our school.  A great accomplishment we thought unachievable in such a short period of time. 


How Your Contributions Will Help Us:

We'll stretch every dollar you contribute to ensure we are able to complete the needed work detailed below.  

Exterior Repairs Needed – Make School Clean and Safe for the Kids!




We need your help to fix and renovate our school infrastructure. We'd also like to provide a safe and clean outside play area for our school children.

We have water damaged and missing ceiling tiles/boards and our roof leaks. When it rains, water gets into our building.

We need roof repairs, repainting, replacement of missing/broken windows, window screens to help keep out mosquitoes and proper school signage. 

Basic Stable Electricity & Water – Help Needed!

Due to extremely unreliable city electricity power supply, we usually don’t have any electricity during the hot school day. With no working fans or lights, we usually have windows open to ensure we have adequate lighting and ventilation for the children however, doing this can also let in mosquitoes which can transmit malaria exposing the children to illness.   A battery back-up off grid solar power system will allow us to provide our school with the clean stable electricity needed to power basic school equipment such as fans and lighting.


Lack of reliable clean water supply also makes it really challenging for our school children during school hours. The children have to use water from water storage containers for flushing restroom toilets. 


We’ll need a water well constructed and water a pumping system to ensure with our school's growth, more school children can have access to proper running water and clean hygienic restrooms during school.


Day Care & Nursery School Space

With your help, we can transform the space for our daycare and nursery school babies,

From This:




To this (concept):


For the toddlers, 

we can transform their classrooms from these:




To this (concept):


Primary School Space

Your kind contributions will go a long way in helping us build and furnish more classrooms. 

We have small full classrooms

More Classrooms - Help Needed!
We have space to build more new classrooms in order to take in and teach more children from the community. 


 What You Get for Helping Us Out:

To show our enormous appreciation and gratitude to you for kindly being gracious in helping our effort, we've come up with some exciting  fun perks for you.

  • In addition to fun perks, you'll receive monthly project updates and status reports of ongoing work (Documentation & Pictures)
  • If we are unable to reach our funding goal, we intend to accomplish all the work we can with the funds you contribute and provide project updates of our accomplishments.
  • Any excess funding we receive would go towards hiring more staff and saving for a school van to allow us transport our school children to various out door school activities such as museum trips, zoo trips etc.

The Impact of Your Contributions:

Your contributions will help color a bright future for our school children by providing an educational foundation not just for our current school children, but also for a lot more children who will attend our school in the future. 
A Solid Educational Foundation is the Key to Future Success for All Children!
  • For a lot of poor children, educational opportunities help lay the frame work for creating a way out of poverty.
  • Education is not only beneficial in drastically reducing poverty, but also aids with building a more successful economy and creating a successful pipeline for further generations to come.
  • Established and successfully opened (Literacy for Allen Parkway Village) a library for young children and adolescence in Forth Ward located in Houston, Texas.
  • Education is substantial in guiding our children to become self reliant, stable and contributing citizens of society. 


Risks & Challenges

Challenges: Through diligent planning, estimation and the execution of the project, we’ll be on track to complete our education project in an efficient and timely manner. However, with almost every project, there presents challenges in terms of controlling cost, scope and schedule while delivering quality.

We have the collective expertise/experience needed to be successful with this project.

Risk: Not reaching full funding.  Without reaching full funding, we shall not be able to deliver the completed project.  In the case that this may happen, we will consolidate our planning goals, but we shall continue to stay optimistic and provide our students with the best educational foundation possible.

Risk:  Not being able to receive, store and ship locally contributed materials. 

If  you’re a local contributor or backer here in Washington State and you’d rather help us by donating books, desks, computers, back packs, chairs or any other materials a school would require, we would need some help with the pick up of local donations, the storage of the donations and the shipment of the donations. Please contact me for more details.

Other Ways You Can Help

We kindly accept donations and if any local contributors in Enugu would prefer to donate their time to helping us on the ground, we would be more than happy to accept any on the ground help we can get. If interested, please contact me for more details and information.  Also, Tweet us @princeacademye1 or find us on Facebook www.facebook.com/educationforimpoverishedchildr... 
Youtube: https://youtu.be/_xRW6JkW9ZI

Please help us get the word out and share with Indiegogo share tools!! 

Thanks Everyone
Cheers!
Chavey

 To show our enormous appreciation and gratitude to you for kindly being gracious in helping our effort, we've come up with some exciting  fun perks for you.
 In addition to fun perks, you'll receive monthly project updates and status reports of ongoing work (Documentation & Pictures) If we are unable to reach our funding goal, we intend to accomplish all the work we can with the funds you contribute and provide project updates of our accomplishments.
Any excess funding we receive would go towards hiring more staff and saving for a school van to allow us transport our school children to various out door school activities such as museum trips, zoo trips etc.



The Impact of Your Contributions:

Your contributions will help color a bright future for our school children by providing an educational foundation not just for our current school children, but also for a lot more children who will attend our school in the future. 

A Solid Educational Foundation is the Key to Future Success for All Children!  For a lot of poor children, educational opportunities help lay the frame work for creating a way out of poverty.
Education is not only beneficial in drastically reducing poverty, but also aids with building a more successful economy and creating a successful pipeline for further generations to come.
Established and successfully opened (Literacy for Allen Parkway Village) a library for young children and adolescence in Forth Ward located in Houston, Texas. Education is substantial in guiding our children to become self reliant, stable and contributing citizens of society. 
  


Risks & Challenges

Challenges: Through diligent planning, estimation and the execution of the project, we’ll be on track to complete our education project in an efficient and timely manner. However, with almost every project, there presents challenges in terms of controlling cost, scope and schedule while delivering quality.
We have the collective expertise/experience needed to be successful with this project.
Risk: Not reaching full funding.  Without reaching full funding, we shall not be able to deliver the completed project.  In the case that this may happen, we will consolidate our planning goals, but
we shall continue to stay optimistic and provide our students with the best
educational foundation possible.
Risk:  Not being able to receive, store and ship locally contributed materials. 
If  you’re a local contributor or backer here in Washington State and you’d rather help us by donating books, desks, computers, back packs, chairs or any other materials a school would require, we would need some help with the pick up of local donations, the storage of the donations and the shipment of the donations. Please contact me for more details. 
  Other Ways You Can Help 
We kindly
accept donations and if any local contributors in Enugu would prefer to donate their time to
helping us on the ground, we would be more than happy to accept any on the
ground help we can get. If interested, please contact me for
more details and information.  Also, Tweet us @princeacademye1 or find us on Facebook www.facebook.com/educationforimpoverishedchildr... Youtube: https://youtu.be/_xRW6JkW9ZI
Please help us get the word out and share with Indiegogo
share tools!! 
Thanks Everyone
Cheers!
Chavey

story:
Sexual Harassment is a global issue, both in and out of the schools, workplace & public. Majority of man and women today, still do not have a written anti-Harassment policy, or if written are not enforced in the organisation to full impact.

We live in a world where design and culture both play important roles in changing behaviors across the globe. It’s time to stand up and speak out against the issues that challenge our generation.

  

 

By providing an interactive workshop framework, attendees engage in design thinking to educate and empower themselves with the skills, knowledge and strategies to confront sexual harassment head on, including framing their own anti-harassment policies.

 

The Ultimate Toolkit comes with a set of creative tools and workshop exercises that enable the user to understand and empathize with Sexual Harassment.

Moreover, The Ultimate Toolkit is designed to be a completely DIY product! (Detailed guide included). So anyone anywhere can conduct the workshop on their own.

Make it fun, give it a theme. Whatever gets your creative juices flowing!

 

 

 

 

 

 

In order to minimize legal liabilities, reduce costs of expensive policy-making and maximize the effectiveness of employees, every company should have an open discussion regarding sexual harassment.

This toolkit allows every individual of an organisation to be involved, input ideas and brainstorm towards a common solution.

Remember, just because it isn't affecting you personally, doesn't mean it isn't happening.

 

The change starts from you. Join this global conversation and help us reach out to the many workplaces in the world. We can't do this without you. Thank you

 

 

This toolkit is universally applicable to all professions as well varying age groups and covers various types of harassment that is recognized by American, European and Hong Kong law.

Please contact info@theultimatetoolkit.co with further questions or requests

 

What will be included? / What are the components of The Ultimate Toolkit? 

 

The toolkit comes with 1 guidebook that tells you how to conduct the workshop - what you’ll need, how much time is required and how to carry out the various exercises, step-by-step!

Inside the box you’ll find:

  • 1 Manual

  • 2/4 black whiteboard pens

  • 2/4 sets of post-its

  • 1 set 4P Cards

  • 1 set ‘I Wish cards’

  • 1 set ‘Frame your solutions’ cards  

  • 2 sets of cue cards

  • 2 posters

Will I or one of my employees be able to conduct the workshop?       

Ofcourse! There is a manual included in the toolkit which is very easy to read and follow. Alternatively, you can also opt for our 2 hour consultation service provided in the Perks section and we’ll take you through the entire toolkit, step-by-step!   

Can you provide examples of some of the activities inside that can promote participation ‘sexual harassment’ talk? 

The workshop begins with some visualizing and verbal exercises that helps employees get comfortable in their surroundings. One example is Visualizing ‘Sexual harassment’ through different colors, objects, words and experiences.

How long does a typical workshop or discussion last?  Can it be re-conducted or is it a one time thing? 

Usually, The Ultimate Toolkit can be conducted for a group of 5-20 people and takes 4 hours. If you have more than 20 employees, you can conduct multiple workshops with the same toolkit. Depending on the participation and number of persons per group, the workshop can be conducted twice. We want to be able to provide each individual ample amount of time to discuss their findings/learnings after each exercise.

How much does shipping cost? Does The Ultimate Toolkit ship internationally? 

Yes! We provide free worldwide shipping just for the duration of our Indiegogo campaign.

When does The Ultimate Toolkit ship?

Pre-orders taken now will ship in February 2016.  

 

**PRE-ORDER NOW**

story:
Who We Are

Florin Albeanu, Raul Muresan and Adam Kampff – We are scientists investigating how the brain works (when healthy) and doesn't work (when ill). We are trying to inspire and train the neuroscientists of the future, to provide them with the best chance to solve the mysteries of the brain, to discover how we perceive, think, decide, act, and understand the world and ourselves; and to offer real hope for a cure of the brain’s devastating maladies, ranging from ALS, Schizophrenia and Parkinson's to Alzheimer’s disease.

Our Cause

We have started a worldwide initiative to train young brain researchers, from both poor and developed countries, in understanding and using the most advanced tools in brain research today. We do this in Transylvania!

This is TENSS, the Transylvanian Experimental Neuroscience Summer School:

  • 3 weeks of 24/7 hands-on practical and theoretical courses in building, debugging, using and interpreting data from cutting-edge experimental methods in modern neuroscience.
  • A select group of the best applicants: for the 2015 edition, top 12 were selected from an excellent pool of 150 applicants from all over the world – 42 countries across 6 continents.
  • A wide collection of experts: 20 instructors and 12 dedicated teaching assistants from Brain research institutes in the USA, UK, Germany, Denmark, Portugal, Romania, India, Switzerland, Norway, Netherlands, Hungary and Slovakia.
  • A knowledge base of Open-Source solutions to complex problems in brain research, providing an alternative to the expensive commercial systems.

TENSS Media Coverage

  • TENSS official website
  • RIST official website
  • News editorial about TENSS
  • Nature editorial about TENSS
  • Romanian media: Vox Publica, Romania Curata

What You Can Do for Us

  • You can support TENSS and RIST by placing a donation. Any dollar counts!
  • You can spread the word about the initiative, its philosophy and the crowd funding campaign.

Where Your Contribution Goes

  • TENSS is about people. To bring the best instructors from all over the world, we need your help. Your donation will cover transportation for instructors and the dedicated teaching assistants.
  • The Romanian Institute for Science and Technology provides the foundation for the course. Your donation will also support the host institute.

The Impact

This event was built on an idea that two friends had at a dinner table. Ever since then,  it has continued to grow in scale and prestige, with people like you supporting the initiative. 

  • The scientists of the future, trained at TENSS, will advance knowledge about the brain and develop treatments for neurological disorders.
  • Your support will enable the stability of TENSS throughout the years. On the long run, community support for TENSS will translate in community support for neuroscience research.

The Story Behind TENSS

The  Transylvanian  Experimental  Neuroscience  Summer  School  (TENSS)  was  born  in  2010, from an idea that Florin Albeanu shared to Raul Mureşan during a conference in Romania. The first edition of TENSS took place in 2012, on the shores of Pike Lake, in the picturesque province of Transylvania. In 2014, TENSS  has welcomed  a  third permanent organizer, Adam Kampff, from the University College London, UK.

The  main  objective  of  TENSS  is  to  provide  participants  top-level,  hands-on training  in experimental  techniques  used  in  neuroscience. The philosophy of the school is learning by doing and while doing so, openly sharing ideas and expertise. To  the  best  of  our  knowledge  the  opportunity  for  such  training  is scarce and is covered only in a few places in the world, such as Cold Spring Harbor and Woods Hole, in the USA, Plymouth in UK, Champalimaud in Portugal and Okinawa, Japan. TENSS is unique in that most of the experimental (hardware and software) tools are assembled from scratch, with minimal costs leading to a deeply personal transfer of information from first principles. 

The course takes place in a remote, picturesque location in Transylvania, where high level technology seems to be out of place. Participants get actively involved in building a laboratory from scratch and then have the chance to use it too. Such an experience can convince any researcher that everything is possible in science and that financial and concept limitations are easily overcome by creativity and knowledge. 

"I came here with almost no knowledge on experimental techniques in neuroscience and I now feel that I have a good overview of a large variety of them. I come back with a lot of ideas and with much less frontiers or fear in implementing any of the techniques that we learned at the school. The environment of freedom, the feeling that we can do whatever we want, the fact that this freedom leads to being very creative and having amzing new ideas, the flexibility of the organizers that allow for this, this is what I liked most of TENSS. "

                                                                                                              Participant in TENSS 2015


A second objective of TENSS is to attract a large number of top-level scientists from all over the world, who can provide theoretical lectures and can interact with participants, among themselves, and with local scientists based in Romania, giving rise to scientific debates of the highest quality. The purpose is to create a durable network of scientists that are willing to share their knowledge and are open to collaborations, and place them in a pool of curious and capable students that can absorb and later implement in their own laboratories the solutions discussed in the summer school.

“The course was a pure delight. The science was hands‐on and cutting edge ‐ despite the need to improvise extensively; the TAs where superb, the organization professional and the visiting lecturers  amongst  the  best  in  the  world.  However, the  specific  reason  why  I  believe  the course ranks supremely amongst its peers and is the best choice for any aspiring graduate student  or  postdoc  in  the neurosciences  is  the  unusual  setting  in  the  rural  parts  of Transylvania  and  the ‐  possibly  correlated  ‐  quality  of  the  students  who  are  absolutely delightful  and highly  intelligent  without  exception.  All  of  these  elements  in  combination produced a summer school that has no equal in the world”. 

                                                                                                 Florian Engert, lecturer                                                                                                                       Harvard University, USA 

Finally, TENSS aims to bring world-wide visibility to neuroscientific research in both Europe and in Romania. The host institute, The Romanian Institute of Science and Technology (http://rist.ro/en.html), is the only independent, non profit basic research facility in Romania, with the aim of providing world class scientists the appropriate institutional and administrative support so that they can run their research within Romania.  Such an event brings visibility, enthusiasm and solutions for the challenges the institute meets in its quest to boost neuroscience research in the country.

"Participating in TENSS 2013 was an amazing experience and an opportunity to meet people who were not only extremely bright, dedicated, contagiously enthusiastic and very much on top of their field but also very open and approachable, starting with the students and all the way  to  the  lecturers. The lectures and lab sessions were well organized and came in support of each other, creating an efficient and intensive hands‐on learning process where each day would bring some incredible source of thrill (such as, well after midnight when you’re finally done aligning and adjusting mirrors and lenses, realizing that you’ve just built your own two‐photon microscope almost from scratch). I can say without a doubt that attending this summer school has been  a  real  boost  and  an  eye‐opening  experience  in  more  ways than I could have ever expected. Hopefully many more students will have the opportunity to a similar experience in the following years”

                                                                             Ioana Gasler,  participant in TENSS 2013                                                                                      Master of Neurobiology                                                                                                                        University of Bucharest, Romania 

Up to now, funding the Transylvanian Experimental Neuroscience Summer School has been partly assured by research societies across the globe, and support was provided by the top companies involved in neuroscience research:  http://tenss.ro/2015/partners/index.php. This edition, we are seeking to involve the community, the people themselves into participating and supporting the event. We believe that through this support, we can ensure the durable existence of TENSS as an event on the research calendar of Europe.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • You can spread the word about our campaign. The fundraising period is 60 days.
  • Spread the word about TENSS: we are struggling every year to get the word out so that more people have the opportunity to reach this training. Also, spread the word about the initiative: we would like to see more groups that are inspired by the TENSS  and RIST philosophy and try it out in their country and  field of study.
  • Give us some feedback: what do you think about this initiative? What could be improved, what do you know that we haven't found out yet. We are eager to get new ideas and put them to practice to increase the impact of TENSS on the community around it.

story:
We are Ngoma Studio, LV! Ngoma (pronounced In-go-ma) is a new dance studio striving to be an asset among the artists’ revolution taking place in the Arts District of Las Vegas, 18b. Our goal is to create a space for artists as well as students from all backgrounds and skill levels to express, share as well as learn performing arts. Ngoma will provide a place in the community where students can take class and be a part of our connection through the Arts.

Our mission is to develop programs, such as dance workshops, fitness classes and performing arts class options for our community. Provide scholarships to kids who are less fortunate and less likely to have the opportunity to receive training in the various styles offered. We will foster a stress- free environment where students are taught the discipline and basic structure of dance. A place where they are able to express themselves while feeling challenged and inspired to learn. A worldly overview of dance styles and cultures blending basic instruction with promising innovative trends. 

Cammie Griffin, who has several years of technical dance training and has been a member of the cast of the world renowned Broadway show STOMP for the past 10 yrs. Having performed around the world teaching kids and adults the many outlets of dance, movement and performing arts, she eagerly wants to bring all she’s learned and experienced to our own community. 

Antwan Davis is an active member of the Body Music Community of Las Vegas and the international body percussion community. He is a co-founder of Molodi and has taught and performed internationally. He was also a member of STOMP, has 16 years of experience in Greek Stepping. 

We all know with any dream or new adventure the beginning (or start) is the toughest part. As a new company our funds are limited for the physical development of the Ngoma. It is now undergoing construction and there are still so many things we need before our grand opening. To name a few.

-Floor

-Mirrors

-Sound system

-Scholarship funding 

-Simple maintenance 

-Nonprofit license fee (501 c 3)

With your support we can purchase the tools we need to develop and deliver our goals of the studio. We reach out to you and your generosity to make this artistic dream a reality. Any donations you may be obliged to provide, will aid in the start of our community’s new studio. With any donation YOU will receive a gift as a token of our appreciation. We and our future students want to thank you in advance. You will forever be a part of us and the “blue print” of Ngoma Studio, LV !

We understand everyone isn’t able to give. Being able to give or not PLEASE spread the word about our studio to all you know. 

                                                   “IT TAKES A VILLAGE”
story_txt:
We are Ngoma Studio, LV! Ngoma (pronounced In-go-ma) is a new dance studio striving to be an asset among the artists’ revolution taking place in the Arts District of Las Vegas, 18b. Our goal is to create a space for artists as well as students from all backgrounds and skill levels to express, share as well as learn performing arts. Ngoma will provide a place in the community where students can take class and be a part of our connection through the Arts.
Our mission is to develop programs, such as dance workshops, fitness classes and performing arts class options for our community. Provide scholarships to kids who are less fortunate and less likely to have the opportunity to receive training in the various styles offered. We will foster a stress- free environment where students are taught the discipline and basic structure of dance. A place where they are able to express themselves while feeling challenged and inspired to learn. A worldly overview of dance styles and cultures blending basic instruction with promising innovative trends. 
Cammie Griffin, who has several years of technical dance training and has been a member of the cast of the world renowned Broadway show STOMP for the past 10 yrs. Having performed around the world teaching kids and adults the many outlets of dance, movement and performing arts, she eagerly wants to bring all she’s learned and experienced to our own community. 
Antwan Davis is an active member of the Body Music Community of Las Vegas and the international body percussion community. He is a co-founder of Molodi and has taught and performed internationally. He was also a member of STOMP, has 16 years of experience in Greek Stepping. 
We all know with any dream or new adventure the beginning (or start) is the toughest part. As a new company our funds are limited for the physical development of the Ngoma. It is now undergoing construction and there are still so many things we need before our grand opening. To name a few.
-Floor
-Mirrors
-Sound system
-Scholarship funding 
-Simple maintenance 
-Nonprofit license fee (501 c 3)
With your support we can purchase the tools we need to develop and deliver our goals of the studio. We reach out to you and your generosity to make this artistic dream a reality. Any donations you may be obliged to provide, will aid in the start of our community’s new studio. With any donation YOU will receive a gift as a token of our appreciation. We and our future students want to thank you in advance. You will forever be a part of us and the “blue print” of Ngoma Studio, LV !
We understand everyone isn’t able to give. Being able to give or not PLEASE spread the word about our studio to all you know.

story:
Hey there!

My name is Shaya Ishaq and I'm a 22 year old art student from Ottawa, Ontario! I moved to Halifax, Nova Scotia two years ago to attend NSCAD University where I study textile design and ceramics. 

This summer I have the opportunity to work as a intern for a clothing company that I've admired for years named Osei Duro. They are quite selective so being chosen to join their team is a privilege that I am truly proud of. Without a doubt, this is one of the best opportunities to come my way so I am incredibly excited to embark on this promising adventure!

ABOUT OSEI DURO

Osei Duro was founded in 2009 by Molly Keogh and Maryanne Mathias, Based in Los Angeles, California and Accra, Ghana, they produce their textiles garments in Ghana where they apply traditional hand dyeing and weaving techniques. By working with local garment workers and artisans, they are supporting the local apparel industry on both a large and small scale.  

I am over the moon to be contributing to a fashion line whose mandate works towards a vibrant fashion industry! One that exceeds international production standards while respecting the rights, traditions and aesthetics of local Ghanaian makers!

Why this means the world to me!

I am so excited and honoured to have a role in the inner workings of an innovative, sustainable and continuously refreshing clothing brand that stands by an ethos that I truly believe in! There is absolutely no doubt in my mind that this opportunity will expand my horizons in ways that would not be possible within my art school. This internship will give me the chance to take a major step in my design practice. It will allow me to apply skills I've acquired as a textiles student in a hands on environment and build off what I've learned in school. 

Working for a company with sustainability at the core of its values is very important to me. Osei Duro goes beyond  "fashion for fashion's sake". They are a socially responsible company aware of the footprint they leave and impact they have on communities in Ghana.

Although this opportunity is a dream come true, the financial realities of making it happen can't be ignored. I would like to raise funds to help me cover my travel costs and part of my living expenses while living in Accra this summer through this campaign!



Why do I need your support?


As a full time student, who funds their education 100% of the way, it can be a never ending hustle just to make ends meet and balance school. I work part-time during the academic year and run my own small business, Mild Eyes, on the side but even so, I don't not have enough personal savings to help me get to Ghana.

By the time I was offered the position, the deadline to apply for a student travel subsidy had passed. Similarly, deadlines to apply for scholarships or grants had passed of I didn't have enough time to apply on short notice. I know in my heart that going away for this internship is meant to be but I want to avoid going in debt to make it happen!

I am hoping to raise $4500 through this campaign to help me cover the cost of my plane ticket, my living expenses, and a modest daily budget for three months in Accra.

What's in it for you?


I'm really excited to share these perks with you guys! I've worked really hard to make some ceramics and textile based goods in exchange for your contributions.
This will be a great opportunity for people who have seen my work on my Instagram to treat themselves to something they've liked all the while knowing that your contributions are helping me fund an important event in my life. 

I've also joined forces with some incredibly supportive local businesses from my hometown in Ottawa who have offered some sweet giveaways!  Victoire Boutique and GOODS have some wonderful perks up for grabs so check them out on the gallery page of this campaing!

Even if I don't reach my entire goal, the funds raised through this will bring me one step closer to getting to Ghana for my summer internship. A step I could not have made on my own!


Other Ways You Can Help

I realize that not everyone can contribute but that doesn't mean they can't help! Here are some other ways you can show your love + support:

  • Sharing is caring so please don't hesitate to share this campaign with your friends, family, colleagues in your social media networks! 
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the love or simply copy and paste the link to share.

And that's all there is to it!
Thank you so much from the bottom of my heart for taking the time to check out my campaign. 
xoxo
