story:
Bref résumé

Un objet connecté au service des Abeilles et des Hommes. Soutenez l'innovation, soutenez l'avenir!

  • J'ai 29 ans et je suis le fondateur du Label Abeille
  • L'idée m'est venue il y a quelques années, alors que j'étais en recherche d'emploi. Intéressé par les abeilles, je me suis formé... J'ai alors pris conscience de leur importance dans notre société et de tout ce qui reposait sur elles! Mais aussi de l'ampleur des dégâts qui nous sont trop souvent cachés...
  • Le Label Abeille propose une innovation : une ruche connectée. Par son intermédiaire, c'est la protection des abeilles et leur repopulation qui est en jeu, à travers la création de nombreux emplois qui vont soutenir l'activité grâce à une formation apicole 2.0!! C'est aussi une action de communication clé en main pour les entreprises, les collectivités et scolaires qui souhaitent adhérer à nos valeurs.

Envie de voir des fruits et des légumes dans votre assiette demain?
Les abeilles sont responsables de 80% de la pollinisation, et à l’origine de plus du tiers de ce que l’on consomme.


A connected hive which allows the protection and the repopulation of bees, by creating jobs!

Connected object  in the service of Bees and Men. Support the innovation, support the future!

  • I am 29 years old and I am the founder of the Label Bee.
  • I had this idea few years ago, while I was in job search. Interested in bees, I educated my self... Then, I became aware of their importance in our company and all which is relaying on them! But also of the extent of damage which are too often hidden from us...
  • The Label Bee proposes an innovation: a connected hive. By his intermediary, it is the protection of bees and their repopulation that is at stake, through the creation of numerous jobs which are going to support the activity thanks to an apiarian training 2.0!! It is also a turnkey communications action for companies, communities and school that wish to subscribe in our values.

 Would you like to see fruits and vegetables in your plate tomorrow?

Bees are responsible for 80 % of the pollination, and at the origin of more than third of what we consume.

We need you... What you gain there?

By supporting the development of this project...

You support at first the environment. Too often victims of our consumer society, bees suffer from our lifestyles... Nevertheless, they assure our future!

" If the bee came to disappear, it would stay to a Man four years to survive on the surface of the earth " Albert Einstein

Nous avons besoin de vous... Qu'est ce que vous y gagnez?

En soutenant le développement de ce projet... 

  • Vous soutenez d'abord l'environnement. Trop souvent victimes de notre société de consommation, les abeilles pâtissent de nos modes de vie... Pourtant, elles assurent notre avenir! 
"Si l'abeille venait à disparaître, il resterait à l'Homme quatre années pour survivre sur la surface de la terre" Albert Einstein.

  • Vous permettrez l'installation et l'entretien de nombreuses ruches connectées. C'est aussi l'ouverture de nombreux emplois, la création de formations à destination du public, des scolaires, des institutions et des entreprises. L'insertion de personnes handicapées ou en difficulté, qui vont participer à l'extraction du miel et sa transformation en produits finis.
  • Vous contribuez à rendre un monde meilleur aux générations à venir en "effaçant l'ardoise" en laissant un crédit positif.
Déjà un goût de victoire face aux pertes subies tous les ans par les apiculteurs! Elles sont devenues inévitables mais la repopulation des abeilles ne tient qu'à vous...

Envie de parrainer une ruche? C'est possible! Une ruche connectée... c'est nouveau! Et vous pouvez suivre à distance sa santé et son évolution.
Votre don permettra la mise au jour d'une interface web dynamique, visible sur tous les formats d'écrans et où vous pourrez voir le fruit de votre don à travers des données issues d'une technologie embarquée : www.label-abeille.org

C'est aussi graver le nom de tous les contributeurs sur une ruche pilote (ou une cuve d'extraction du miel si vous êtes plus nombreux) qui servira d'outil de sensibilisation et de formation aux écoliers, en preuve de votre soutien.

Du miel! Du miel! ça coule de source... et en il coulera pour nos donateurs! La mise en place de ce projet permettra l'installation de ruches connectées et par conséquent, l'extraction d'un miel de région de qualité, made in France, mis en pot pour vous. Il vous en sera offert un conditionnement personnalisé, unique, pour une contrepartie qui l'est tout autant.


  • You will allow the installation and the maintenance of numerous connected hives. It is also the opening of numerous jobs, the creation of trainings for the public, the schools, the institutions and the companies. The insertion of disabled people or in trouble, who are going to participate in the extraction of the honey and its transformation in finished products.
  • You contribute to return a better world to the upcoming generations « by cleaning

the slate " by leaving a positive credit.

Already a taste of victory in front of losses undergone every year by the beekeepers! They became inevitable but the repopulation of bees depends only of you...

You would like to sponsor a hive? It is possible! A connected hive it is new! And you can follow at a distance its health and its evolution.

Your donation will allow the brought to light of a dynamic, visible Web interface on all the sizes of screens and where you can see the fruit of your donation through data stemming from an embarked technology:www.label-abeille.org

It also is to engrave the name of all the contributors on an experimental hive (or a tank of extraction of the honey if you are more numerous) which(who) will serve as tool of raising awareness and as training to the pupils, in proof of your support.

Some honey! Some honey! That goes without saying and in it will flow for our donors! The implementation of this project will allow the installation of connected hives and consequently, the extraction of a honey of quality region, made in France, put in jar for you. It will be offered that to you a personalized, unique packaging, for a compensation which is it just as much.


Envie d'avoir vos propres abeilles?? Votre ruche connectée?

  • Si nous atteignons l'objectif, nous pourrons industrialiser et commercialiser des bases connectées pour partager avec le plus grand nombre cette innovation et en faire un projet collectif et collaboratif à travers notre site internet.
    L    es fonds récoltés seront destinés rendre accessible l'innovation et participent à protection des abeilles. 


Envy to have your own bees? Your connected hive?

  • If we reach the goal, we can industrialize and market bases connected to share with the largest number this innovation and make a collective and collaborative project through our web site. 
    The collected funds will serve protection bee.

L'impact

Il s'agit d'un véritable projet de développement durable engageant les contributeurs et futurs labélisés dans une démarche sociale, sociétale, écologique, économique et environnementale. Votre contribution fera la différence entre un citoyen acteur de son avenir... et les autres!

  • Agissez maintenant, c'est l'avenir de nos enfants qui en dépend.
  • Le Label Abeille intéresse déjà de grands groupes internationaux qui y voient un engagement d'envergure pour rendre le monde meilleur.
  • Nous avons démontré la" preuve de concept" en réalisant un démonstrateur (prototype), contenant nos capteurs et une technologie embarquée.
A nous, tous ensemble, d'engager la fabrication d'une pré-série qui pourra être testée à plus grande échelle et en toutes situations.

La mise en place d'un réseau collaboratif via notre plateforme web repose sur la solidité de votre engagement et votre investissement sur le long terme!
"Seul on va vite mais ensemble on va loin!"


The Impact

It is about a real sustainable development project committing the contributors and future labélisés in a social, societal, ecological, economic and environmental approach. Your contribution will make the difference between a citizen actor of its future and the others!

  • Act now, it is the future of our children that depends on it.
  • The Label Bee already interests big international groups which see a large-scale commitment there to return the better world.
  • We demonstrated the " proof of concept " by realizing a prototype, containing our sensors and an embarked technology.

To us, all together, to commit the manufacturing of a pre-series which can be tested on a larger scale and in any situations.

The implementation of a collaborative network via our Web platform bases on the solidity of your commitment and your investment on the long term!

" Only we go fast but together we go far! "


D'autres façons d'aider

Vous ne pouvez pas contribuer mais vous souhaitez nous soutenir? Prenez part à ce projet ambitieux en utilisant les réseaux sociaux et les profils du Label Abeille pour partager et communiquer! Parlez-en dans votre entourage, votre entreprise... Formez vous à l'apiculture et soutenez les abeilles en étant acteur de leur repopulation.

Inscrivez vous sur notre site et créez votre compte : www.label-abeille.org



Other manners to help

 You cannot contribute but you wish to support us? Take part in this ambitious project by using the social networks and the profiles of the Label Bee to share and communicate! Speak it in your circle of acquaintances, your company... Train you in the beekeeping and support bees by being an actor of their repopulation.

Subscribe on our web siteand creat your account : www.labe-abeille.org

Vous ne pouvez pas contribuer mais vous souhaitez nous soutenir? Prenez part à ce projet ambitieux en utilisant les réseaux sociaux et les profils du Label Abeille pour partager et communiquer! Parlez-en dans votre entourage, votre entreprise... Formez vous à l'apiculture et soutenez les abeilles en étant acteur de leur repopulation.
Inscrivez vous sur notre site et créez votre compte : www.label-abeille.org





Other manners to help
 You cannot contribute but you wish to support us? Take
part in this ambitious project by using the social networks and the profiles of
the Label Bee to share and communicate! Speak it in your circle of
acquaintances, your company... Train you in the beekeeping and support bees by
being an actor of their repopulation.
Subscribe on our web siteand creat your account : www.labe-abeille.org

story:
The Head of the Mag.

Thank you for dropping by here in our campaign page for Sneak Hunt Middle East MAGAZINE.

My name is Thomas, a sneaker-enthusiast based in Dubai, United Arab Emirates.
I started this campaign to bring my ideas of an ideal sneaker magazine to print, from one sneakerhead to another.

What We Need:

We need at least USD11,000 (or the equivalent of AED40,000) to start the production of the magazine.

  • UAE's National Media Council requires an estimated USD4,100 (approx. AED15000) for the license and media distribution. 
  • Printing cost for 1,000 copies is USD2,700 (approximately AED10,000)
  • The team: writer, content manager, researcher, designer, photographer, works on their discounted rates for the remaining AED15,000.

What you get:
Your Donation, Your Subscription.

You, as a donor / crowdfunder / contributor, all your donations will be converted into subscription credit.

USD14/AED50
You'll get the first 2 issues of Sneak Hunt Middle East Magazine for 2015 which will be for June and September.

USD28/AED100
You'll get the first 4 issues of Sneak Hunt Middle East Magazine:

  1. June 2015
  2. September 2015
  3. December 2015
  4. March 2016
But wait! There's more...
*You'll receive a AED100-voucher redeemable at Sneak Hunt Middle East website that you can use to purchase any item from the site.

USD55/AED200
You'll get 8 issues of Sneak Hunt Middle East Magazine from the 1st issue to December 2016 issue.
*You'll receive a AED200-voucher redeemable at Sneak Hunt Middle East website that you can use to purchase any item from the site.


Keeping it real.

We know it won't be this easy to start what others never did before, but from one sneakerhead to the other, I am fully positive that this will change our sneaker culture here in the middle east.

Please spread the word

Share this campaign on your facebook feeds, twitters, googleplus, blogs, perks.
Your help is priceless...

A BIG THANK YOU!

story:
Summary

Hi I am Gigi Goin, founder of Milk Lady Farmers Markets and the Annual Montgomery County Strawberry Festival. Our team members of the campaign are Bennett and Karen Rushkoff, Felix Bryant, BT Thomas, and Jacob Rushkoff.  

This year, the fifth annual Montgomery County Strawberry Festival takes place Saturday, May 16, from 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. at White Oak Middle School. In addition to sampling juicy local strawberries, attendees can also experience live music, fair-style rides, face painting, and food samples from local vendors.

Even sweeter than the strawberries is the fact that proceeds benefit these wonderful charitable programs: 

  • Sponsoring 200 local foster and sheltered children to enjoy the festival 
  • Providing 15 full and 15 partial scholarships for Summer Farm Day Camp Scholarship Fund
  • Funding the WIC and Seniors Matching Dollars Food Buying Program at farmers’ markets.

Be a part of this effort to give back by supporting the neediest families in our community, while having a blast with your family!

More Details

Milk Lady Farmers Markets is host of the Annual Montgomery County Strawberry Festival which is a fundraiser for its three charitable programs!

The festival provides an opportunity to invite local foster children that may otherwise not be able to attend and this year our goal is to bring 200 children and families from local foster homes and women and children’s shelters.  Would you be willing to help us to meet this goal?  See more at: http://mocostrawberryfest.org/donate/

The Strawberry Festival is a fundraiser for the Summer Farm Camp Scholarship program.  Our goal for our Summer Farm Camp Scholarship program is to help local families in need by providing 15 full and 15 partial scholarships.  See more at: http://milkladyfarmcamp.org/ 

Our “WIC and Seniors Matching Dollars Food Program” at our two farmers markets, matches the Fruit and Vegetable checks of WIC (Women, Infants and Children) and senior recipients.  They are among the most vulnerable and food-insecure in our communities and we match their Fruit and Vegetable checks in order to expand their food buying power at the markets.  Funding WIC matching dollars is not only good for recipient families, turns out, it’s good for farmers too!  See more at: http://milkladymarkets.org/wic-and-seniors/

Families come out to enjoy the Strawberry Festival and each year attendance has grown (from 300 in 2011 to 4,200 people in 2014).  Because of the growth, we need to bring our offerings to meet the scale of the number of attendees and cross the threshold for success.  We need to raise this money now so we can prepare the event for its best year ever for these amazing resilient kids and for you!

At the festival, we provide a community day for family fun featuring carnival rides, activities, music, local strawberry farmers, and strawberry inspired food and craft vendors.  To attract quality local vendors, we lease an elegant mid-century modern property and the indoor facilities, set up a festive décor, lease parking lots and buy excellent insurance coverages; the vendor and ticket fees cover most of these operational expenses. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our need from you is to be a part of building and funding the following goals:

·  Sponsoring 200 local foster and sheltered children to enjoy the festival 

·  Providing 15 full and 15 partial scholarships for Summer Farm Day Camp Scholarship Fund

·  Funding the WIC and Seniors Matching Dollars Food Buying Program at Shady Grove and White Oak Farmers Markets. 

You get to be a part of building this worthwhile campaign and to share in our amazing perks! 

Goal Expenses

Sponsor 200 foster children passes

7,800

WIC & Seniors Matching Nutrition Dollars

8,500

Farm Camp Scholarship Fund – 15 Full and 15 Partial Scholarships

21,700

We have a great team that is mobilizing around this effort, organizing security, décor and volunteers, customer service staff to support guests at the festival, and we need your support to join with us in making the 2015 Strawberry Festival our best year ever!  

The Impact

All funds will go to these three goals:

  1. Sponsoring 200 local foster and sheltered children to enjoy the Strawberry Festival on May 16.  Our tickets are based on the costs of the carnival equipment company.  We will give 200 foster care and sheltered children the chance to have a great time at the festival!  This is a $7,800 fundraising effort.
  2. Funding our WIC and Seniors Matching Dollars Nutrition Program for 2015.  Each year, we spend between $15,000 and 16,000 per year on fresh fruits and vegetables for WIC recipients and Senior Nutrition Check recipients.  We need to raise another $8,500 to meet our goal this year of supporting food security for the neediest in our community.  
  3. Funding 15 full and 15 partial scholarships for Summer Farm Day Camp.  These scholarships will go to local children with a strong interest in nature, farming and ecology and whose families are not positioned to cover the cost of tuition.  Our tuition is based on paying a competitive living wage to our professional educators and resource professionals who work in MCPS and are employed by us in the summer.  This is a $21,700 fundraising effort which represents half of our total effort for this program.

When you give, it helps us to meet these goals and regardless of the amount we raise, it all goes towards these three goals.  Thank you and see more below… 

Risks & Challenges

This is a steep fundraising challenge for us and getting the word out is our key to succeeding.  We are promoting it through our network of market goers, festival attendees, social media and to you the generous public.  Please give and also share this campaign with your friends and colleagues.

When you give, it helps us to meet these goals and regardless of the amount we raise, it all goes towards these three goals.  Thank you and see more below… 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • So please help to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

We appreciate your support.  Thank you!

story:
Summary

I discovered the outdoors when i was a kid. I started with fishing, then hiking. As a teenager i did a lot of camping with my friends and took it to the next level - rock climbing.

This formed my character. I learned about sustainability, friendship, nature and basic life principles.   

Now, a father myself, i also take my son fishing and camping. doing this and looking at my son, made me realize what impact nature can have on a little individual and how i can use this to help others.

After almost an year of brainstorming, my wife, her father and I agreed on what needs to be done to actually make that thought come to life.

This is phase one of the project, where we want to raise money to put together a non-profit organization, to help kids from not so fortunate families (poor, single parent, etc.) and give them a fair fighting chance to do something with their lives. Give them access to what the most of us take for granted - education, love and support. 

And we want to do this using mother nature. But this is phase 2...

What We Need

As in any other country on this planet, bureaucracy can be a show stopper to anything you are trying to accomplish, hence we need professional help.

Professional help means a lawyer, that can help us navigate the narrow and twisted wording found in the local laws, and get to our end scope - non-profit organization.
As we all know, lawyers cost money, and even if 1000$ might now seems like a big amount for others, for us, here in Romania, can sometimes be a fortune.

The money we raise here, plus our own financial effort will be invested in:
- create a non profit organization
- build a website
- draft a project to access EU (European Union) founds for phase two.

If we manage to do this, we move to phase two.
Phase two, without going into more details, requires accessing EU funding (300k $) to build an outdoor camp.

If we do not manage to do this, raise the 1000$, we will not stop. We will keep on trying until we have the organization in place, and dedicate our time to find alternative ways for funding.

Impact

We know it is impossible to change the world, and we know we cannot help all the children in need, but if we managed to do so with some, who knows what happens. Maybe the next Einstein will be found, or the new great composer of our time, the doctor that will cure cancer.
Without access to information, education and well being, natural talent can be easily lost.
100. This is our target for the first 2 years.
At least 100 hundred children, from underprivileged families, with no possibility to pursuit an academic institution, or cannot afford one. Identify what they are good at, what do they like to do, offer professional support.

Teach them basic life principles, give them access to all the things OUR children take for granted - TV, Internet, toys, etc. - and teach them how they can use it, how are they built. 
There are no limits and no barriers - we built them, and only we can take them down.


Risks & Challenges

Not raising the money in time to access the EU funding.
No support from the local authorities

No money to donate? You can still help.

We need anything you can spare, as it is not all about the money.
For example, If you can build a website, we save money in paying someone to do it for us.  Or you already have experience working in a non-profit organization, share you knowledge. 

If you think you can help in any way, drop us a line. Let's have a chat.

story:
1. Introduction:
    My name is Henry Moyo and I am the founder and owner of International Pro Soccer Academy Inc. IPSA Inc. is a (501.3.c application in process pending) elite soccer school in Central Florida focussing on player development at an elite level. We are NOT a soccer club, but a school with the aim of improving players one at a time through specific programming.
  1.  Background and Experience
    I was privileged to play soccer as a professional and after retirement I began my coaching career at an amateur level. I moved to Tennessee from England to continue coaching at a collegiate level. I spent 17 years as a college coach before moving to Central Florida in 2011 to continue my coaching at the USA National Training Center as the Director of the Soccer Academy. Just over a year ago I started my own Academy, International Pro Soccer Academy Inc.
       While in college I was voted NCCAA Region Coach of the Year. I produced         numerous NSCAA Academic AllAmericas, NSCAA All-America players and also MLS draftees who played professionally for MLS and USL teams (Columbus Crew, CharlotteEagles, Tampa Bay Rowdies) and also in England (Stockport County). 
As Director of National Training Center, with over 400 registered youthplayers I was also Head Coach of the NTC Phoenix, a WPSL team inwhich I produced players that went on to play in France and nowin England, (Liverpool Ladies), and here in the USA (Boston BreakersWPL).3. Campaign Goal: Extend IPSA’s uniquesoccer education to children across Central Florida and ensure itremains accessible to all families.

Campaign Goal:

Extend IPSA’s unique soccer education to children across Central Florida and ensure it remains accessible to all families.

Who we are:

The International Professional Soccer Academy (IPSA) is a unique soccer school. Our goal is to prepare students physically, mentally, and emotionally for the disciplined life of an elite soccer player and provide them with access to higher levels of soccer.

At IPSA, we don’t just train. We educate players of the beautiful game. Soccer skills training is a core part of our curriculum but so is character-building and life skills training. Our students develop speed and agility, self-confidence, and sportsmanship while learning to love the sport and excel in it. Our students and their families also learn how to:

  • Eat healthy

  • Be disciplined

  • Stay safe on the field, off the field, on the internet, and out in their communities

  • Handle money, establish budgets, and become financially literate

  • Prepare for college and college application requirements

  • Become socially responsible

These skills, and the discipline they learn, prepare our students for success in college athletics and in life.

The IPSA model is unique and superior to the standard American soccer clubs’ approach to training:

Approach to Soccer Training

Standard Soccer Clubs

The
IPSA Model

Develop students’ general understanding of how soccer is played including formation and positional plays

Develop students’ soccer skills and technical abilities

Develop students’ deep, intrinsic desire to succeed in the sport and in life by emphasizing effort and discipline


Develop each student to his or her fullest potential through individualized training


Instill discipline in areas that foster long-term success in the sport and in life (nutrition, college preparedness, internet safety) through formal classroom instruction


Facilitate networking opportunities for older students (connect with college coaches, other leagues, and the professional soccer world)


Provide students direct access to elite levels through associations with FIFA-licensed agencies


Ensure students are on par with their European Academy counterparts both as players and in their understanding of the latest training trends


Train students to play in league games every weekend – a short-term motivation risking fatigue and injury among players


Compete in tournaments once a month – a long-term focus providing students with competitive experiences without pressure for league results



Our priority is developing each player to his or her fullest potential. Students receive field and classroom instruction each week from qualified coaches and specialists. We use scientifically proven methods like periodization to minimize fatigue and injury, and our students only compete in local tournaments once a month. Our priority is not to fill trophy cases. It’s to fill the sport with well-rounded individuals and world-class players.

To learn more, go to www.internationalprosocceracademy.com.

What we need:

We want to completely change the perception of youth soccer training and education in the United States, starting with Central Florida. Through the IPSA model, we want to produce healthier, stronger, better-skilled and technically advanced players.

Our first year of operation has been a huge success. Our Academy brought together 60 children and families from across Lake County, Florida. Together, we’ve competed in 13 tournaments and earned 8 championship and finalists medals. More importantly, every one of our players has improved drastically in their soccer skills. Our players are demonstrating a true understanding of the game and impressive ball-handling skills. The few players with physical challenges are showing great improvement in their running skills and body movements and our shy players are showing initiative and drive. All are demonstrating commitment and love for the sport.

Moving forward, our immediate priorities are to:

  1. Sponsor young, talented players from low-income families who otherwise could not afford the high fees for local clubs

  2. Subsidize training for up to 140 IPSA Cadets – our new program designed to introduce novice U6 – U9 players to the sport and begin developing their skills and technique in a fun environment

  3. Fund our high school players’ college preparatory courses and college visitation trips, and gather game footage for their college recruiting

Longer-term, we are working to grow the Academy strategically. We are not aiming for explosive expansion; we are seeking qualitative growth with a manageable number of students who we can fully support with personalized training from highly experienced staff. This means establishing processes for, and funding, effective screening, hiring, educating, and licensing of coaches.

We know and understand that soccer is a growing sport in our country. We also know that our Academy concept is still very new to the United States but a proven method in Europe. We are constantly working to educate the community on how other countries consistently produce higher skilled players, demonstrating that the IPSA model of training is the way forward. We are prepared to move slowly but effectively, producing high quality players.

We’ve grown our Academy by word of mouth, visiting local schools, hosting soccer camps, and inviting prospective students to try out our school free of charge. Eventually, it is those young players who have made a conscious decision to play soccer at an elite level who will find a home at IPSA. IPSA’s holistic training perspective and commitment to player development will make the difference.

How you can help:

We need to raise $30,000 before August 2015. This will help us:

  1. Provide scholarships for 10 full-time or 20 part-time players from low-income families for the 2015-2016 school year

  2. Purchase age-appropriate equipment, rent fields and classrooms from the city, and pay coach salaries for the IPSA Cadets program, reducing costs to families

  3. Subsidize college application costs for our high school players.

Your contribution will greatly advance IPSA’s mission and be a significant benefit to our current and future students. As an IPSA sponsor, your name will appear on our Academy website and the highest donor will have their name or the name of their business/organization printed on the IPSA Cadets’ game jerseys.

Other Ways You Can Help

We need monetary support to advance our mission but we also need to get the word out about IPSA and about our campaign. Please consider:

  • Sharing our campaign with others in your community

  • Liking us on Facebook and directing others to our page

  • Following us on Twitter

  • Recommending IPSA to family and friends

  • Helping us find business sponsors

  • Directing young talented players, especially from low-income families, our way

  • Recommending the IPSA Cadets program to novice U6 – U9 players

We at IPSA thank you most sincerely for your time and generous support.Please spread the word out and share with your friends on Facebook, Twitter and all social media.

Director of the Soccer Academy. Just over a year ago I started my own
Academy, International Pro Soccer Academy Inc.       While in college I was voted NCCAA Region Coach of the Year. I produced         numerous NSCAA Academic AllAmericas, NSCAA All-America players and also MLS draftees who played professionally for MLS and USL teams (Columbus Crew, CharlotteEagles, Tampa Bay Rowdies) and also in England (Stockport County). As Director of National Training Center, with over 400 registered youthplayers I was also Head Coach of the NTC Phoenix, a WPSL team inwhich I produced players that went on to play in France and nowin England, (Liverpool Ladies), and here in the USA (Boston BreakersWPL).3. Campaign Goal:
Extend IPSA’s uniquesoccer education to children across Central Florida and ensure itremains accessible to all families.



Campaign Goal:

Extend IPSA’s unique
soccer education to children across Central Florida and ensure it
remains accessible to all families.

Who we are:

The International
Professional Soccer Academy (IPSA) is a unique soccer school. Our
goal is to prepare students physically, mentally, and emotionally for
the disciplined life of an elite soccer player and provide them with
access to higher levels of soccer.

At IPSA, we don’t just
train. We educate players of the beautiful game. Soccer skills
training is a core part of our curriculum but so is
character-building and life skills training. Our students develop
speed and agility, self-confidence, and sportsmanship while learning
to love the sport and excel in it. Our students and their families
also learn how to:



	Eat healthy



	Be disciplined



	Stay safe on the field,
	off the field, on the internet, and out in their communities



	Handle money, establish
	budgets, and become financially literate



	Prepare for college and
	college application requirements



	Become socially
	responsible



These skills, and the
discipline they learn, prepare our students for success in college
athletics and in life. 


The IPSA model is unique
and superior to the standard American soccer clubs’ approach to
training:




Approach
			to Soccer Training


Standard
			Soccer Clubs


The
			IPSA Model




Develop
			students’ general understanding of how soccer is played
			including formation and positional plays


















Develop
			students’ soccer skills and technical abilities 
			


















Develop
			students’ deep, intrinsic desire to succeed in the sport and in
			life by emphasizing effort and discipline 
			















Develop
			each student to his or her fullest potential through
			individualized training















Instill
			discipline in areas that foster long-term success in the sport and
			in life (nutrition, college preparedness, internet safety) through
			formal classroom instruction















Facilitate
			networking opportunities for older students (connect with college
			coaches, other leagues, and the professional soccer world)















Provide
			students direct access to elite levels through associations with
			FIFA-licensed agencies















Ensure
			students are on par with their European Academy counterparts both
			as players and in their understanding of the latest training
			trends 
			















Train
			students to play in league games every weekend – a short-term
			motivation risking fatigue and injury among players















Compete
			in tournaments once a month – a long-term focus providing
			students with competitive experiences without pressure for league
			results
















Our
priority is developing each player to his or her fullest potential.
Students receive field and classroom instruction each week from
qualified coaches and specialists. We use scientifically proven
methods like periodization to minimize fatigue and injury, and our
students only compete in local tournaments once a month. Our priority
is not to fill trophy cases. It’s to fill the sport with
well-rounded individuals and world-class players. 


To learn more, go to
www.internationalprosocceracademy.com.

What we need:
We
want to completely change the perception of youth soccer training and
education in the United States, starting with Central Florida.
Through the IPSA model, we want to produce healthier, stronger,
better-skilled and technically advanced players. 


Our first year of
operation has been a huge success. Our Academy brought together 60
children
and families from across Lake County, Florida. Together, we’ve
competed in 13
tournaments and earned 8
championship
and finalists medals. More importantly, every one of our players has
improved drastically in their soccer skills. Our players are demonstrating a true
understanding of the game and impressive ball-handling skills. The few players with physical challenges are showing great improvement in
their running skills and body movements and our shy players are
showing initiative and drive. All are demonstrating commitment and
love for the sport.

Moving forward, our
immediate priorities are to:



	Sponsor young, talented
	players from low-income families who otherwise could not afford the
	high fees for local clubs



	Subsidize training for up
	to 140 IPSA Cadets – our new
	program designed to introduce novice U6 – U9 players to the sport
	and begin developing their skills and technique in a fun environment



	Fund our high school
	players’ college preparatory courses and college visitation trips,
	and gather game footage for their college recruiting 
	


Longer-term,
we are working to grow the Academy strategically. We are not aiming
for explosive expansion; we are seeking qualitative growth with a
manageable number of students who we can fully support with
personalized training from highly experienced staff. This means
establishing processes for, and funding, effective screening, hiring,
educating, and licensing of coaches.
We
know and understand that soccer is a growing sport in our country. We
also know that our Academy concept is still very new to the United
States but a proven method in Europe. We are constantly working to
educate the community on how other countries consistently produce
higher skilled players, demonstrating that the IPSA model of training
is the way forward. We are prepared to move slowly but effectively,
producing high quality players. 

We’ve
grown our Academy by word of mouth, visiting local schools, hosting
soccer camps, and inviting prospective students to try out our school
free of charge. Eventually, it is those young players who have made a
conscious decision to play soccer at an elite level who will find a
home at IPSA. IPSA’s holistic training perspective and commitment
to player development will make the difference.

How you can help:

We need to raise $30,000
before August 2015. This will help us:



	Provide scholarships
	for 10 full-time or 20 part-time players from low-income
	families for the 2015-2016 school year



	Purchase age-appropriate
	equipment, rent fields and classrooms from the city, and pay coach
	salaries for the IPSA Cadets program, reducing costs to families 
	



	Subsidize college
	application costs for our high school players.



Your contribution will
greatly advance IPSA’s mission and be a significant benefit to our
current and future students. As an IPSA sponsor, your name will
appear on our Academy website and the highest donor will have their
name or the name of their business/organization printed on the IPSA
Cadets’ game jerseys.

Other Ways You Can Help

We need monetary support
to advance our mission but we also need to get the word out about
IPSA and about our campaign. Please consider:



	Sharing our campaign with
	others in your community



	Liking us on Facebook and
	directing others to our page



	Following us on Twitter



	Recommending IPSA to
	family and friends



	Helping us find business
	sponsors



	Directing young talented
	players, especially from low-income families, our way



	Recommending the IPSA
	Cadets program to novice
	U6 – U9 players



We at IPSA thank you most
sincerely for your time and generous support.Please spread the word out and share with your friends on Facebook, Twitter and all social media.

story:
Version français en bas.

As a celebration of our three years hard at work, learning all the ins and outs of professional photography, we are having a vernissage! We've all grown as artists throughout our time in the Professional Photography program at Dawson College, and it's time to show you what we can do!

We would like to demonstrate our abilities to all our guests. From family and friends, to professionals alike.


Every contributed dollar will help us make this wonderful exhibition a reality. This budget will be allocated to drinks, catering, promotional and exhibition material, and brochures for each graduating students' work. Other various fundraisers such as bake sales and photo booths have helped us raise some of our money already. This Indiegogo campaign will help us continue to raise money and promote our exhibition.

As a thank you for your donation, we have gifts to offer you! After you choose your perk, an email will be sent to you to find out which print you would like.

These are the prints you can choose from...


Although we will have an online catalog of our collective work, we have decided to create individual brochures as well. This will be one of the greater expenses of our vernissage.

Because we are fewer graduates than normal this year, each of us plays a bigger role in the planning process of this vernissage, so your help means so much to each and every one of us!
Everyone who donates will be able to pick up their print(s) at our vernissage on May 20th, 2015 at Dawson College.

Other Ways You Can Help

To help us even further, please spread the word about our vernissage and our fundraiser, the more the word is spread, the happier everyone will be!
VERSION FRANÇAIS
Pour célébrer nos trois ans de travail acharné, d’apprentissage de tous les rouages de la photographie professionnelle, nous organisons un vernissage ! Nous avons tous appris, progressé et développé notre créativité et c’est maintenant le temps de vous montrer ce que nous sommes capable d’accomplir. Nous aimerions présenter le fruit de nos efforts à vous chers invités, famille, amis et professionnels du domaine.
Chaque dollars reçu servira à rendre ce moment tant attendu réalité. Le budget est alloué à la nourriture, les breuvages, tout le matériel promotionnel et relié au vernissage ainsi que des brochures regroupant le beau travail de chaque étudiant. Nous avons effectué d’autres types de levée de fond tels que cuisiner et vendre de petites pâtisseries à l’école ou encore des « photobooth », le tout nous a grandement aidé à ramasser un bon montant. La campagne Indiegogo à pour but de poursuivre la levée de fond et en même temps promouvoir notre vernissage. 
Pour vous remercier de vos contributions, nous avons des cadeaux à vous offrir. Après avoir choisi une contrepartie, un courriel vous sera envoyé avec la liste des photos que vous pouvez acheté et faire imprimer. Photos en haut. 
Nous aurons un catalogue en ligne qui regroupera le travail de chaque étudiant, ainsi que des brochures individuelle, ces dernières, qui seront distribuée la soirée du vernissage, représentent la plus grande partie du budget. Dû à une plus petite cohorte qu’à l’habitude dans ce programme, nous jouons tous un rôle crucial dans la planification et l’organisation de ce vernissage. Conséquemment, votre aide représente énormément pour nous, chacun d’entre nous. Tous les généreux donateurs pourront venir chercher leur photo imprimée à notre vernissage le 20 mai 2015 au collège Dawson. 
 PASSEZ LE MOT Pour nous aider encore plus, nous vous invitons à passer le mot autour de vous à propos de notre vernissage et notre levée de fonds, plus vous en parlez plus nous seront content !

story:
Short Summary

Our passion for the children of our community has helped us build Healthy bodies, trusting hearts, and enriched minds. 

  • Founded by 3 New York City teachers, Project Haven was incorporated and obtained its 501(c)(3) status.  As teachers working within the New York City public schools, they witnessed the loss of opportunities for their students to have a safe haven away from the dangers of crime and gang violence once schools let out for the day. Their response to the crisis is the birth of Project Haven, an organization that strives to fill in the void of the lack of after school programs in New York City public schools.
  • Contributions will help us fund programs like martial arts, and Cultural Excursions to keep the children engaged and safe away from the streets during the dangerous hours of 3pm to 5pm when hard working parents are not home and children fall prey to gangs, drugs and violence.
  • Our vast charter encompasses enrichment programs like chess, health, art, technology, sports, and travel for children k-12.

What We Need 

In collaboration with the City University of New York we will be expanding our reach to provide enriched programs that are deeply needed in our community.

This is our break down. 

PROJECT HAVEN MARTIAL ARTS PROGRAM - $41,325

Fifty-five students will get active while learning to find focus and stillness as they experience the discipline and confidence of martial arts. We provide everything they need including uniforms, sparring gear, mouth guards, and all the belts they can earn!

PROJECT HAVEN MULTICULTURAL EXCURSION - $23,810

Fifteen students will challenge their perspectives with six days of travel and discovery on a cultural excursion. 

PROJECT HAVEN CAMPING PROGRAM - $4,496

Thirteen students will replace the streetlights with stars and embark upon a teamwork adventure for seven days.

The Impact

  • We at Project Haven believe that we can provide the much-needed opportunities for NYC children of today to become leaders of tomorrow.

  • Young people who participate in outdoor adventures benefit in countless ways as they step into new environments. Experiences with Project Haven will provide youth with the opportunity to develop:

    Leadership and life skills

    Self-confidence, self discipline and self-respect

    Trust

    A sense of responsibility for self, others, the community, and the environment

    Critical thinking skills

    Teamwork experience

    Decision-making skills                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Respect for all   

Risks & Challenges

The Community served by Project Haven is primarily the Children in the Bronx area who’s parents cannot afford the ever increasing costs of after school provision. Many of the parents work in minimum wage positions and are left with little choice but to leave their children at home or out on the streets until they return from work. These children are then subjected to inappropriate actions including crime, promiscuity, and other drug and alcohol related issues.

    The program aims to serve all school age children in need; however it is recognized that targeting middle schoolers before they have had chance to become embedded in the negative and harmful effects that being on the streets can cause, will provide sustainable benefits to not only the children’s wellbeing, emotional and physical development but also to the community in which they live. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about our efforts through social media and word of mouth... The next child we serve may be one you know and love...
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools as well!

Thank you for your support!!!

story:
My name is Matthew K. Toyama and I will be joining the Peruvian Forensic Anthropology Team (EPAF) as a foreign student assisting in the investigation and documentation of human rights abuses committed under the Siad Barre regime in Hargeisa, Somaliland this March 2015--I need your support to assist me in this work.

BACKGROUND: In countries where grave human rights violations have taken place, and the transition from totalitarian regime to political and economic development is underway, preserving memory is paramount to writing history and for building and rebuilding nations. In post conflict situations facing many countries of the Global South, “it is important that countries have the capacity to investigate their own dead. It is a new form of doing justice.” (José Pablo Baraybar, Executive Director of EPAF)

This need exists in the Horn of Africa, as Somaliland seeks to establish itself since its independence from the Republic of Somalia in 1991 and the end of the Siad Barre dictatorship which left estimates of 60,000 civilians dead, many from massacres and bombings of the city of Hargeisa. In the words of Executive Director Baraybar, "Hargeisa is a graveyard. Some say there are 200,000 bodies under the ground. Others say 60,000. Nobody really knows. That's why we have to get the record straight."

THE WORK: EPAF provides international forensic training programs to assist prosecutors, human rights defenders and civil society actors to investigate and document evidence of human rights violations. Since 2013, EPAF has employed its program in Somaliland through its Field Schools to accomplish:

1. The determination of the universe of missing people through a systematic approach including ante mortem data collection, research of mass graves and analysis of human remains, and the eventual return of human remains to relatives and communities of victims in Hargeisa;

2. The improvement of the skills and competencies of the War Crimes Investigation Commission (WCIC) of Somaliland (http://wcicsomaliland.org/) staff investigating the human rights violations, with the help of foreign students;

3. The enrichment of the professional experience of foreign students in the field of forensic anthropological research;

4. And the eventual prosecution of some of the cases analyzed by EPAF and students, pending the decision of the government and the people of Somaliland, through the WCIC.

*See below for more information on the history of Somalia under the rule of Siad Barre and the work of EPAF. 

ABOUT ME: I am a May 2014 graduate of Santa Clara University School of Law in CA, USA earning a J.D. as a Public International Law Scholar with Honors. My experience in the international legal field includes work with the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) in San Jose, Costa Rica in 2012 and with the international human rights litigation non-profit organization, Center for Justice and Accountability (San Francisco, CA) in 2013, which is a sponsor and partner of EPAF (http://cja.org/article.php?id=1153). I have also worked with the Stanford Human Rights Center as a research assistant to Professor James Cavallaro serving as a Commissioner of the Inter-American Commission on Human Rights. I have been published in international legal academia with an article concerning the future of human rights litigation in the U.S. in the Indonesian Journal of International & Comparative Law (July 2014).

EXPENSES:
--> Program costs (incl. accommodations/meals/administrative fees of Somaliland government): $4000 USD
--> Airfare: Estimated $1500-1900 USD
* I will be paying for the majority of this, however I am grateful for any support I receive and will be using it towards offsetting the costs of airfare and the program, even if the stated funding goal is not met.

THE PRODUCT / "PERKS":
--> I intend to write a scholarly article concerning the relationship of the preservation of memory, the historical record and the state of international human rights law, or a thesis in progress. Contributors will receive any published copies at no charge and potentially a note of gratitude in the work.
--> Entrance ticket to the afterlife of worldview of choice per each contributor of this campaign, plus reception of the divine grace which accompanies knowledge of oneself as an indefatigably "good person"
--> Also, if desired by contributors, I will monitor progress of the work through a picture blog.

MORE INFORMATION:

*Siad Barre: General Mohammed Siad Barre was the military dictator and President of the Somali Democratic Republic from 1969-1991.

During the effort to institute socialist government in Somalia following a coup d'état in 1969, part of the Barre-led military junta's reign was characterized by oppressive dictatorial rule, including allegations of arbitrary arrests and summary killings of resistant Somalis in urban and rural nomad populations and the oppression and torture of political opponents and dissidents. The United Nations Development Programme has stated that "the 21-year regime of Siyad Barre had one of the worst human rights records in Africa."

In the mid-1980s, in response to resistance movements, especially the Somali National Movement (SNM) in northern Somaliland, Barre ordered punitive measures including mass executions and the bombing of cities, including administrative centers of Hargeisa among the targeted areas in 1988. The bombardment resulted in the deaths of an estimated 50,000 people.

To date, a small number of former members of the Siad Barre regime now residing in the United States have been successfully sued in U.S. federal court, including: the first human rights case to address atrocities under the Siad Barre regime, against former Prime Minister and Minister of Defense Mohamed Ali Samantar (Yousuf v. Samantar); Warfaa v. Ali, against notorious war criminal Colonel Yusuf Abdi Ali (aka Tukeh); and most recently, Ahmed v. Magan, against former Chief of Investigations of the infamous National Security Service (NSS) Abdi Aden Magan. (See http://www.cja.org/article.php?list=type&type=287)

*EPAF: The forensic experts of Equipo Peruano de Antropología Forense teach participant states how to use locally available materials to:   conduct ante mortem interviews to collect information about a crime and construct detailed profiles of the victims; identify, document, and recover evidence from a crime scene while maintaining the chain of custody; conduct forensic investigations according to international standards, following protocols detailed in the training manual; and make valid interpretations of evidence that can be presented in the form of a forensic report.

Its training program is built on a model of South-South cooperation that allows EPAF to share experiences with its international partners while offering low-tech solutions to problems frequently encountered in the developing world. As a result, participants in EPAF training programs acquire a sustainable, pragmatic approach to forensic investigations that can be easily replicated, even in the most isolated regions.

To date, EPAF’s training program has increased the investigative capacity of counterparts in Peru, Colombia, Chile, Venezuela, the Philippines, Nepal and the Democratic Republic of Congo. EPAF has most recently used this model to assess and train the regional staff of the Commission on Human Rights for the Philippines and strengthen their capacity to investigate cases of forced disappearances; train Congolese police officers to investigate mass grave sites in the war-torn province of North Kivu; prepare Nepalese human rights investigators to uncover cases of forced disappearances and extrajudicial killings from the country’s recently concluded internal armed conflict. (http://epafperu.org/)

3. The enrichment of the professional experience of foreign students in the field 
of forensic anthropological research; 
4. And the eventual prosecution of some of the 
cases analyzed by EPAF and students, pending the decision of the government and the people
 of Somaliland, through the WCIC.

*See below for more information on the history of Somalia under the rule of Siad Barre and the work of EPAF.  
ABOUT ME: I am a May 2014 graduate of Santa Clara University School of Law in CA, USA earning a J.D. as a Public International Law Scholar with Honors. My
experience in the international legal field includes work with the
 United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) in San Jose, Costa Rica in 2012 and with the international human rights litigation non-profit organization, Center for Justice and 
Accountability (San Francisco, CA)  in 2013, which is a sponsor and partner of EPAF (http://cja.org/article.php?id=1153). I have also worked with the Stanford Human Rights Center as a research assistant to Professor James 
Cavallaro serving as a Commissioner of the Inter-American Commission on Human Rights. I have been published in international legal academia with an article concerning the future of human rights litigation in the U.S. in the Indonesian Journal of International & Comparative Law (July 2014). 

EXPENSES:--> Program costs (incl. accommodations/meals/administrative fees of Somaliland government): $4000 USD--> Airfare: Estimated $1500-1900 USD* I will be paying for the majority of this, however I am grateful for any support I receive and will be using it towards offsetting the costs of airfare and the program, even if the stated funding goal is not met.THE PRODUCT / "PERKS":--> I intend to write a scholarly article concerning the relationship of the preservation of memory, the historical record and the state of international human rights law, or a thesis in progress. Contributors will receive any published copies at no charge and potentially a note of gratitude in the work.--> Entrance ticket to the afterlife of worldview of choice per each contributor of this campaign, plus reception of the divine grace 
which accompanies knowledge of oneself as an indefatigably "good person" --> Also, if desired by contributors, I will monitor progress of the work through a picture blog.MORE INFORMATION:

*Siad Barre: General Mohammed Siad Barre was the military dictator and President of the Somali Democratic Republic from 1969-1991.During the effort to institute socialist government in Somalia following a coup d'état in 1969, part of the Barre-led military junta's reign was characterized by oppressive dictatorial rule, including allegations of arbitrary arrests and summary killings of resistant Somalis in urban and rural nomad populations and the oppression and torture of political opponents and dissidents. The United Nations Development Programme has stated that "the 21-year regime of Siyad Barre had one of the worst human rights records in Africa." 
In the mid-1980s, in response to resistance movements, especially the Somali National Movement (SNM) in northern Somaliland, Barre ordered punitive measures including mass executions and the bombing of cities, including administrative centers of Hargeisa among the targeted areas in 1988. The bombardment resulted in the deaths of an estimated 50,000 people.
To date, a small number of former members of the Siad Barre 
regime now residing in the United States have been successfully sued in U.S. federal court, including: the first human rights case to address atrocities under the Siad Barre regime, against former Prime Minister and Minister of Defense Mohamed Ali 
Samantar (Yousuf v. Samantar); Warfaa v. Ali, against notorious war criminal Colonel Yusuf Abdi Ali (aka Tukeh); and
 most recently, Ahmed v. Magan, against former Chief of Investigations of the infamous National Security 
Service (NSS) Abdi Aden Magan. (See http://www.cja.org/article.php?list=type&type=287) 

*EPAF: The forensic experts of Equipo Peruano de Antropología Forense teach participant states how to use locally available 
materials to:   conduct ante mortem interviews to collect information 
about a crime and construct detailed profiles of the victims; identify, 
document, and recover evidence from a crime scene while maintaining the 
chain of custody; conduct forensic investigations according to 
international standards, following protocols detailed in the training 
manual; and make valid interpretations of evidence that can be presented in 
the form of a forensic report.
Its training program is built 
on a model of South-South cooperation that allows EPAF to share 
experiences with its international partners while offering low-tech 
solutions to problems frequently encountered in the developing world. As
 a result, participants in EPAF training programs acquire a sustainable,
 pragmatic approach to forensic investigations that can be easily 
replicated, even in the most isolated regions.To date, EPAF’s training program has increased the
 investigative capacity of counterparts in Peru, Colombia, Chile, 
Venezuela, the Philippines, Nepal and the Democratic Republic of Congo. EPAF
 has most recently used this model to assess and train the regional 
staff of the Commission on Human Rights for the Philippines and 
strengthen their capacity to investigate cases of forced 
disappearances; train Congolese police officers to investigate mass 
grave sites in the war-torn province of North Kivu; prepare Nepalese 
human rights investigators to uncover cases of forced disappearances and
 extrajudicial killings from the country’s recently concluded internal 
armed conflict. (http://epafperu.org/)

story:
UNPics - alternative studies for orphans


WHAT IS FREE CHILDREN?  

      Free Children is a non-profit organisation created to tackle poverty by helping children from underprivileged families to become qualified professionals. This long term project, is aiming to provide education to those who got less fortune and help them work towards a better life by getting a full degree in programming, design and photography.


What UNPics does?

Our school is aiming to offer free qualification in computer science, programming (IOS, Android, Web, Ruby, PHP, Java, Scala, JS, CSS, C++, C#), design, illustration and photography. The project will provide graduates an opportunity to become experienced professionals in desired filed through learning and practicing at the same time.

Following the concept and main aim of the project, the project is designed to help children from underprivileged families age 13-16 to get degree in design or IT.

The reason for having this focus group is manly related to the time when adolescents are completing mandatory studies funded by the state. As the educational system in Moldova is based on universal knowledge, many of them cannot apply their skills into practice, therefore failing in having a decent job after their graduation. Moreover, all of them do not have the budget to continue their studies in order to become a qualified professional with college or university degree.

Therefore, Free Children will bring possibility for children to get a safe profession witch which they can always compete on labour market.  

Why is not a simple charity foundation?

The things we are doing is not charity, we are teaching, training and employing unprivileged teenagers who are interested in arts and IT science.  If they had a bad luck to be born in an unstable family or in a very poor area it doesn’t mean that they cannot change their destiny. Or main goals and objective is to give them the knowledge, practice, and a clear understanding of how using their learned skills can get them a better life.

How it works?

When joining the course, students will be able to choose their field of studies in computer science and programming or design, digital arts classes and photography. The course will take a year and a half where children will learn the basics of their area of interest and will apply their knowledge into real time work experience by assisting experienced professionals who will rent our studios on off-classes time.


Another pivotal mission of the project is helping students selling their works on stock platforms. As a part of the agreement signed with their representatives when joining the course, all the students will have their own bank accounts linked to their online stock profiles from where they will earn 100% of the sales of works such as: digital content, hand painted posters, postcards, and interior design sketches. From the gained income they will be allowed to spend only half of it, the rest being saved for their future higher education studies. For all the others users selling their works from our stock platform they will earn 70% of the sales of works such as: digital content, hand painted posters, postcards, and interior design sketches the rest of 30% will be used to expand the project nationally by building two more schools in other main cities or financing project which intend to support the same cause. If the project will be successful, after 3-4 years Free Children is planning to open an international chain in other vulnerable countries, with first location to be Varanssy, India.

100% of our students will get a job,

Another key focus of the intended project is to help students finding jobs in the fields they graduated from. They can start in the school studio and teach other generations or we will source potential employers who are looking for graduates. In addition to that, will source pre-job contracts, where the students will be qualified based on employer’s requests, those securing a position after they completed their degree.  Also there are 2 more options  becoming a part of our big family   they can pass a training an become a teacher in our  next studio. At the end all of them  are going to get  a free account on Freelance.pro, a new start up from our friends.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal this year

  • The cost of the project is estimated to  75000 $, (from which we will lose around 29% on  different payments and taxes fees) 
  • The money will be pended on :
    • Renting a building(180m2) for a 12000$ a year including all taxes and bills (after a year we are going to become owners of this place).

    • Equipment for photo studio 3000$

    • Equipment for 2 big classes ,
      • Programming and design class  -3500$

      • Design and painting class  on the second floor with materials for a year 3000$

    • 12 used IMac units,  so we could use them for all the modules 
      • Licenced package of: AD illustrator , AD Photoshop , Programming  ,Cinema 4d , Sketchup  15000$
    • 3 pro cameras and sets of lenses for the photography classes (well-maintained used equipment) 
    • 15 simple crop cameras that we could give to the children for making their homework 10000$
    • Bus for transporting kids from different regions (300$ a month/12 months =3600$)
    • creating and developing an online stock (the stock is going to be the first platform  where all students will sell their works, and gain income -  3000$
    • Workshop studio with necessary equipment where children will be producing elements of interior design 2000$
    • Materials for designing and producing perks (for our funders)

 Perks , what we can offer.

 available  Perks
  10$ 

  • Website Credit - your name will be added to Unpics.org to demonstrate your support for the Free Children Project.
  • Digital Certificate - we will send you a digital certificate that you can use to show your support for the campaign.
  •  10$-hand painted postcard  100 available
  •   150 available   50$-Personal thanks from children on our Youtube chanel an a small  present designed and created by our students
    • Website Credit and Digital Certificate
  •   500 available  90$ Free Children unique Tshirt , with handpainted   from our Kids.Those could be so different thats why we are not adding photos but for sure you gonna like them. 
    • Website Credit and Digital Certificate
  •   200 available  100$ 25 free uploads from our stock and a personal giftcard 
  •   100  available   200$ interior design object , you can chose , a handpainted poste,canvas,handmade lamp inspire by Max Ashford design  
    • Website Credit and Digital Certificate

  •   300 available  250$ Poster , 50% discount in stock fro all the products in stock 
    • Website Credit and Digital Certificate
  •   50  available     300$  Spcialist for 50 h.For your choice We will offer you 50 hours of coding in (IOS,Android,web:ruby , php, java, scala, js, css,c++ ,c#) ,  design  , illustartor. Its goig to be a good practice for children and a good investing 
    • Website Credit and Digital Certificate
  •   200 available    500$ free acces to the stock- free download of 30 items  per month and a personal thank you  poster. 
    • Website Credit and Digital Certificate
  •   30 available       1500$,Specialist, we can grow up for you a young high quality specialist in domain you need in 2-3 years , everything depends on their skills and their desire to get a nice Job and also Website Credit and Digital Certificate 
  •  10 available       10000$  Special  option for Special Sponsor , joining us  for a period of 2-weeks to one month  including the flight to Moldova ,when you can  contribute to studying  process and also you are getting  tourist trip all over  our  beautiful  country.Also you are getting Free access to our stock ,website credits and a digital certificate.
    • Website Credit and Digital Certificate


Our Mission

1. We aim to offer opportunities for a better future to teenagers from underprivileged families, who will be able to create their future by developing and applying useful skills and enhance their self-esteem when studying programming, graphic design photography, and other digital arts.

2. We want to raise awareness of the world to tackle and approach the problems of those in need. We all can change, all you need is a little creativity. We aim to inspire people, create new job opportunities, convince people to contribute in solving social problems and more important treating each and every person as an individual.

3. We aim to develop as much talents as we can because:

Not everyone can become a great artist; but a great artist *can* come from *anywhere*

Who are the people behind Free Children  and How did UNPics (pilot project )start off?

The Free Children was founded by two students Dmitri Potapov and Alexander Gubin back in 2014. 

Dmitri Potapov:

“All my life I tried to be as correct as possible from moral and ethical point of view, by being a straight edger, vegetarian and practicing professional sports for almost 14 years. Besides that, I’m a graffiti artist and graphic painter and I’m truly passionate about taking pictures on film cameras. One day I asked myself: “Who am I?” . In that moment I understood that I’m the guy who has “enough to have a heart” and who believes in one thing: Helping those who need us most. 

Alex Gubin 


“Initially I just wanted to make great photos and share them around the world. We talked about volunteering and I thought it would be a great idea to go somewhere extreme and take pictures of people out there, hear out their stories. I ended up volunteering in India for 3 month, where I was teaching photography to teenagers from underprivileged families. 

The idea of sharing the knowledge and love for art is global and everyone deserves to have a chance. That’s why I think Free Children is a great project. I’m a photographer, who managed to win several international awards, by believing that each of us can “Find what we love and let it kill us”. I believe we all have what it takes to change to world, so why not to do it?”


Risks & Challenges

The risks attached to the project are minimal.We already found a place where the school will activate. Also, there is a plan of the study program for a year and a half which includes partnerships with companies of Programming and Design who are offering us volunteers as teachers.
The only main risk we were considering, is the finance of the project. If we do not manage to get the amount needed for the entire project to be launched, we will begin the program with the computer science, design and illustration. If the working process will be successful, we will continue trying to attract more founds for investing in photography and stock platform.
   
 Our challenges are: 

  • Rising enough founds for launching the entire educational project.
  • Creating as many studying places as it possible.
  • To provide fully equipped classes, in order students to learn in practice
  • Develop and promote the stock platform.
  • Expand the studding classes, by building attachments to the building, for which we already have authorisation.
  • Introduce volunteer teachers from outside of Moldova who can bring a different learning schemes, and offer a different experience for students

Contribute in other ways

  • 1  Contribute! - a great place to start is to buy one of our awesome perks. Scroll up to find out more!
  • 2  Join our Fb page -  share ideas, brainstorm, and collaborate around new projects.
  • 3  Refer Friends – an make repost  on your FB wall and also you will get a postcar from us.
  • 4  Create and Share Digital Content - we will encouraging authors with some special  presents
  • 5  Put Posters up in Your Community – contact us on FB and we are going to sent it to you, print the posters out and put them up in your local coffee shops, universities, colleges, schools, and elsewhere!
  • 6  Remember, if you have questions, be sure to join our pilot project  Community
  • 7  In case you want to get involve and donate us useful equipment of money funds, you can always contact us  directly on https://www.facebook.com/UNPICSorg?ref=hl
  • 8  Please don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools

How do we know this Free Children will be successful? All of those children had  a hard life  and they want to get a better future and they are ready to work hard on it. This process takes into growth of a different generation,  we expect to get great results  in the next five years, changing the problem of education system .

What payment methods do you accept? We accept major credit cards.

Can I donate from outside the USA? Absolutely!

When will my perk  be delivered? We are currently estimating shipping in august-november 2015.

I love what you are doing! How can I help? Great question! Go and see the 8 ways in which you can help, all listed above.

Is shipping included in the perks? Yes.

Can I help in some other way. How do I get in touch with you? Please email eam@unpics.org our Dir. Community who can discuss this further with you.
